en: Extremist Rebels Launch Deadly Attack in Northeast Nigeria
ny: Anthu Oukira Boma Oopsa Anayamba Kuukira Kumpoto-Kum'mawa kwa Nigeria

en: Islamic extremist rebels have killed at least seven people in an attack in northeast Borno state in Nigeria, witnesses told The Associated Press on Wednesday.
ny: Anthu opanduka achisilamu apha anthu osachepera asanu ndi awiri pa chigawenga kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa dziko la Borno ku Nigeria, mboni zinauza Associated Press Lachitatu.

en: The rebels attacked Kautukari village in the Chibok area of Borno on Tuesday evening, said residents. The attack happened at the same time that U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres was in the state to meet with survivors of jihadi violence.
ny: Anthu a m'dera la Chibok ku Borno, omwe ndi dera la Kautukari, anaukira zigawengazo pa Lachiwiri madzulo, malinga ndi anthu a m'derali.

en: The Chibok area is 115 kilometers (71 miles) away from Maiduguri, the state capital, where Guterres met with former militants being reintegrated into society and thousands of people displaced by the insurgency.
ny: Dera la Chibok lili pamtunda wa makilomita 115 kuchokera ku Maiduguri, likulu la boma, kumene Guterres anakumana ndi anthu omwe kale anali zigawenga ndipo anthu masauzande ambiri anathawa kwawo chifukwa cha zigawenga.

en: "They came in large number with superior firepower (and) took over the community," said Hassan Chibok, a community leader. Troops from a nearby military base were deployed to repel the attack but "the damage had been done," Chibok said, adding that "casualties are up to 10."
ny: "Iwo anabwera ambiri ndi mphamvu zapamwamba za mfuti (ndipo) anatenga derali", anatero Hassan Chibok, mtsogoleri wa derali.

en: Another resident Yana Galang said at least seven people were killed in the latest violence before the Nigerian military intervened.
ny: Munthu wina wa m'derali, Yana Galang, ananena kuti anthu osachepera 7 anaphedwa m'chiwawa chaposachedwapa asilikali a ku Nigeria asanachitepo kanthu.

en: Nigerian police did not immediately respond to a request for confirmation of the attack.
ny: Apolisi a ku Nigeria sanayankhe mwamsanga pempho loti atsimikizire kuti chigawengachi chinachitika.

en: Nigeria, Africa's most populous country with 206 million people, continues to grapple with a 10-year-old insurgency in the northeast by Islamic extremist rebels of Boko Haram and its offshoot, the Islamic State West Africa Province. The extremists are fighting to establish Shariah law and to stop Western education.
ny: Nigeria, dziko lokhala ndi anthu ambiri ku Africa ndi anthu 206 miliyoni, likupitirizabe kulimbana ndi kupanduka kwa zaka 10 kumpoto chakum'mawa ndi zigawenga zachi Islamist za Boko Haram ndi nthambi yake, Province of West Africa ya Islamic State.

en: More than 35,000 people have died and millions have been displaced by the extremist violence, according to the U.N. Development Program.
ny: Malinga ndi zimene bungwe la United Nations Development Programme linanena, anthu oposa 35,000 afa ndipo anthu mamiliyoni ambiri asamuka pakhomo chifukwa cha chiwawa cha zigawenga.

en: Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari said earlier this week that the war against the extremists is "approaching its conclusion," citing continued military airstrikes and the mass defection of thousands of the fighters, some of whom analysts say are laying down their arms because of infighting within the jihadi group.
ny: Pulezidenti wa Nigeria, Muhammadu Buhari, adati koyambirira kwa sabata ino kuti nkhondo yolimbana ndi zigawenga "ikuyandikira mapeto ake", ponena za kupitiriza kwa asilikali ndi anthu ambiri omwe akuchoka m'gululi, omwe akatswiri ena amati akupereka zida zawo chifukwa cha nkhondo mkati mwa gulu la jihad.

en: The violence, however, continues in border communities and areas closer to the Lake Chad region, the stronghold of the Islamic State-linked group, ISWAP.
ny: Komabe, chiwawa chikupitirizabe m'madera okhala m'malire ndi m'madera oyandikana ndi dera la Nyanja ya Chad, malo achitetezo a gulu la ISWAP.

en: "Things are getting worse" in Kautukari village in Chibok and adjourning areas closer to the forest, said community leader Chibok, saying the extremists' presence near the forest is a contributing factor.
ny: "Zinthu zikuipiraipira" m'mudzi wa Kautukari ku Chibok ndi madera ena oyandikana ndi nkhalango, mtsogoleri wa gululi Chibok anati, ponena kuti kupezeka kwa zigawenga pafupi ndi nkhalango ndi chinthu chochititsa chidwi.

en: Reporting Under Attack in South Sudan, Sudan
ny: Kufotokoza za Kuukira ku South Sudan, Sudan

en: Journalists in both Sudan and South Sudan say threats, intimidation and arbitrary arrests are part of everyday life, limiting their ability to inform the public.
ny: Atolankhani ku Sudan ndi South Sudan akuti kuopseza, kuopseza ndi kumangidwa mwaufulu ndi mbali ya moyo wa tsiku ndi tsiku, zomwe zimachepetsa luso lawo lofotokozera anthu.

en: South Sudan ranks 128th and Sudan ranks 151st out of 180 countries in Reporters Without Borders annual World Press Freedom Index, released Tuesday to coincide with the United Nations annual recognition of World Press Freedom Day. The bigger the number, the worse the environment for news media.
ny: Dziko la South Sudan lili pa nambala ya 128 ndipo dziko la Sudan lili pa nambala ya 151 pa mayiko 180 omwe ali mu lipoti la Reporters Without Borders la World Press Freedom Index, lomwe linatulutsidwa Lachiwiri kuti lizigwirizana ndi mwambo wa United Nations wokumbukira Tsiku la Ufulu wa Atolankhani Padziko Lonse.

en: Irene Ayaa of the Association for Media Development in South Sudan says government censorship in her country is widespread.
ny: Irene Ayaa wa Association for Media Development ku South Sudan akuti boma likuletsa anthu ambiri kuonera nkhani m'dziko lake.

en: "Last month, we registered four articles removed from newspapers," she said.
ny: Iye anati: "Mwezi watha, tinalembetsa nkhani zinayi zimene zinachotsedwa m'manyuzipepala".

en: Between January and March alone, security personnel removed dozens of articles from the Juba Monitor, Anna Namiriano, editor-in-chief of an English-language daily, told South Sudan in Focus. "They removed stories and we left the space blank. They say why we are not listening to them, so on 17th of March, they suspended the newspaper."
ny: Pakati pa Januware ndi Marichi okha, ogwira ntchito zachitetezo adachotsa zolemba zambiri kuchokera ku Juba Monitor, Anna Namiriano, mkonzi wamkulu wa nyuzipepala yachingerezi, adauza South Sudan mu Focus. "Iwo adachotsa nkhani ndipo tidasiya malo opanda kanthu. Iwo akuti chifukwa chake sitiwamvera, kotero pa Marichi 17 adaimitsa nyuzipepalayo".

en: In February, a handful of journalists were briefly detained for covering a press conference by opposition lawmakers in parliament. A Juba Monitor newspaper article about the incident was removed by security agents at the printing plant.
ny: Mu February, atolankhani angapo anamangidwa kwa kanthawi chifukwa chofotokoza msonkhano wa atolankhani ndi aphungu otsutsa m'boma. Nkhani ya nyuzipepala ya Juba Monitor yokhudza chochitikachi inachotsedwa ndi apolisi a m'chipinda chosindikizira.

en: "We dont have freedom of the press in the country," Namiriano said. "The solution is let us do our work as media houses. We have the code of conduct, we have the media law to guide us, and removal of stories is really very bad."
ny: Namiriano anati: "Tilibe ufulu wa atolankhani m'dziko muno. Njira yothetsera vutoli ndi yoti tizitha kugwira ntchito yathu monga nyumba zofalitsa nkhani. Tili ndi malamulo a khalidwe, tili ndi malamulo a atolankhani otilamulira, ndipo kuchotsa nkhani n'koipa kwambiri".

en: South Sudans information minister, Michael Makuei, insists press freedom is alive and well in his country.
ny: Nduna ya za Chidziŵitso ku South Sudan, Michael Makuei, inatsimikiza kuti ufulu wa atolankhani uli wamoyo ndi wabwino m'dziko lake.

en: "South Sudan is the only place where journalists are free, where they enjoy absolute freedom according to the law. I say, 'according to the law,' because there is nothing absolute in this world," Makuei told South Sudan in Focus.
ny: "Dziko la South Sudan ndi lokhalo limene atolankhani ali ndi ufulu, ndipo ali ndi ufulu wonse malinga ndi lamulo. Ndikunena kuti'malinga ndi lamulo,' chifukwa palibe chinthu chilichonse chotsimikizika padziko lapansili", akutero Makuei ku South Sudan in Focus.

en: The United Nations Commission on Human Rights refutes that assertion. In a report issued last October, it said the government is harassing activists, journalists and their families, limiting their activities and targeting their work and finances. South Sudan is one of the most dangerous places in the world to be a journalist, according to the commission.
ny: Bungwe la United Nations Commission on Human Rights linatsutsa zimenezi.M' lipoti lomwe linatulutsidwa mu Okutobala chaka chatha, linati boma likuvutitsa anthu ogwira ntchito, atolankhani ndi mabanja awo, kuchepetsa ntchito zawo komanso kutsata ntchito ndi ndalama zawo.M'dziko la South Sudan muli malo ena owopsa kwambiri padziko lonse lapansi kuti akhale mtolankhani, malinga ndi komitiyi.

en: "South Sudan has a lot of work to do to establish and solidify the institutions that are critical to a well-functioning democratic state," David Renz, charge daffaires for the U.S. Embassy in South Sudan, said in a statement Tuesday, adding that the U.S. remains deeply concerned about the state of press freedom in South Sudan.
ny: "South Sudan ili ndi ntchito yambiri yoti ichite kukhazikitsa ndi kulimbikitsa mabungwe omwe ndi ofunikira kuti boma la demokalase liziyenda bwino", David Renz, woyang'anira ntchito za nthambi za US ku South Sudan, adati m'mawu Lachiwiri, ndikuwonjezera kuti US ikupitilizabe kuda nkhawa kwambiri ndi ufulu wa atolankhani ku South Sudan.

en: "We have seen some of the local radio stations shut down over very trivial matters," Renz said. "And we also are aware that journalists of radio and television and even social media are self-censored" and wary of local and national governments actions "to penalize journalists who say things the government would prefer that they not say."
ny: Renz anati: "Tinaona kuti mawailesi ena a m'deralo atsekedwa chifukwa cha zinthu zazing'ono kwambiri. "Ndipo tikudziwanso kuti atolankhani a pa wailesi ndi pa wailesi yakanema ndiponso ngakhale pa Intaneti amadziletsa okha" ndipo amapewa zimene maboma a m'deralo ndi a m'mayiko ena amachita "kuti apereke chilango kwa atolankhani amene amanena zinthu zimene boma silifuna kuti anene".

en: Further complications from coup
ny: Zovuta zina zimene zinachitika chifukwa cha kuphulika kwa boma

en: In Sudan, journalists in the capital city of Khartoum say harassment and threats have increased since the October 25 military takeover.
ny: Ku Sudan, atolankhani a ku likulu la Khartoum akuti kuzunzidwa ndi kuopseza kwawonjezeka kuyambira pamene asilikali anagonjetsa dzikoli pa October 25.

en: Shoggi Abdulazeem, an investigative journalist in Sudan, said he received a death threat in November and was warned not to speak to international media.
ny: Shoggi Abdulazeem, mtolankhani wofufuza ku Sudan, adati adalandira chiwopsezo cha imfa mu Novembala ndipo adachenjezedwa kuti asalankhule ndi atolankhani apadziko lonse.

en: "I was hosting live on Al Jazeera and after leaving their office, eight armed security men followed me in a pickup. They surrounded my car," Abdulazeem said. He told South Sudan in Focus he was blindfolded and moved around "for more than two hours" and was ordered "not to criticize the military again."
ny: "Ndinali kuchititsa moyo pa Al Jazeera ndipo atangochoka ku ofesi yawo, amuna asanu ndi atatu ankhondo ananditsatira m'galimoto. Anandizungulira galimoto yanga", adatero Abdulazeem. Iye anauza South Sudan kuti anali ndi maso opindika ndipo adayenda "kwa maola oposa awiri" ndipo adalamulidwa "kuti asadzayankhulenso za asitikali".

en: Covering pro-democracy protests in Sudan continues to be a dangerous endeavor, Abdulazeem said.
ny: Abu Abdullahzeem anati kuphimba zionetsero za demokalase ku Sudan kukupitirizabe kukhala ntchito yoopsa.

en: "Many newspapers, TV channels and radio stations received directives not to host or conduct interviews with some named individuals" who criticize military leaders, Abdulazeem said. He added, "There are intelligence officers who are assigned to monitor this situation."
ny: "Manyuzipepala ambiri, ma TV ndi ma wailesi analandira malangizo oti asamachite nawo misonkhano kapena kuchita zokambirana ndi anthu ena otchulidwa" omwe amatsutsa atsogoleri a asilikali, adatero Abdulazeem. Iye anawonjezera kuti, "Pali apolisi azinsinsi omwe apatsidwa ntchito yowunika mkhalidwewu".

en: Aisha Assamani, an executive member of the independent Sudanese Media Network, told South Sudan in Focus he has recorded more than 10 attacks on journalists and media houses since last year's coup.
ny: Aisha Assamani, membala wamkulu wa bungwe la Independent Sudanese Media Network, anauza South Sudan mu Focus kuti walembapo za ziwopsezo zoposa 10 pa atolankhani ndi nyumba zofalitsa nkhani kuyambira pamene boma linagonjetsedwa chaka chatha.

en: "They are targeting freedom of speech with so much excessive force," Assamani said. "The majority of our journalists now are fearful and their lives are in danger. Most of them remain anonymous due to the danger of the situation."
ny: "Akupha ufulu wa kulankhula ndi mphamvu zochuluka kwambiri", Assamani anati. "Nthawi ino atolankhani athu ambiri akuopa ndipo miyoyo yawo ili pangozi. Ambiri mwa iwo amakhalabe osadziwika chifukwa cha ngozi ya mkhalidwewo".

en: On December 30, Sudanese security forces stormed the offices of three television stations — al-Arabiya, al-Hadath and al-Sharq — firing tear gas, assaulting staff and destroying broadcast equipment, according to local news media. That same day, security forces detained al-Sharq correspondents Maha Al-Talb and Sally Othman for hours before releasing them.
ny: Pa December 30, magulu a chitetezo ku Sudan adalowa m'maofesi a ma TV atatu  al-Arabiya, al-Hadath ndi al-Sharq  kuphulitsa mpweya wolira, kuukira ogwira ntchito ndikuwononga zida zofalitsa, malinga ndi atolankhani akumaloko. Tsiku lomwelo, magulu a chitetezo adasunga olemba nkhani a al-Sharq Maha Al-Talb ndi Sally Othman kwa maola angapo asanawatulutse.

en: On January 16, Sudanese authorities withdrew the broadcast license of Al Jazeera Live and closed its office in Khartoum. A letter from the Information Ministry to the director of Al Jazeera television in Sudan attributed the closing to an "unprofessional approach" and media content that "harmed the countrys higher interests and national security." The Doha-based network condemned the closure.
ny: Pa Januware 16, akuluakulu aku Sudan adachotsa chilolezo chofalitsa Al Jazeera Live ndikutseka ofesi yake ku Khartoum. Kalata yochokera ku Unduna wa Zidziwitso kwa director wa Al Jazeera TV ku Sudan idalemba kutseka kwa "njira yosakhala yaukadaulo" komanso nkhani zapa media zomwe "zidavulaza zofuna zapamwamba za dzikoli komanso chitetezo chadziko lonse".

en: In February, Sudanese authorities arrested a group of BBC reporters in Khartoum and questioned them for several hours before releasing them.
ny: Mu February, akuluakulu a dziko la Sudan anamanga gulu la atolankhani a BBC ku Khartoum ndipo anawafunsa mafunso kwa maola angapo asanawatulutse.

en: VOA repeatedly called Sudans government for comment, but those calls — to Brigadier General Attahir Abu Haja, press advisor to military leader Abdul Fattah al-Burhan — went unanswered.
ny: A VOA anaitana mobwerezabwereza boma la Sudan kuti lipereke ndemanga, koma mafoniwo kwa Brigadier General Attahir Abu Haja, mlangizi wa atolankhani kwa mtsogoleri wa asilikali Abdul Fattah al-Burhan sanayankhidwe.

en: Michael Atit reported from Khartoum, Sudan; Deng Ghai Deng and Manyang David Mayar reported from Juba, South Sudan.
ny: Michael Atit anafotokoza kuchokera ku Khartoum, Sudan; Deng Ghai Deng ndi Manyang David Mayar anafotokoza kuchokera ku Juba, South Sudan.

en: At Least 30 Burundian AU Soldiers Killed in Al-Shabab Attack, Official Says
ny: Asilikali a Burundi osachepera 30 a AU anaphedwa pa kuukira kwa Al-Shabab, atero akuluakulu a boma

en: At least 30 Burundian soldiers were killed and 20 others injured in Tuesday's attack by al-Shabab militants on an African Union base in southern Somalia, according to a Burundian official.
ny: Asilikali a Burundi osachepera 30 anaphedwa ndipo ena 20 anavulala pa tsiku la Lachiwiri m'kuukira kwa zigawenga za al-Shabab pa malo a African Union kumwera kwa Somalia, malinga ndi mkulu wina wa dziko la Burundi.

en: The official, who requested anonymity because he is not allowed to speak to media, told VOA Somali that 10 soldiers died on the spot, and the rest of the soldiers succumbed to their wounds. He confirmed that other soldiers are still missing.
ny: Mkuluyo, yemwe anapempha kuti asadziwike chifukwa sanaloledwe kulankhula ndi atolankhani, anauza Voice of America Somali kuti asilikali 10 anafa pamalowo, ndipo asilikali ena onse anafa chifukwa cha zilonda zawo.

en: Al-Shabab said it killed 173 soldiers in the attack on the AU base in the village of El-Baraf, about 150 kilometers north of Mogadishu. The casualty figure has not been independently verified. A separate source told VOA Somali that 161 soldiers were at the camp at the time of attack. The Burundian official confirmed that number.
ny: Al-Shabab inati inapha asilikali 173 pomenya nkhondo pa malo a AU m'mudzi wa El-Baraf, pafupifupi makilomita 150 kumpoto kwa Mogadishu. Chiwerengero cha anthu omwe anaphedwa sichinavomerezedwe payekha.

en: The Burundian official told VOA Somali that the soldiers had intelligence al-Shabab was gathering in a nearby village about 48 hours prior to the attack. He said the soldiers prepared to defend themselves and dug trenches.
ny: Mkulu wa Burundi anauza Voice of America Somali kuti asilikali anali ndi zinsinsi al-Shabab anali kusonkhanitsa m'mudzi wapafupi pafupifupi maola 48 asanachitike chiwopsezocho.

en: He said what caught the soldiers by surprise was the enormity of al-Shabab explosives detonated at the camp. He said the militants used three truck bombs, one of which fell into a ditch. He estimated the militants detonated about 20 kilograms of explosives, and that 450 militants overran the camp.
ny: Iye anati chimene chinadabwitsa asilikali chinali kuchuluka kwa zinthu zophulika za al-Shabab zomwe zinaphulika mumsasawo. Iye anati zigawengazo zinagwiritsa ntchito mabomba atatu, imodzi mwazomwe zinagwa m'dzenje. Iye akuti zigawengazo zinaphulika pafupifupi makilogalamu 20 a zinthu zophulika, ndipo zigawenga 450 zinagunda msasawo.

en: The official said the suicide truck bombs caused most of the casualties.
ny: Ofesiyo inati anthu ambiri anafa chifukwa cha mabomba a galimoto yodzipha.

en: Earlier, the government of Burundi reported 10 of their soldiers were killed, with five others missing and 25 injured. Burundi also said 20 al-Shabab militants were killed in the attack.
ny: Poyamba, boma la Burundi linati asilikali 10 a dziko la Burundi anaphedwa, ena asanu akuphedwa ndipo 25 anavulala.

en: On Twitter, Burundi President Evariste Ndayishimiye said there are no words strong enough to condemn the terrorist attack against the Burundian contingent. He wrote, "I join with all of Africa which has just lost sons and daughters … to console the hard-hit families."
ny: Pa Twitter, Purezidenti wa Burundi Evariste Ndayishimiye adanena kuti palibe mawu olimba okwanira kutsutsa chiwopsezo cha zigawenga motsutsana ndi gulu la Burundi. Iye analemba kuti, "Ndikuyanjana ndi Africa yonse yomwe yataya ana aamuna ndi aakazi... kuti atonthoze mabanja omwe akhudzidwa kwambiri".

en: The African Union, the Somali government and the embassy of the United States in Mogadishu have all strongly condemned the al-Shabab attack.
ny: A African Union, boma la Somalia ndi ofesi ya kazembe wa United States ku Mogadishu onse anatsutsa mwamphamvu kuukira kwa al-Shabab.

en: AU chief Moussa Faki Mahamat paid tribute to the Burundian soldiers killed, and said the "heinous" attack will not lessen support of AU forces to Somalia.
ny: Mtsogoleri wa AU Moussa Faki Mahamat anapereka ulemu kwa asilikali a Burundi omwe anaphedwa, ndipo anati chiwopsezo "chankhanza" sichidzachepetsa thandizo la magulu a AU ku Somalia.

en: The Somali ministry of foreign affairs called on the international community to increase and provide higher-end capability to Somali security forces and AU forces so they can effectively combat terrorism in Somalia.
ny: Unduna wa Zakunja wa Somalia wapempha mayiko ena kuti awonjezere ndi kupereka mphamvu zapamwamba kwa magulu a chitetezo a Somalia ndi magulu a AU kuti athe kulimbana ndi uchigawenga ku Somalia.

en: The U.S. embassy in Mogadishu said the U.S. extends condolences to the families of the troops killed and wished a quick recovery to those injured.
ny: Kazembe wa US ku Mogadishu wanena kuti US ikupereka zifundo kwa mabanja a asilikali omwe anaphedwa ndipo ikufuna kuti anthu ovulala achire mwamsanga.

en: The Mayor of El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, told VOA that Tuesday's fighting at the camp was the heaviest the area has seen.
ny: Meya wa mzinda wa El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, anauza mawu a AMERIKA kuti nkhondo za Lachiwiri m'ndendeyi zinali zoopsa kwambiri m'derali.

en: "Fighting like this never happened in this area," he said, explaining that the violence also killed two civilians and injured 10 others. "It was heavy fighting."
ny: Iye anati: "M'derali simunapezeke nkhondo ngati imeneyi", ndipo anafotokoza kuti nkhondoyi inapha anthu aŵiri ndipo inavulaza anthu ena 10. "Zinali zovuta kwambiri".

en: The incident marked the first major al-Shabab attack on AU forces since the mission changed its name and operational structures last month.
ny: Zimene zinachitikazi ndi zoyamba za al-Shabab kuukira asilikali a AU kuyambira pamene ntchitoyi inasintha dzina lake ndi maofesi ake mwezi watha.

en: The U.N. Security Council, which authorized the new mission called the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia, gave it a mandate to reduce the threat posed by al-Shabab, support the capacity building of Somali security forces, and conduct a phased handover of security responsibilities to the Somali government. The mission's mandate runs through the end of 2024.
ny: Bungwe la UN Security Council, lomwe linavomereza ntchito yatsopano yotchedwa African Union Transition Mission ku Somalia, linapereka udindo wochepetsera chiwopsezo chomwe al-Shabab akuyikira, kuthandizira kukhazikitsidwa kwa mphamvu za chitetezo cha Somalia, ndikuchita kusamutsa kwapang'onopang'ono kwaudindo wa chitetezo ku boma la Somalia. Ntchito ya ntchitoyi ikupita kumapeto kwa 2024.

en: This story comes from VOA's Somali and Central African services.
ny: Nkhaniyi imachokera ku mautumiki a Voice of America a ku Somalia ndi Central Africa.

en: Kenya Trains Domestic Workers in Middle East About Rights
ny: Kenya Imaphunzitsa Ogwira Ntchito Kunyumba ku Middle East za Ufulu

en: Kenyan authorities are training domestic workers who accept jobs in the Middle East about their rights after years of reported abuses there, including beatings, rapes and deaths.
ny: Akuluakulu a dziko la Kenya akuphunzitsa antchito apanyumba amene amalandira ntchito ku Middle East za ufulu wawo pambuyo pa zaka zambiri za kuphwanya malamulo kumene kunanenedwa, kuphatikizapo kumenyedwa, kugwiriridwa ndi imfa.

en: It's been a year since Bernard Njenga learned his wife, Esther Thuku, had died in Saudi Arabia, where she had been a domestic worker for three years.
ny: Patha chaka kuchokera pamene Bernard Njenga anadziwa kuti mkazi wake, Esther Thuku, anamwalira ku Saudi Arabia, kumene anali atagwira ntchito zapakhomo kwa zaka zitatu.

en: Saudi authorities reported that his wife had committed suicide at her employer's home, Njenga said, but he believes the mother of four was murdered.
ny: Akuluakulu a ku Saudi Arabia anena kuti mkazi wake anadzipha kunyumba ya abwana ake, adatero Njenga, koma akukhulupirira kuti mayi wa ana anayi anaphedwa.

en: Njenga said his wife's body did not have any marks that would show that she had hanged herself. It appeared the body had been buried because it was very dirty and looked like she had been stabbed on the left side, he added.
ny: Njenga adanena kuti thupi la mkazi wake silinali ndi zizindikiro zilizonse zomwe zikusonyeza kuti adadzipachika. Zikuwoneka kuti mtembowo udaikidwa m'manda chifukwa unali wonyansa kwambiri ndipo ukuwoneka ngati waponyedwa kumanzere, adawonjezera.

en: Kenyan authorities say that since November, at least 23 domestic workers have died while working in the Middle East. Most of those deaths occurred in Saudi Arabia, according to labor officials.
ny: Akuluakulu a dziko la Kenya amanena kuti kuyambira mu November, anthu 23 ogwira ntchito zapakhomo anafa pa nthawi imene ankagwira ntchito ku Middle East. Malinga ndi zimene akuluakulu a ntchito ananena, ambiri mwa anthu amenewa anafa ku Saudi Arabia.

en: Saudi authorities have reported that all 23 of those deaths resulted from cardiac arrest.
ny: Akuluakulu a ku Saudi Arabia anena kuti anthu onse 23 amene anafa ndi a mtima womwe unachititsa kuti anthuwa afe.

en: In April of 2020, rights advocacy group Amnesty International reported that Kenyans who have jobs as domestic workers in the Middle East often complain of lack of payment, forced labor, physical abuse, rape and dangerous working conditions.
ny: Mu April 2020, gulu loteteza ufulu wa anthu la Amnesty International linati anthu a ku Kenya omwe ali ndi ntchito monga antchito apanyumba ku Middle East nthawi zambiri amadandaula za kusowa malipiro, ntchito yakukakamizidwa, kuzunzidwa, kugwiriridwa komanso zinthu zoopsa zogwirira ntchito.

en: Now, Kenya is offering safety training for domestic workers who take jobs abroad.
ny: Tsopano, Kenya ikupereka maphunziro a chitetezo kwa antchito apanyumba amene amapita kudziko lina.

en: "When you don't train them, basically, you are exposing them to a lot of exploitation and abuse," said Edith Murogo, director at East Africa Institute of Homecare Management in Nairobi. "Part of the training also includes labor rights awareness. They have to know how to bargain and talk to employees about decent terms and conditions of employment."
ny: "Munthu amene sakuwaphunzitsa, kwenikweni amawazunza kwambiri", anatero Edith Murogo, mkulu wa East Africa Institute of Homecare Management ku Nairobi. "Mbali ya maphunzirowo imaphatikizapo kudziŵa za ufulu wa antchito. Iwo ayenera kudziwa mmene angagulitsire ndi kulankhula ndi antchito awo za ntchito yabwino".

en: An estimated 30,000 Kenyans migrate to the Middle East to find work each year.
ny: Anthu pafupifupi 30,000 a ku Kenya amapita ku Middle East chaka chilichonse kukafuna ntchito.

en: Kenya's cabinet secretary for labor, Simon Chelugui, said his department is working with Saudi officials on labor law reforms.
ny: Mlembi wa ntchito ku Kenya, Simon Chelugui, adati dipatimenti yake ikugwira ntchito ndi akuluakulu a ku Saudi pa kusintha malamulo antchito.

en: "We would want them also to upscale their law to protect workers and employers equally, not to discriminate and have the attitude of the employer is right always," Chelugui said. "Number two is the pay is reasonable and commensurate to the work."
ny: "Tikufuna kuti apititse patsogolo malamulo awo kuti ateteze antchito ndi abwana mofanana, kuti asakhale osankhana mitundu ndipo kuti abwana aziganiza bwino nthawi zonse", anatero Chelugui. "Nambala yachiwiri ndi malipiro abwino komanso ofanana ndi ntchitoyo".

en: VOA reached out to the Saudi embassy in Nairobi for comment on alleged mistreatment and deaths of Kenyan workers. In an email response, the embassy said the kingdom does not condone illegal and ill treatment of anyone and said Riyadh is working with Nairobi to protect citizens from any offense.
ny: A VOA adafikira ku kazembe wa Saudi ku Nairobi kuti adandaule za nkhanza zomwe akuti zikuchitika komanso imfa za ogwira ntchito ku Kenya. Poyankha imelo, kazembeyo adati ufumuwo suvomereza nkhanza kapena nkhanza kwa aliyense ndipo adati Riyadh ikugwira ntchito ndi Nairobi kuti iteteze nzika zake ku zolakwa zilizonse.

en: Meanwhile, officials say with an estimated 2 million young people graduating each year, according to national figures, and only about 800,000 new jobs, many Kenyans will continue to go abroad to find work.
ny: Panthaŵiyi, akuluakulu amanena kuti malinga ndi ziŵerengero za dziko lonse, achinyamata pafupifupi 2 miliyoni amaliza maphunziro awo chaka chilichonse, ndipo ndi ntchito zatsopano pafupifupi 800,000 zokha, anthu ambiri a ku Kenya adzapitirizabe kupita kunja kukafuna ntchito.

en: South Africa Urges Africa’s First COVID-19 Vaccine Plant to Keep Its Doors Open
ny: South Africa Ikulimbikitsa Malo Oyamba Odyera Katemera wa COVID-19 ku Africa Kuti Asatsegule Zipata Zake

en: South African health officials are urging COVID-19 vaccine manufacturer Aspen to keep its plant in the Eastern Cape province open. This follows a Reuters article quoting Aspens senior director saying they may have to shut down as there have been no orders for their rebranded COVID vaccine.
ny: Akuluakulu azaumoyo ku South Africa akulimbikitsa wopanga katemera wa COVID-19 Aspen kuti asunge malo ake opangira katemera ku Eastern Cape. Izi zikutsatira nkhani ya Reuters yomwe idatchula mkulu wa Aspens akuti atha kutseka chifukwa palibe malamulo a katemera wawo wa COVID.

en: A South African-owned subsidiary of pharmaceutical giant Aspen struck a deal with American company Johnson & Johnson in March to package, price, sell and distribute its vaccine in Africa.
ny: Kampani ya kampani ya Aspen ya ku South Africa, yomwe ndi ya kampani yaikulu yopanga mankhwala, inagwirizana ndi kampani ya ku America ya Johnson & Johnson mu March kuti ipake, kugulitsa, kugulitsa ndi kugawira katemera wake ku Africa.

en: This vaccine was rebranded as Aspenovax.
ny: Katemerayu anadzatchedwa Aspenovax.

en: The move was hailed by many as there had been much concern about Africas reliance on imported vaccines which were often costly and at times in short supply.
ny: Anthu ambiri anayamikira zimenezi chifukwa chakuti anthu ambiri ankadera nkhawa kuti Africa ikudalira katemera wochokera kunja, omwe nthawi zambiri anali okwera mtengo ndipo nthawi zina analibe.

en: But there have been no orders for Aspenovax. South Africas National Health Department Spokesperson Foster Mohale said the lack of orders is due to low vaccination rates not only at home, but globally.
ny: Koma palibe malamulo a Aspenovax. Mneneri wa Dipatimenti ya Zaumoyo ku South Africa Foster Mohale adati kusowa kwa malamulowa chifukwa cha kuchuluka kwa katemera osati kunyumba kokha, komanso padziko lonse lapansi.

en: "Vaccine hesitancy is one of the factors which contribute to these low vaccination rates or demand for more vaccines which also affect the production. Because obviously we understand that they are in a business, they cant keep on producing vaccines when they know that the demand for vaccines is very low. So, we understand the situation where they are, and we sympathize with them," he said.
ny: "Kudandaula ndi katemera ndi chimodzi mwazinthu zomwe zimapangitsa kuti katemera azichotsedwa kapena kuti katemera wochulukirapo afunike ndipo zimakhudzanso kupanga. Chifukwa chodziwikiratu kuti timamvetsetsa kuti ali mu bizinesi, sangathe kupitiliza kupanga katemera akadziwa kuti kufunikira katemera ndikotsika kwambiri. Chifukwa chake, timamvetsetsa momwe zinthu zilili, ndipo timawamvera chisoni", adatero.

en: Mohale said for now, South Africa has enough vaccines. He adds that in March, 100,000 vaccines expired. And more are due to expire in June and July.
ny: Mohale adati pakadali pano, South Africa ili ndi katemera wokwanira. Iye akuwonjezera kuti mu Marichi, katemera 100,000 adatha. Ndipo ena akuyenera kutha mu Juni ndi Julayi.

en: However, he said that Aspens vaccine plant is important because no one knows what the future holds.
ny: Komabe, iye anati malo opangira katemera a Aspens ndi ofunika chifukwa palibe amene akudziwa zimene zidzachitike m'tsogolo.

en: "We will try to engage them not to rush their decision precisely because we anticipate especially our scientists, our epidemiologists, we anticipate that the fifth wave might hit the country, South Africa, during the winter season which is a few weeks away from now. As you can see the number of daily COVID-19 patients has been rising for the past seven days," he said.
ny: "Tidzafuna kuwalimbikitsa kuti asamafulumire kusankha chifukwa tikuyembekezera makamaka asayansi athu, akatswiri athu azachipatala, tikuyembekezera kuti chivomezi chachisanu chitha kukhudza dzikoli, South Africa, m'nyengo yozizira yomwe ili pafupi masabata angapo. Monga mukuwonera, kuchuluka kwa odwala tsiku ndi tsiku a COVID-19 kwakhala kukuwonjezeka masiku asanu ndi awiri apitawa", adatero.

en: Professor Petro Terblanche, who is the managing director of South African company, Afrigen, which in a continent-first made an mRNA COVID vaccine using Modernas data — said the situation at Aspen is a tragedy for the industry.
ny: Pulofesa Petro Terblanche, yemwe ndi director wa kampani ya ku South Africa, Afrigen, yomwe idapanga katemera wa mRNA COVID koyamba ku Africa pogwiritsa ntchito deta ya Modernas  adati mkhalidwe ku Aspen ndi tsoka kwa makampani.

en: "This is just indicating again how important it is that this continent looks at policy reform. This is about how are we going to make sure that we give preferential procurement to local companies. How are we going to make sure that we create a marketplace and eco-system that will absorb local capacity? Otherwise, we will not have capacity locally in a sustainable manner and were going to get the next pandemic and we will be unprepared, and we will not have health security," said Terblanche.
ny: "Izi zikungosonyeza kuti ndi zofunika kwambiri kuti dziko lino liyang'ane kusintha kwa mfundo za ndale. Nkhaniyi ndi yokhudza momwe tingaonetsetse kuti timapereka mwayi wopeza zinthu kwa makampani am'deralo. Kodi tingaonetsetse bwanji kuti timapanga msika ndi chilengedwe chomwe chidzachotsa mphamvu zam'deralo? Apo ayi, sitidzakhala ndi mphamvu zam'deralo mwanjira yokhazikika ndipo tikadakhala kuti tikukumana ndi mliri wotsatira ndipo sitidzakhala okonzeka, ndipo sitidzakhala ndi chitetezo chaumoyo", adatero Terblanche.

en: She believes money should also be put into educating people on the importance of vaccines.
ny: Iye amakhulupirira kuti ndalama ziyenera kugwiritsidwanso ntchito pophunzitsa anthu za kufunika kwa katemera.

en: "We need to ensure that we also put effort into advocacy for vaccination. Because we now have 17% of the continent that is vaccinated. We need to get them to at least 40% to ensure that we fully arrest this pandemic," she said.
ny: "Tiyenera kuonetsetsa kuti tikuyesetsanso kulimbikitsa katemera. Chifukwa tsopano tili ndi 17% ya dziko lapansi lomwe ladziwitsidwa. Tiyenera kuwafikitsa osachepera 40% kuti tiwonetsetse kuti tikuletsa mliriwu kwathunthu", adatero.

en: Mohale was unable to say when the Health Department would be meeting with Aspens executives.
ny: Mohale sanathe kunena kuti dipatimenti ya zaumoyo idzakumana liti ndi akuluakulu a Aspens.

en: Journalists in Ethiopia Say Press Freedom is at 'Crossroads'
ny: Atolankhani ku Ethiopia Amanena Kuti Ufulu wa Atolankhani Uli pa 'Msewu Wopapatiza'

en: When Ethiopia's Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed took office four years ago, Reporters Without Borders, a Paris-based group that promotes press freedom, raised Ethiopia's ranking in its international press freedom index by 40 places.
ny: Pamene Prime Minister wa Ethiopia Abiy Ahmed anayamba kugwira ntchito zaka zinayi zapitazo, bungwe la Reporters Without Borders, lomwe lili ku Paris ndipo limalimbikitsa ufulu wa atolankhani, linakweza malo a Ethiopia m'gulu la ufulu wa atolankhani padziko lonse ndi malo 40.

en: It was a giant leap forward after decades of media repression by the state. But since the war between federal government forces and rebels in the Tigray region began in late 2020, Ethiopia has dropped in the rankings.
ny: Chinali chitukuko chachikulu pambuyo pa zaka makumi angapo zozunzidwa ndi boma pa nkhani za atolankhani. Koma kuyambira pomwe nkhondo pakati pa magulu a boma la feduro ndi opanduka kudera la Tigray idayamba kumapeto kwa 2020, Ethiopia yatsikira pamndandanda.

en: To mark World Press Freedom Day 2022, VOA spoke to Ethiopian journalists about how free they feel to carry out their work.
ny: Pochita mwambo wa Tsiku la Ufulu wa Atolankhani Padziko Lonse mu 2022, mawu a AMERIKA analankhula ndi atolankhani a ku Ethiopia za ufulu umene ali nawo pochita ntchito yawo.

en: Elias Meseret, who worked with the Associated Press, told VOA that press freedom in Ethiopia is at a crossroads.
ny: Elias Meseret, yemwe anagwira ntchito ndi Associated Press, anauza VOA kuti ufulu wa atolankhani ku Ethiopia uli pa mphambano.

en: "Overall, I can say that lack of professionalism and also extreme views have become the hallmarks of the state of the media in Ethiopia, at this point in time," Elias said. "For this to change, I think the government has a responsibility to let media professionals do their job freely. This means without any harassment and intimidation."
ny: "Ponseponse, ndinganene kuti kusowa kwa akatswiri komanso malingaliro oopsa akhala zizindikiro za momwe atolankhani alili ku Ethiopia, panthawi ino", adatero Elias. "Kuti izi zisinthe, ndikuganiza kuti boma lili ndi udindo wolola akatswiri azama TV kuchita ntchito yawo momasuka. Izi zikutanthauza popanda kuzunzidwa kapena kuwopseza".

en: Assegid Mulugeta, a radio presenter for the government-owned broadcaster, the Ethiopian Broadcasting Corporation, or EBC, thinks press freedom has improved in recent years. In 2018, the prime minister released all journalists from prison, However, that progress has since been reversed according to Ethiopian journalists, who documented that 46 journalists were detained in the country in 2021, making Ethiopia one of the worst jailers of journalists in Africa.
ny: Assegid Mulugeta, wofalitsa wailesi wa wailesi ya boma, Ethiopian Broadcasting Corporation, kapena EBC, akuganiza kuti ufulu wa atolankhani wawongolera mzaka zaposachedwa. Mu 2018, nduna yayikulu idamasula atolankhani onse m'ndende, Komabe, kupita patsogolo kumeneku kwabwezeretsedwa malinga ndi atolankhani aku Ethiopia, omwe adalemba kuti atolankhani 46 adatsekeredwa mdzikolo mu 2021, ndikupangitsa Ethiopia kukhala m'modzi mwa omwe amaika atolankhani m'ndende zoyipa kwambiri ku Africa.

en: The state-backed Ethiopian Human Rights Commission released a statement Tuesday expressing concern for journalist Gobeze Sisay, whose whereabouts are unknown since plainclothes officers arrested him on Sunday.
ny: Bungwe lothandizidwa ndi boma la Ethiopian Human Rights Commission linatulutsa mawu Lachiwiri posonyeza nkhawa zake za mtolankhani Gobeze Sisay, yemwe malo ake sadziwika chifukwa apolisi ovala zovala za anthu adamugwira Lamlungu.

en: Another journalist, Amir Aman Kiyaro, and his colleague Thomas Engida were arrested in November and released in March. But they still may face years in prison if convicted of violating the country's wartime state of emergency law and anti-terrorism law.
ny: Mtolankhani wina, Amir Aman Kiyaro, ndi mnzake Thomas Engida anamangidwa mu November ndipo anamasulidwa mu March. Koma iwo akhoza kukhalabe m'ndende zaka zambiri ngati atapezeka kuti aphwanya lamulo la dziko la nthawi ya nkhondo la mwadzidzidzi ndi lamulo loletsa uchigawenga.

en: Still, radio presenter Assegid said he sees improvement.
ny: Komabe, woulutsa wailesi Assegid anati akuona kuti zinthu zikuyenda bwino.

en: Under the pre-2018 government where the Tigray People's Liberation Front political party dominated, he said, there were "lots of stifling systems, there was lots of censorship, there was beating of journalists, there was lots of pressures and censorship against journalists and now we are seeing the booming of YouTube and online media … this is a good thing to hear."
ny: M'boma la chaka cha 2018 pomwe chipani cha ndale cha Tigray People's Liberation Front chinali kulamulira, iye anati, panali "machitidwe ambiri opondereza, panali kuletsa zambiri, panali kumenyedwa kwa atolankhani, panali kuletsa zambiri ndi kuletsa atolankhani ndipo tsopano tikuwona kukula kwa YouTube ndi media pa intaneti... izi ndi zabwino kumva".

en: Sisay Sahlu, editor at The Reporter, a private newspaper based in Addis Ababa, said independent media often get stonewalled by the government.
ny: Sisay Sahlu, mkonzi wa nyuzipepala ya The Reporter, yomwe ndi yaumwini ku Addis Ababa, anati atolankhani odziimira okha nthawi zambiri amalamulidwa ndi boma.

en: "My experience and the experience of my friends from public media is totally different," he said. "As a private newspaper employee, it's tough to get information for me."
ny: Iye anati: "Zimene ndimakumana nazo komanso zimene anzanga a m'ma TV ndi anthu ena amachita zimasiyana kwambiri ndi zimene ndimakumana nazo.

en: Sisay said that for a simple story, he might call 10 officials, who all may be unwilling to answer his questions.
ny: Sisay ananena kuti pofuna kufotokoza nkhani yosavuta, angayimbire foni akuluakulu 10 amene onsewo sangafune kuyankha mafunso ake.

en: "When you call them, they don't give us any clue," he said. "We write a letter to them, they are not talking. Finally, when we publish [the story], they are coming to our office. Sometimes they are on the phone and start a verbal fight. Either they are giving us information or not."
ny: Iye anati: "Mukawaimbira foni, sitimadziwa chilichonse. Timawalembera kalata, koma iwo sakulankhula. Pamapeto pake, tikamafalitsa nkhaniyo, amabwera ku ofesi yathu. Nthawi zina amaimbira foni n'kuyamba kukangana.

en: A government spokesman was not immediately available for comment.
ny: Woyankhula ndi boma sanapezeke kuti anenepo kanthu.

en: In the latest World Press Freedom Index, Ethiopia is ranked 114th, down 13 places from its ranking in 2021.
ny: M'gulu laposachedwapa la World Press Freedom Index, Ethiopia ili pa malo a 114, kutsika malo 13 poyerekeza ndi kumene inali mu 2021.

en: Editor's note: The story has been updated with additional information about the arrests of journalists.
ny: Chidziwitso cha mkonzi: Nkhaniyi yasinthidwa ndi zina zokhudza kumangidwa kwa atolankhani.

en: As Tigray Aid Blockade Continues, Nearby Areas Also in Desperate Need of Food, Medicine
ny: Pamene Kuletsa Tigrayi Kuthandiza Kupitirizabe, Madera Apafupi Nawo Akufunikira Chakudya, Mankhwala

en: Despite Ethiopias declared humanitarian cease-fire with Tigrayan rebels, aid groups said they are struggling to get food and medicine to those in need. Even outside the worst affected areas in Tigray, which are off limits to reporters, providing aid is fraught with risks and challenges.
ny: Ngakhale kuti Ethiopia yalengeza kuti yathetsa nkhondo ndi zigawenga za ku Tigray, magulu othandizira anthu akuti akuvutika kupeza chakudya ndi mankhwala kwa anthu omwe akusowa. Ngakhale kunja kwa madera omwe akhudzidwa kwambiri ku Tigray, omwe ali kutali ndi atolankhani, kupereka thandizo kuli ndi zoopsa komanso zovuta.

en: In Ethiopias northern Amhara region, burned tanks and other ruined military equipment lie at the roadside four months after occupying forces of the Tigray Peoples Liberation Front, or TPLF, left the area. As the region recovers from a brutal civil war, the U.N. said some 9.4 million people in the Amhara region and neighboring Afar and Tigray regions need humanitarian assistance. But aid has been slow to arrive.
ny: M'chigawo cha kumpoto kwa Amhara ku Ethiopia, matangi otentha ndi zida zina zankhondo zomwe zawonongeka zili m'mphepete mwa msewu patatha miyezi inayi kuchokera pamene magulu a Tigray People's Liberation Front, kapena TPLF, achoka m'derali. Pamene derali likuchira nkhondo yankhondo yankhanza, UN idati anthu pafupifupi 9.4 miliyoni m'chigawo cha Amhara ndi madera oyandikana nawo a Afar ndi Tigray akufunikira thandizo lachibadwidwe. Koma thandizo lachedwa kufika.

en: Seventeen-year-old Ahmed Nuru was living in the Oromia region, but said he had to flee after facing persecution for his Amhara ethnicity. He lost his mother when he was young. Last year, his father died after being unable to get lifesaving treatment due to the wars impact on the local health care system.
ny: Ahmed Nuru wazaka 17 amakhala ku Oromia region, koma adati adathawa chifukwa chozunzidwa chifukwa cha fuko lake la Amhara. Anatayika amayi ake ali wamng'ono. Chaka chatha, abambo ake anamwalira atasowa chithandizo chifukwa cha nkhondo zomwe zimakhudza dongosolo laumoyo wakomweko.

en: Now, Nuru is left to take care of his sisters, ages 10 and 8. He said life is very difficult and doesnt know how he will be able to raise his sisters.
ny: Tsopano, Nuru akukhala ndi alongo ake a zaka 10 ndi 8. Iye anati moyo ndi wovuta kwambiri ndipo sakudziwa mmene angalerere alongo akewo.

en: Daniel Tigabu, a public health officer based in the camp for the displaced where Ahmed lives, said there is not enough medical equipment or medicine. The center is running out of basic medical kits, as well as a shortage of kits for malaria, hepatitis and HIV testing.
ny: Daniel Tigabu, mkulu wa zaumoyo wa anthu omwe amakhala mumsasa wa anthu omwe akhudzidwa ndi mavuto omwe Ahmed amakhala nawo, adati palibe zida zokwanira zamankhwala kapena mankhwala.

en: Tens of thousands live in camps for the displaced in the Amhara region. Others live in host communities, like Tsgenet Tibebu, who lost her husband during the conflict with the TPLF.
ny: Anthu masauzande ambiri amakhala m'misasa ya anthu othawa kwawo m'dera la Amhara. Ena amakhala m'madera amene akukhala nawo, monga Tsgenet Tibebu, yemwe mwamuna wake anamwalira pa nkhondo ndi TPLF.

en: Tibebu said she and her son rely on what her husbands friends provide as charity, which includes a room to stay in. As tears begin to flow, she said she is a housewife who has nothing and is waiting for support to help her raise her two children. She believes she should pay rent even though the owners have given her a place to stay. She wonders how she can plan for the future when she has nothing.
ny: Tibebu adati iye ndi mwana wake amadalira zomwe abwenzi a amuna ake amapereka ngati chikondi, zomwe zimaphatikizapo chipinda chokhalamo. Pamene misozi ikuyamba kuyenda, adati ndi mayi wanyumba yemwe alibe chilichonse ndipo akuyembekezera thandizo kuti amuthandize kulera ana ake awiri. Amakhulupirira kuti ayenera kulipira lendi ngakhale eni ake adamupatsa malo ogona. Akudabwa momwe angakonzekerere tsogolo pomwe alibe chilichonse.

en: Mulugeta Kebede, an aid worker who works in the Hayk camp, spoke to VOA and said stories like Nurus and Tibebus are not uncommon across Amhara.
ny: Mulugeta Kebede, wogwira ntchito yothandiza anthu amene amagwira ntchito m'ndende ya Hayk, analankhula ndi mawu a ku America ndipo anati nkhani ngati Nurus ndi Tibebus si zachilendo ku Amhara.

en: He said the situation makes aid workers cry day and night. He said if someone is hungry, they cant sleep because they think about their empty stomach. He said he has seen displaced people sell pans or mattresses to surved and added that the situation is at a critical stage.
ny: Iye anati mkhalidwewo umachititsa ogwira ntchito zothandiza anthu kulira usana ndi usiku. Iye anati ngati wina ali ndi njala, sangathe kugona chifukwa amaganiza za mimba yawo yopanda kanthu. Iye anati iye wawona anthu osamuka akugulitsa pans kapena matiresi kuti apulumuke ndipo anawonjezera kuti mkhalidwewo uli m'nthawi yovuta.

en: About 30,000 people displaced by conflict live just north of Hayk, in Weldiya. A local government representative, Habtemariam Assefa, North Wollo Zone spokesperson, said there was a little support shortly after TPLF left, after the area had been a conflict zone for months. But, he said, aid has been distributed only twice since and the aid provided by the U.N. or the federal government is not enough.
ny: Anthu pafupifupi 30,000 omwe asamuka chifukwa cha nkhondo amakhala kumpoto kwa Hayk, ku Weldiya. Woimira boma la m'deralo, Habtemariam Assefa, mneneri wa North Wollo Zone, adati panali thandizo pang'ono TPLF itangochoka, pambuyo poti derali lakhala malo osokoneza bongo kwa miyezi ingapo. Koma, adati, thandizo lagawidwa kawiri kokha kuyambira pamenepo ndipo thandizo lomwe limaperekedwa ndi UN kapena boma la feduro silokwanira.

en: North of the Amhara region, in Tigray where journalists are banned from entering, the U.N. said the situation is worse, with famine-like conditions. Tigray is under a de facto humanitarian blockade, according to the U.N.
ny: Kumpoto kwa dera la Amhara, ku Tigray kumene atolankhani saloledwa kulowa, UN yati zinthu zafika poipa kwambiri, ndipo zinthu zikufanana ndi njala.

en: For now, all Ahmed Nuru and his sisters can do is try to scrape by and hope more assistance arrives soon.
ny: Pakadali pano, zonse zimene Ahmed Nuru ndi alongo ake angachite ndi kuyesa kupulumuka ndi kuyembekezera kuti thandizo lina lidzafika posachedwa.

en: State Group Investigates Video Allegedly Showing Abuse by Ethiopian Army
ny: Gulu la Boma likufufuza za kanema yemwe akuti akuwonetsa nkhanza za asitikali a Ethiopia

en: The Ethiopian Human Rights Commission is investigating a video shared online that appears to show government troops abusing and shooting an ethnic Tigrayan boy.
ny: Komiti ya ufulu wa anthu ku Ethiopia ikufufuza za kanema wofalitsidwa pa intaneti womwe ukuonetsa asilikali a boma akuzunza ndi kupha mnyamata wa mtundu wa Tigrayan.

en: The four-minute video shows an alleged ethnic Tigray teenager being surrounded by men in Ethiopian army uniforms. The forces are seen abusing the boy, who they refer to as being from Abbi Adi, a location in the northern Tigray region of Ethiopia.
ny: Kanemayo wa mphindi zinayi akuwonetsa mnyamata wina wa fuko la Tigray akuzunguliridwa ndi amuna ovala yunifolomu ya asilikali a Ethiopia.

en: In response to a query from VOA, the state-run Human Rights Commission said it was "gathering information regarding the incident."
ny: Poyankha funso la mawu a America, bungwe la boma la Human Rights Commission linati "likupeza zambiri zokhudza nkhaniyi".

en: In the video, the boy, with blood on his face, is seen sitting while the men in uniform surround him and threaten him with death. One of the men in uniforms calls for the boy to suffer rather than being killed immediately.
ny: M'vidiyoyi, mnyamatayo, wokhala ndi magazi pankhope, akuoneka atakhala pansi pamene amuna ovala yunifolomu akum'zinga ndi kumuwopseza kuti amupha.

en: They tell a teenage girl to forcefully feed the boy. Finally, one man steps forward and shoots the boy, and the video ends.
ny: Kenako munthu wina akupita patsogolo n'kum'wombera ndipo vidiyoyo yatha.

en: VOA cannot independently verify the location of the incident or the identities of the individuals in the footage. Asked about the video, both the Ethiopian government communication minister and Ethiopian ministry of defense spokesperson declined to comment.
ny: A VOA sangathe kutsimikizira mosadalira malo omwe zidachitika kapena mayina a anthu omwe ali pa kanema. Atafunsidwa za kanema, onse a Minister of Communications a boma la Ethiopia komanso mneneri wa Ministry of Defense wa Ethiopia anakana kuyankha.

en: A similar incident was reported by rights groups in January 2021 in which Ethiopian army members were seen executing a number of civilians in Mahibere Dego, in central Tigray.
ny: Gulu loteteza ufulu wa anthu linalengeza za chochitika chofanana mu Januware 2021 pomwe anthu a asilikali a Ethiopia adawonedwa akupha anthu ambiri ku Mahibere Dego, ku Central Tigray.

en: Rights group Amnesty International has verified the killing of 11 civilians in that incident.
ny: Gulu loona za ufulu wa anthu la Amnesty International linatsimikizira kuti anthu 11 anafa pa ngoziyi.

en: Forces from the rebel Tigray People's Liberation Front also have been accused of committing human rights violations. In February 2022, Amnesty International reported that TPLF forces and their affiliates have killed more than a dozen people and gang raped women in towns of the Amhara region they occupied.
ny: Gulu la zigawenga la Tigray People's Liberation Front ladzudzulidwa kuti laphwanya ufulu wa anthu. Mu February 2022, Amnesty International inanena kuti magulu a TPLF ndi omwe adawagwirizana nawo apha anthu opitilira khumi ndi awiri ndikuzunza akazi m'matauni a dera la Amhara omwe adawagwira.

en: The Ethiopian Human Rights Commission recently reported that more than 740 civilians were killed in the Tigray war between July 2021 and March 2022.
ny: Komiti ya ufulu wa anthu ku Ethiopia posachedwapa inanena kuti anthu oposa 740 anaphedwa pankhondo ya ku Tigray pakati pa July 2021 ndi March 2022.

en: Both the government and the TPLF deny accusations of rights violations, saying their operations do not target civilians.
ny: Boma ndi TPLF amakana milandu yozunza ufulu wa anthu ponena kuti ntchito zawo sizikulimbana ndi anthu wamba.

en: Disinformation, Censorship, Trigger Global Retreat of Press Freedom
ny: Kuchita Zinthu Zosokoneza Chidziŵitso, Kuika Chitsulo, Kuyambitsa Kuchepa kwa Ufulu wa Atolankhani Padziko Lonse

en: Led by the Kremlin's example, a global rise in disinformation and propaganda is having a disastrous effect on independent news around the world, a new report finds.
ny: Lipoti latsopano linanena kuti, kutsogoleredwa ndi chitsanzo cha Kremlin, kuwonjezeka kwa chidziŵitso cholakwika ndi propaganda padziko lonse kukuyambitsa mavuto aakulu pa nkhani za nkhani za m'dziko lonse.

en: In its 2022 World Press Freedom Index released Tuesday, the Paris-based Reporters Without Borders (RSF) said Russia's invasion of Ukraine has contributed vastly to the spread of fake news and propaganda.
ny: M'kalata yake ya World Press Freedom Index ya 2022 yomwe idatulutsidwa Lachiwiri, bungwe la Reporters Without Borders (RSF) lochokera ku Paris linanena kuti kulowa kwa Russia ku Ukraine kwathandiza kwambiri kufalitsa nkhani zabodza ndi propaganda.

en: The journalism watchdog group said its findings are worrying, as they show deep divisions among media within countries and between countries at the international level.
ny: Gulu loyang'anira nkhani za atolankhani linati zomwe zapezazi ndizovuta, chifukwa zikuwonetsa magawano akuya pakati pa atolankhani m'maiko ndi pakati pa mayiko padziko lonse lapansi.

en: "In 2022, it's really undeniable that media polarization and information chaos are really fueling social divisions in ways that are pretty new," said Clayton Weimers, deputy director of RSF for the United States, told VOA. He said the prevalence of partisan news around the world has come at the expense of authentic journalism.
ny: "Mu 2022, ndizosatsutsika kuti kuundana kwa atolankhani ndi chisokonezo chazidziwitso zikulimbikitsa magawano pagulu m'njira zatsopano", adatero Clayton Weimers, wachiwiri kwa mkulu wa RSF ku United States, kwa Voice of America. Iye adati kufalikira kwa nkhani zapa chipani padziko lonse lapansi kwabwera chifukwa cha ntchito yolemba nkhani yeniyeni.

en: The group's annual report ranks 180 countries based on the environment for independent journalism. This year, however, RSF said it used a new method that blends each country's political, legal, economic, sociocultural and security conditions.
ny: Lipoti la pachaka la gululi limaika mayiko 180 m'malo malinga ndi malo omwe anthu ambiri amagwirira ntchito pa nkhani ya nkhani zaumishonale. Komabe, chaka chino, RSF inati inagwiritsa ntchito njira yatsopano imene imaphatikiza zochitika za ndale, malamulo, chuma, chikhalidwe ndi chitetezo m'mayiko onse.

en: Now, the index classifies a record 28 countries as "having very bad media freedom." That group includes China, which is exporting censorship beyond its borders while also amplifying the Kremlin's propaganda on Russia's devastating war against Ukraine.
ny: Tsopano, indexyo imaika mbiri ya mayiko 28 monga "amene ali ndi ufulu woipa kwambiri wa atolankhani". Gulu limenelo limaphatikizapo China, yomwe ikugulitsa chindapusa kunja kwa malire ake pamene ikuwonjezera chiphunzitso cha Kremlin pa nkhondo yowononga ya Russia yolimbana ndi Ukraine.

en: Russia, China among worst
ny: Russia, China pakati pa oipa

en: Since its invasion of Ukraine on February 24, Russia has sought total control over news coverage, passing a new law that carries 15-year prison terms for reporting "false news" on the military, and even forbids calling the conflict a "war."
ny: Kuyambira pamene inaloŵa mu Ukraine pa February 24, Russia yafuna kulamulira nkhani zonse, ndipo inapereka lamulo latsopano limene limalamula kuti anthu amene amafalitsa "nkhani zabodza" zokhudza asilikali akhale m'ndende zaka 15, ndipo ngakhale limaletsa kuti nkhondoyo ikhale "nkhondo".

en: That has forced most remaining independent news outlets, including the renowned Novaya Gazeta newspaper, Ekho Moskvy radio and Dozhd TV, to shut down or move outside Russia to continue operating.
ny: Zimenezi zakakamiza mabungwe ambiri otsala a nkhani, kuphatikizapo nyuzipepala yotchuka yotchedwa Novaya Gazeta, wailesi ya Ekho Moskvy ndi Dozhd TV, kuti atseke kapena kusamukira kunja kwa Russia kuti apitirize kugwira ntchito.

en: With independent voices absent, experts say, the Russian government has been able to flood state-run airwaves with propaganda that downplays the war and spreads false or misleading justifications for the Kremlin's invasion.
ny: Akatswiri amanena kuti, popeza palibe anthu amene angalankhulepo, boma la Russia lakwanitsa kuika nkhani za m'mawailesi a boma m'madzi n'cholinga choti lizichepetsa nkhondoyo komanso kufalitsa zifukwa zonama kapena zosokoneza zimene zingathandize kuti boma la Kremlin lichite zinthu zosemphana ndi zimene anthu amakhulupirira.

en: Russia's media repression stands at 155 out of 180 countries included in RSF's index, where one is the most free and 180 the least.
ny: Kuukira kwa atolankhani ku Russia kuli pa mayiko 155 pa mayiko 180 omwe ali m'gulu la RSF, kumene mmodzi ndi womasuka kwambiri ndipo 180 ndi osavuta.

en: "It's safe to say at this point that the free press is a thing of the past in Russia," Clayton said.
ny: Clayton anati: "Palibe vuto kunena kuti ufulu wa atolankhani ndi chinthu cha m'mbuyomu ku Russia".

en: Throughout Russian President Vladimir Putin's 22 years in power, Moscow has been targeting journalists and the independent press, he said.
ny: M'zaka 22 zonse zimene Pulezidenti Vladimir Putin wa ku Russia wakhala pa ulamuliro, Moscow yakhala ikulimbana ndi atolankhani ndi atolankhani odziimira okha, adatero.

en: "But since the invasion of Ukraine, it seems that Putin has really finished off the independent media once and for all in Russia," Clayton said. "At this point, it is impossible to accurately report on the war in Ukraine."
ny: Clayton anati: "Koma kuchokera pamene dziko la Ukraine linaloŵedwa, zikuoneka kuti Putin wathetsa nkhani za ufulu wa anthu ku Russia", ndipo "panopa n'zosatheka kufotokoza molondola za nkhondo ya ku Ukraine".

en: China ranked 175th in the new report. And now that it is firmly under Beijing's influence, Hong Kong also registered a dramatic decline, ranking 148th out of 180 following a lengthy series of raids and arrests that shuttered pro-democracy news sites.
ny: China inali pa malo a 175 mu lipoti latsopanoli. Ndipo tsopano popeza ili pansi pa mphamvu ya Beijing, Hong Kong nayonso inachepha kwambiri, ikukhala pa malo a 148 pa 180 pambuyo pa kufufuza kwa nthawi yaitali ndi kumangidwa komwe kunatseka malo oteteza demokalase.

en: RSF's country file on China says it is the world's biggest jailer of journalists, with 120 in detention. The regime uses coercion, harassment, intimidation and surveillance to keep independent and foreign journalists from reporting on issues deemed "sensitive."
ny: M'mbiri ya RSF yofotokoza za China, akuti ndi boma lalikulu kwambiri padziko lonse la ndende la atolankhani, lomwe lili ndi anthu 120 omwe ali m'ndende. Boma la Russia limagwiritsa ntchito kukakamiza, kuzunza, kuwopseza ndi kuyang'anira kuti asatulutse nkhani za atolankhani odziimira okha komanso akunja zomwe zimaonedwa kuti ndi "zofunikira".

en: "President Xi Jinping, in power since 2013, has restored a media culture worthy of the Maoist era, in which freely accessing information has become a crime and to provide information an even greater crime," RSF's country file states.
ny: "Purezidenti Xi Jinping, yemwe wakhala paudindo kuyambira 2013, wabwezeretsa chikhalidwe cha atolankhani choyenera nyengo ya Maoist, pomwe kupeza kwaulere chidziwitso kwakhala mlandu ndipo kupereka chidziwitso ndi mlandu waukulu kwambiri", akutero fayilo ya RSF.

en: Rising authoritarianism
ny: Kuwonjezeka kwa ulamuliro wankhanza

en: North Korea remains the worst country in the rankings at 180th. Elsewhere in the Asia-Pacific region, political turmoil, conflict and rising authoritarianism have wiped out years of progress.
ny: Dziko la North Korea likadali dziko loipa kwambiri m'gululi pa malo a 180. Kumadera ena a m'chigawo cha Asia-Pacific, mikangano ya ndale, mikangano ndi ulamuliro wolamulira ulamuliro umene ukuwonjezeka zawononga zaka zambiri za kupita patsogolo.

en: The 2021 coup in Myanmar marked a 10-year setback for media rights, with journalists detained, media licenses revoked, and many news outlets returning to exile. Under the military junta, Myanmar, ranking 176th, is one of the world's biggest jailers of journalists.
ny: Kuphulika kwa boma kwa 2021 ku Myanmar kunathetsa ufulu wa atolankhani kwa zaka 10, pomwe atolankhani adamangidwa, ziphaso za atolankhani zidachotsedwa, ndipo atolankhani ambiri adabwerera kudziko lakwawo.

en: In Afghanistan, the Taliban insurgents pledged to uphold press freedom when they took power in August 2021. Instead, RSF said the "Taliban's seizure of power has further worsened conditions for reporters and news organizations, who are the targets of all forms of intimidation and violence." Afghanistan ranked 154th.
ny: Ku Afghanistan, zigawenga za Taliban zidalonjeza kuti zidzalimbikitsa ufulu wa atolankhani pomwe adalowa pampando mu Ogasiti 2021. M'malo mwake, RSF idati "kugwidwa kwa mphamvu ndi Taliban kwapangitsa kuti zinthu ziipire olemba nkhani ndi mabungwe azamauthenga, omwe ndi omwe akuwopsezedwa ndi ziwawa zamtundu uliwonse". Afghanistan idakhala nambala 154.

en: Across Africa, laws criminalizing online journalism have dealt a new blow to the right to information, RSF said, while the spread of rumors, propaganda, and disinformation has contributed to undermine access to quality information.
ny: Ku Africa konse, malamulo oletsa ntchito yolemba nkhani pa intaneti achititsa kuti ufulu wa anthu ukhale woipa kwambiri, RSF inati, pomwe kufalikira kwa mphekesera, propaganda, ndi chidziwitso cholakwika kwachititsa kuti anthu asapeze chidziwitso chabwino.

en: In Ethiopia, the war in the Tigray region, with its communication blackouts and restricted access, were the main factors that placed the country 114 on the index. Neighboring Eritrea and Djibouti are far worse, ranking near the bottom at 179 and 164, respectively.
ny: Ku Ethiopia, nkhondo m'dera la Tigray, ndi kuzimitsidwa kwa mauthenga ndi kuchepa kwa mwayi, ndizo zinthu zazikulu zomwe zinapangitsa dzikoli kukhala 114 pa index.

en: African media continue to struggle economically, RSF said it its accompanying analysis.
ny: RSF inati atolankhani a ku Africa akupitirizabe kuvutika pa nkhani zachuma, zomwe zikuwatsogolera.

en: "Despite a wave of liberalization in the 1990s, there are still, too often, cases of arbitrary censorship, especially on the internet, with occasional network shutdowns in some countries, arrests of journalists and violent attacks," the group said.
ny: Bungweli linati: "Ngakhale kuti m'ma 1990 anthu ambiri ankasintha zinthu, nthawi zambiri anthu ankachita zinthu zosonyeza kuti ankafuna kuti anthu azichita zinthu mosaganizira zimene akufuna, makamaka pa Intaneti.

en: Clayton said the rising authoritarianism feeds on itself.
ny: Clayton ananena kuti ulamuliro wolamulira ulamuliro umene ukuwonjezeka umadzidyetsa wekha.

en: "When we allow a culture of impunity to exist where authoritarians are allowed to go after journalists, harass them, arrest them, beat them in the streets and kill them, it has a knock-on effect," he said. "It emboldens that same authoritarian to do it again next time, and it emboldens other authoritarians who are watching to do the same."
ny: Iye anati: "Tikalola kuti anthu amene ali ndi ulamuliro akhale ndi chikhalidwe chosalola kuti anthu azivutika, kuzunza, kumanga, kumenya ndi kupha atolankhani, zimenezi zimakhudza kwambiri anthu amene ali ndi ulamulirowo".

en: US not perfect
ny: Ife sitiri angwiro

en: After a period of seeing its media attacked as "fake news" by former President Donald Trump, the United States retained a relatively high ranking of 42 in RSF's index. That is largely thanks to the return of regular White House and federal agency press briefings.
ny: Pambuyo pa nthawi yomwe atolankhani ake adatsutsidwa ngati "nkhani zabodza" ndi Purezidenti wakale a Donald Trump, United States idasunga malo apamwamba kwambiri a 42 mu index ya RSF. Izi zimatheka makamaka chifukwa cha kubwerera kwa White House ndi mabungwe aboma.

en: But RSF said problems persist, including "the disappearance of local newspapers, the systematic polarization of the media, and the erosion of journalism by digital platforms amid a climate of animosity and aggression toward journalists, among others."
ny: Koma RSF inati mavutowo akupitirirabe, kuphatikizapo "kuzimiririka kwa nyuzipepala zakomweko, kugawikana kwa njira za atolankhani, ndi kuwonongeka kwa ntchito ya atolankhani ndi nsanja za digito pakati pa nyengo ya udani ndi chiwawa kwa atolankhani, pakati pa ena".

en: Barriers exist, for instance, when it comes to covering state governments and protests.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, pali zopinga pamene zikufunika kuletsa maboma a m'madera ena komanso zionetsero.

en: "We typically find that this is either due to just a blatant disregard for the laws governing open records or meetings, or they're simply misinterpreting them. An individual is misinterpreting whether a journalist can be present at a particular event," said Beth Francesco, senior director of the National Press Club Journalism Institute.
ny: "Timaona kuti zimenezi zimachitika chifukwa chakuti anthu amangoona kuti malamulo amene amalamulira nkhani zotseguka kapena misonkhano ndi osayenera, kapena amangomasulira molakwika nkhaniyo. Munthu wina akumasulira molakwika ngati mtolankhani angathe kupezeka pa mwambo winawake", anatero Beth Francesco, mkulu wa bungwe la National Press Club Journalism Institute.

en: A few bright spots
ny: Malo ena owala

en: Despite an overall trend of decline, Clayton said there are positives.
ny: Ngakhale kuti anthu ambiri akuchepa, Clayton ananena kuti pali zinthu zabwino.

en: Some governments provide funding for news media without interfering in their operations, to ensure independence from political influence.
ny: Maboma ena amapereka ndalama zothandizira atolankhani popanda kusokoneza ntchito zawo, pofuna kuonetsetsa kuti sizimakhudzidwa ndi ndale.

en: "If you look at the top of our list, some of the things that stand out are these are countries that have robust public funding for media," he said, noting that "it's always important to separate state funding for media and state-controlled media."
ny: "Ngati muyang'ana pamwamba pa mndandanda wathu, zina mwa zinthu zomwe zimawonekera ndi izi ndi mayiko omwe ali ndi ndalama zolimba zoyendetsera atolankhani", adatero, ndipo adazindikira kuti "ndizofunikira nthawi zonse kupatula ndalama zoyendetsedwa ndi boma ndi zoyendetsedwa ndi boma".

en: Three Scandinavian countries — Norway, Denmark and Sweden — respectively come at the top of RSF's index. Estonia, a former Soviet Union republic, ranked 4th.
ny: Dziko la Scandinavia limodzi ndi dziko la Norway, Denmark ndi Sweden, ndi dziko la Estonia, lomwe kale linali dziko la Soviet Union, linakhala pa malo a 4.

en: RSF said the free exercise of journalism plays a major role in emerging democracies such as East Timor, ranked 17, Bhutan, ranked 33, and Mongolia, ranked 90.
ny: RSF inati ufulu wochita zofalitsa nkhani umakhala ndi gawo lalikulu m'mafuko otchuka monga East Timor, pa malo 17, Bhutan, pa malo 33, ndi Mongolia, pa malo 90.

en: East Timor was one country whose ranking skyrocketed, rising 54 places. But RSF cautioned that because of its change in methodology this year, "care should be taken when comparing the 2022 rankings and scores with those from 2021."
ny: Dziko la East Timor linali limodzi mwa mayiko omwe malo ake adakulira kwambiri, kukwera malo 54. Koma RSF idachenjeza kuti chifukwa cha kusintha kwa njira zake chaka chino, "kuyenera kusamala poyerekeza malo ndi ziwerengero za 2022 ndi za 2021. "

en: UN’s Guterres Meets with Nigerian Leaders After Visiting Volatile Borno State
ny: UN  Guterres Akumana ndi Atsogoleri a Nigeria Atachezera Boma la Borno

en: U.N. Secretary General Antonio Guterres met with Nigerian leaders Wednesday at the end of a two-day visit to Nigeria and three-nation trip to Africa. On Tuesday, he visited internally displaced people (IDPs) in northeast Nigeria and called for them to be safely returned to their homes. Nigerian authorities plan to close all IDP camps in the next few years despite security concerns.  Antonio Guterres arrived the United Nations house in Abuja around 9 a.m. Wednesday and met with U.N. local coordinators before holding talks with Nigerian womens representatives.
ny: Mlembi wamkulu wa UN Antonio Guterres adakumana ndi atsogoleri aku Nigeria Lachitatu kumapeto kwa ulendo wamasiku awiri ku Nigeria komanso ulendo wa mayiko atatu ku Africa. Lachiwiri, adachezera anthu omwe akusowa pokhala kwawo kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa Nigeria ndikuwalimbikitsa kuti abwerere kwawo. Akuluakulu aku Nigeria akufuna kutseka misasa yonse ya anthu omwe athawa kwawo m'zaka zingapo zikubwerazi ngakhale pali nkhawa zachitetezo. Antonio Guterres adafika kunyumba ya United Nations ku Abuja mozungulira 9 koloko m'mawa Lachitatu ndikukumana ndi oyang'anira aku United Nations asanayambe kukambirana ndi oimira azimayi aku Nigeria.

en: The delegates, led by Nigeria's minister for womens affairs, Pauline Kedem Tallen, discussed gender equality and the inclusion of women in politics with the U.N. secretary-general.
ny: Oimirawo, motsogozedwa ndi nduna ya Nigeria yoona za akazi, Pauline Kedem Tallen, anakambirana ndi mlembi wamkulu wa bungwe la United Nations za kufanana kwa amuna ndi akazi komanso kuika akazi m'ndale.

en: "His coming to Nigeria today has given us hope, because we know that he will lend his voice to all the issues affecting women, gender-based violence, early marriage, lack of implementation of some of our laws," said Tallen.
ny: "Kubwera kwake ku Nigeria lero kwatidalitsa chiyembekezo, chifukwa tikudziwa kuti adzalankhula pa nkhani zonse zokhudza akazi, chiwawa cha amuna kapena akazi, ukwati wa msinkhu wa pasadakhale, kusatsatira malamulo athu ena", adatero Tallen.

en: Guterres afterwards met with Nigeria's religious leaders and later attended a wreath-laying ceremony at the U.N. house to remember the 23 people killed during the 2011 bombing of the building.
ny: Pambuyo pake, Guterres anakumana ndi atsogoleri achipembedzo a ku Nigeria ndipo pambuyo pake anapita ku mwambo wokhazikitsa korona ku nyumba ya UN kukakumbukira anthu 23 omwe anaphedwa pa kuphulika kwa bomba mu 2011.

en: He began his three-nation Africa visit Sunday in Senegal as part of his Ramadan solidarity tour, and later went to Niger.
ny: Anayamba ulendo wake wopita ku Africa ku mayiko atatu Lamlungu ku Senegal monga gawo la ulendo wake wa Ramadan, ndipo kenako anapita ku Niger.

en: On Tuesday, he visited northeastern Borno state and met with the state governor as well as IDPs and families impacted by the Boko Haram conflict.
ny: Lachiwiri, anapita kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa dziko la Borno ndipo anakumana ndi bwanamkubwa wa boma komanso anthu omwe anathawa kwawo komanso mabanja omwe akhudzidwa ndi nkhondo ya Boko Haram.

en: Guterres also visited repentant Boko Haram fighters and praised authorities' reintegration program for more than 1,000 former fighters.
ny: Guterres anapitanso kukaona anthu omwe analapa m'ntchito zawo za Boko Haram ndipo anayamikira ntchito imene akuluakulu a boma anagwira yothandiza anthu oposa 1,000 omwe anali m'ntchito zawo.

en: He also commended authorities efforts to resettle displaced people back to their communities and called for more support to rebuild the region.  "The Borno that I found today is the Borno of hope, the Borno with future and I was very impressed to see the policy that is being deployed here, recognizing that you don't fight terrorism just by military means, you fight terrorism addressing the root causes of terrorism," he said. "The people that I met today in the IDP camps want to go back home in safety and dignity. The way to address terrorism effectively is to provide not only hope but a future of reality."
ny: Anayamikiranso zoyesayesa za akuluakulu a boma zokhazikitsira anthu omwe asamuka kwawo kumadera awo ndipo adapempha thandizo lowonjezereka kuti amange derali. "Borno yomwe ndapeza lero ndi Borno ya chiyembekezo, Borno wokhala ndi tsogolo ndipo ndinasangalatsidwa kwambiri kuwona mfundo zomwe zikuchitika pano, ndikuzindikira kuti simukumenya nkhondo ndi uchigawenga kudzera munkhondo zokha, mumenya nkhondo ndi uchigawenga pothana ndi zoyambitsa za uchigawenga", adatero. "Anthu omwe ndidakumana nawo lero m'misasa ya anthu omwe asamuka kwawo akufuna kubwerera kwawo ali otetezeka komanso olemekezeka. Njira yothetsera uchigawenga bwino si kungopereka chiyembekezo koma tsogolo lenileni".

en: Nigerian authorities have been closing IDP camps since late last year and want to close all camps by 2026. More than 2 million people have been displaced from their homes since the start of the Boko Haram insurgency in 2009.
ny: Akuluakulu a ku Nigeria akhala akutseka misasa ya anthu othawa kwawo kuyambira kumapeto kwa chaka chatha ndipo akufuna kutseka misasa yonse pofika 2026. Anthu oposa 2 miliyoni asamuka m'nyumba zawo kuyambira pamene gulu la Boko Haram linayamba mu 2009.

en: But aid groups have been warning some communities may still be attacked.
ny: Koma magulu othandiza anthu akhala akuchenjeza kuti madera ena angawonongedwebe.

en: "There are multiple solutions when it comes to resettlement. We need to get people stabilized," said Adenike Oladosu, a climate justice activist, met with the U.N. secretary-general. "Climate change is leading to the rise of armed conflicts affecting people in the region and around and the need for us to see that we have more climate action and not always military action."
ny: "Pali njira zambiri zothetsera mavutowa. Tiyenera kukhazikitsa anthu", anatero Adenike Oladosu, yemwe ndi wochita za chilungamo cha nyengo, atakumana ndi mlembi wamkulu wa bungwe la United Nations. "Kusintha kwa nyengo kukuchititsa kuti nkhondo zankhondo zikhale zowonjezereka m'derali komanso m'madera ena, ndipo tikufunika kuonetsetsa kuti tikuchita zinthu zambiri zothandiza pa nkhani ya nyengo osati nthawi zonse kuchita zinthu zankhondo".

en: The U.N. secretary-general ended his visit at the Abuja presidential village, where he met with President Muhammadu Buhari and his top Cabinet members.
ny: Mlembi wamkulu wa bungwe la United Nations anamaliza ulendo wake ku Abuja, komwe anakumana ndi Pulezidenti Muhammadu Buhari ndi akuluakulu a nduna zake.

en: Al-Shabab Raids African Union Military Base
ny: Al-Shabab Yathira Mfuti pa Malo Ankhondo a African Union

en: Al-Shabab fighters stormed an African Union military base in the village of El-Baraf in Somalias Middle Shabelle region early Tuesday, local officials and security sources say.
ny: Al-Shabab alonda anaukira msasa wa asilikali a African Union m'mudzi wa El-Baraf m'chigawo cha Middle Shabelle ku Somalia m'maŵa wa Lachiwiri, malinga ndi akuluakulu a m'deralo komanso magwero a chitetezo.

en: Officials told VOA Somali that the militants briefly seized the base before withdrawing from it. State media said Burundian solders at the base repulsed the attack.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma anauza Voice of America Somali kuti zigawengazo zinalanda pang'ono malowa asanawachotse.

en: "The Federal Government of Somalia condemns in the strongest possible terms the heinous attack targeting the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia forward operating base in Elbaraf, Middle Shabelle," the Somali Ministry of Foreign Affairs posted on its official Facebook page.
ny: "Boma la Federal la Somalia limatsutsa mwamphamvu kwambiri chiwopsezo choopsa choukira gulu la African Union Transition Mission ku Somalia ku Elbaraf, Middle Shabelle", Ministry of Foreign Affairs ya Somalia inachita pa tsamba lake la Facebook.

en: "We extend our deepest condolences to the victims of this terrorist attack and their families."
ny: "Tikuwauza anthu amene anavulala ndi zigawenga zimenezi ndiponso mabanja awo kuti tikuwachitira chifundo kwambiri".

en: The Mayor of El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, said the militants started their attack with two suicide truck bombs. He said the militants then fought their way onto the base.
ny: Meya wa El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, adati zigawengazo zidayamba kuwukira ndi mabomba awiri odzipha.

en: Al-Shabab claimed the killing of 173 African Union forces. The group also claimed responsibility for capturing AU forces as prisoners-of-war. Both claims could not be independently verified. AU force headquarters and Somali military officials could not be immediately reached for comment.
ny: Al-Shabab adati apha asilikali a African Union 173. Gululi linaperekanso udindo wogwira asilikali a AU ngati akaidi ankhondo. Zilengezo zonsezi sizinathe kutsimikiziridwa payekha.

en: In an interview with VOA, Muhumed, who was not at the village at the time of the attack, said he was told there were "many deaths" among Burundian forces but could not give an exact figure.
ny: Poyankha mawu a mawu a ku America, Muhumed, yemwe analibe m'mudziwo panthawi ya chigawengacho, ananena kuti anauzidwa kuti panali "anthu ambiri omwe anafa" pakati pa asilikali a Burundi koma sanathe kupereka chiwerengero chenicheni.

en: "Fighting like this never happened in this area," he said. "It was heavy fighting."
ny: Iye anati: "M'derali simunapezeke nkhondo ngati imeneyi.

en: He said two civilians were also killed and more than 10 others injured.
ny: Iye anati anthu awiri aphedwa ndipo anthu ena oposa 10 anavulala.

en: Muhumed confirmed to VOA that al-Shabab militants withdrew from the base. He also reported airstrikes targeting the militants as they left the base but did not say who was responsible for the strikes.
ny: Muhumed adavomereza ku Voice of America kuti zigawenga za al-Shabab zidatuluka m'malo omenyera nkhondo. Ananenanso za kuwukira kwa ndege komwe kunatsogolera zigawengazo pomwe zidatuluka m'malo omenyera nkhondo koma sananene kuti ndi ndani amene anali ndi mlandu.

en: El-Baraf, approximately 150 kilometers north of Mogadishu, is one of the forward operating bases of African Union forces from Burundi.
ny: El-Baraf, pafupifupi makilomita 150 kumpoto kwa Mogadishu, ndi amodzi mwa malo opangira zida za African Union zochokera ku Burundi.

en: The incident marked the first major al-Shabab attack on AU forces since the mission changed its name and operational structures last month.
