ny: Zimene zinachitikazi ndi zoyamba za al-Shabab kuukira asilikali a AU kuyambira pamene ntchitoyi inasintha dzina lake ndi maofesi ake mwezi watha.

en: The U.N. Security Council, which authorized the new mission called the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia (ATMIS), gives it a mandate to reduce the threat posed by al-Shabab, support the capacity-building of Somali security forces, and conduct a phased handover of security responsibilities to Somalia. The mission has until the end of 2024 to operate in the country.
ny: Bungwe la UN Security Council, lomwe lidapatsa chilolezo ntchito yatsopano yotchedwa African Union Transition Mission ku Somalia (ATMIS), limapatsa ntchito yochepetsera chiwopsezo chomwe al-Shabab akuyikira, kuthandizira kukhazikitsa mphamvu za chitetezo cha Somalia, ndikuchita kusamutsa kwapang'onopang'ono kwa chitetezo ku Somalia. Ntchitoyi ili ndi mpaka kumapeto kwa 2024 kuti igwire ntchito mdzikolo.

en: India’s Muslims Mark Eid al-Fitr Amid Community Violence
ny: Asilamu a ku India Akuchita Chikondwerero cha Eid al-Fitr Pamphepete mwa Chiwawa cha M'dera Lonse

en: Muslims across India marked Eid al-Fitr on Tuesday by offering prayers outside mosques, even as the celebrations this year came in the backdrop of a series of recent attacks against the community during the month of Ramadan.
ny: Asilamu ku India onse anakondwerera Eid al-Fitr Lachiwiri mwa kupereka mapemphero kunja kwa misikiti, ngakhale kuti zikondwerero chaka chino zinachitika chifukwa cha ziwopsezo zingapo zomwe zachitika posachedwapa motsutsana ndi anthu ammudzi m'mwezi wa Ramadan.

en: "We will not have the same kind of festivity" this time, said Mohammad Habeeb ur Rehman, a civil engineer in Indias financial capital, Mumbai. "This is the most painful Eid with worst memories for Indian Muslims."
ny: "Sitidzakhala ndi chikondwerero chofanana" nthaŵi ino, anatero Mohammad Habeeb ur Rehman, injiniya wa zomangamanga ku likulu la ndalama la India, Mumbai. "Ichi ndi Eid yoŵaŵa kwambiri ndi kukumbukira koipa kwambiri kwa Asilamu a ku India".

en: Anti-Muslim sentiment and attacks have surged across the country in the last month, including stone throwing between Hindu and Muslim groups during religious processions and subsequent demolitions of a number of properties mostly belonging to Muslims by authorities.
ny: Mwezi watha, anthu ambiri m'dzikoli akhala akudziwa kuti Asilamu ndi amene amawaukira. Anthuwa akuponya miyala pakati pa magulu a Ahindu ndi Asilamu pa nthawi ya mapwando achipembedzo komanso akuluakulu a boma akuwononga nyumba zambiri za Asilamu.

en: The community, which makes up 14% of Indias 1.4 billion population, is reeling from vilification by hard-line Hindu nationalists who have long espoused an anti-Muslim stance. Some leaders of Indias ruling Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party have tacitly supported the violence, while Prime Minister Narendra Modi has so far been silent about it. Eid al-Fitr is typically marked with communal prayers, celebratory gatherings around festive meals and new clothes, but celebrations in India for the past two years have been marred by COVID-19 restrictions.
ny: Anthu a m'derali, omwe ndi 14% mwa anthu a ku India 1.4 biliyoni, akuvutika ndi kunyozedwa ndi anthu a mtundu wa Hindu omwe akhala akudziwa zambiri za chipembedzo cha Muslim. Atsogoleri ena a Indian Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party omwe akulamulira India athandizira mwachinsinsi zachiwawachi, pomwe Prime Minister Narendra Modi adakhala chete mpaka pano. Eid al-Fitr nthawi zambiri imakhala ndi mapemphero wamba, misonkhano yokondwerera zakudya zaphwando ndi zovala zatsopano, koma zikondwerero ku India kwa zaka ziwiri zapitazi zakhala zikuwonongedwa ndi zoletsa za COVID-19.

en: In Indian-controlled Kashmir, the Muslim festival has been subdued for the past three years because of an unprecedented military lockdown after India stripped the regions semi-autonomy in 2019, followed by the pandemic. The region also saw a rise in violence during Ramadan, with at least 20 militants, two civilians and five police and soldiers killed.
ny: M'dziko la Kashmir lomwe lili m'manja mwa India, chikondwerero cha Asilamu chachepetsedwa kwa zaka zitatu zapitazi chifukwa cha kutsekedwa kwa asilikali komwe sikunachitikepo pambuyo poti India idachotsa maderawo kukhala ndi ufulu wodzilamulira okha mu 2019, kenako mliriwu.

en: "As we prepare to celebrate Eid, a strong sense of collective loss jars at us," said Bashir Ahmed, a businessman in Srinagar.
ny: "Pamene tikukonzekera kukondwerera Eid, timamva chisoni kwambiri ndi zimene anthu ena achita", anatero Bashir Ahmed, munthu wazamalonda wa ku Srinagar.

en: Kashmir is the Muslim-majority disputed region where a violent insurgency against Indian rule and New Delhis brutal crackdown has raged for over three decades. Tens of thousands of people have died in the conflict.
ny: Kashmir ndi dera lomwe lili ndi anthu ambiri a Asilamu ndipo lakhala likutsutsana ndi anthu ambiri chifukwa cha chiwawa chomwe chachitika kwa zaka zoposa makumi atatu.

en: Meanwhile in the capital, New Delhi, hundreds assembled in the Jama Masjid, one of Indias largest mosques, while offering Eid prayers there for the first time in over two years due to pandemic restrictions. Families came together early on Tuesday morning while many people shared hugs and wishes.
ny: Panthawiyi, ku New Delhi, anthu mazana ambiri anasonkhana ku Jama Masjid, umodzi mwa misikiti yayikulu kwambiri ku India, pomwe ankapemphera Eid kumeneko koyamba mzaka zopitilira ziwiri chifukwa cha zoletsa za mliriwu. Mabanja adasonkhana m'mawa wa Lachiwiri pomwe anthu ambiri adagawana maubwenzi ndi zikhumbo.

en: Beijing Residents Brace for COVID-19 Lockdown
ny: Anthu a ku Beijing Akukonzekera Kutsekedwa kwa COVID-19

en: Unlike Shanghai, Beijing has yet to require that all its residents remain at home to contain the spread of COVID-19. Nevertheless, many people in its Chaoyang district and elsewhere are preparing for that possibility.
ny: Mosiyana ndi Shanghai, Beijing sinathebe kufuna kuti anthu onse okhala m'dzikolo akhale kunyumba kuti athetse kufalikira kwa COVID-19. Komabe, anthu ambiri m'chigawo chake cha Chaoyang ndi kwina kulikonse akukonzekera mwayiwu.

en: On Wednesday, city officials closed 60 subway stations, more than 10% of Beijing's vast system. They did not say when service would be resumed, according to ABC News.
ny: M'mawa wa Lachitatu, akuluakulu a mzindawu anatseka masiteshoni 60 a sitima zapamadzi, omwe ndi oposa 10% a dongosolo lalikulu la Beijing. Iwo sananene kuti utumiki udzayambiranso liti, malinga ndi ABC News.

en: Beijing, a city of 21 million people, has been on high alert for the spread of COVID-19, as restaurants and bars pivot to takeout, gyms close and schools suspend classes indefinitely, according to CNBC.
ny: Beijing, mzinda wokhala ndi anthu 21 miliyoni, wakhala pamalo oopsa chifukwa cha kufalikira kwa COVID-19, pomwe malo odyera ndi mipiringidzo imatsuka, malo ochitira masewera olimbitsa thupi amatseka ndipo masukulu amaimitsa maphunziro mpaka kalekale, malinga ndi CNBC.

en: People who live in "controlled" areas, neighborhoods where cases have been discovered, have been told to stay in the city, and all residents must test for the virus three times throughout the week, according to ABC.
ny: Anthu amene amakhala m'madera "oletsedwa", m'madera omwe anthu apezeka ndi matendawa, akuuzidwa kuti azikhala mumzindawu, ndipo anthu onse ayenera kuyesedwa katatu pa sabata, malinga ndi ABC.

en: Chinese authorities reported 5,489 cases nationwide on Wednesday, of which 4,982 were in Shanghai, which has been under a draconian lockdown for weeks.
ny: Akuluakulu aku China adanenanso za milandu 5,489 mdziko lonse Lachitatu, pomwe 4,982 anali ku Shanghai, yomwe yakhala ikuyimitsidwa kwa milungu ingapo.

en: Beijing reported 46 symptomatic cases and five asymptomatic on Wednesday. The city's total since April 22, what it considers the start of its omicron outbreak, is 544.
ny: Beijing inati pali anthu 46 omwe ali ndi zizindikiro ndipo ena 5 omwe alibe zizindikiro Lachitatu.

en: Mr. Zhang, a Beijing resident, said he had bought extra food and water, even though he doesn't think Beijing will be locked down like Shanghai. He asked that VOA not use his full name because he was afraid of attracting official attention.
ny: Bambo Zhang, wokhala ku Beijing, adati adagula chakudya ndi madzi owonjezera, ngakhale sakuganiza kuti Beijing idzatsekedwa ngati Shanghai. Iye adapempha kuti Voice of America isagwiritse ntchito dzina lake lenileni chifukwa ankaopa kukopa chidwi cha boma.

en: "I have six bags of rice, two bags of noodles, and several boxes of water, instant noodles and (nutritionally dense) biscuits, and I haven't stocked up too much," Zhang told VOA Mandarin in a phone interview last week. He said he bought his groceries online because the supermarket was crowded.
ny: "Ndili ndi matumba asanu ndi limodzi a mpunga, matumba awiri a noodles, ndi mabokosi angapo amadzi, noodles amodzi ndi ma biscuit (olimba kwambiri), ndipo sindinapeze zambiri", adatero Zhang ku Voice of America Mandarin pa foni sabata yatha. Iye adati adagula zakudya zake pa intaneti chifukwa msika waukulu unali wodzaza.

en: Ms. Yao, who lives in the Chaoyang district, told VOA Mandarin that she had been stocking up on necessities since the beginning of this year, after the Ministry of Commerce recommended that everyone do so. She asked that VOA Mandarin not use her full name because she wanted to avoid official retribution.
ny: Mayi Yao, omwe amakhala m'chigawo cha Chaoyang, anauza VOA Mandarin kuti wakhala akupanga zinthu zofunika kuyambira kumayambiriro kwa chaka chino, pambuyo poti Unduna wa Zamalonda udalimbikitsa aliyense kuchita izi. Iye adapempha kuti VOA Mandarin isagwiritse ntchito dzina lake lenileni chifukwa akufuna kupewa kubwezera kwa boma.

en: "I have always maintained a good habit of reserving food. So I have a lot of rice, noodles and oil at home," she said, adding that she figured her family would be fine even if Beijing locked down for a month.
ny: Iye anati: "Nthaŵi zonse ndakhala ndi chizoloŵezi chabwino choika chakudya m'malo, choncho ndili ndi mpunga, nudu ndi mafuta ambiri kunyumba", ndipo anawonjezera kuti ankaganiza kuti banja lake lidzakhala bwino ngakhale Beijing ikatseka kwa mwezi umodzi.

en: And while Beijing has not yet closed the city, citizens' lives have been disrupted.
ny: Ndipo ngakhale kuti Beijing sinatseke mzindawu, moyo wa nzika zasokonezeka.

en: On April 28, the Beijing Chaoyang District Maternal and Child Health Care Hospital issued a notice that the outpatient and emergency departments of the hospital would suspend the admission of patients.
ny: Pa April 28, chipatala cha Beijing Chaoyang District Maternal and Child Health Care Hospital chinapereka chidziwitso chakuti zigawo za anthu odwala kunja ndi zowonongeka za chipatalachi zidzaimitsa kulandira odwala.

en: On the same day, Chaoyang Hospital, one of the largest hospitals in Beijing, announced on its official Weibo account that its emergency department would also suspend the admission of patients. Weibo is China's equivalent of Twitter.
ny: Tsiku lomwelo, Chipatala cha Chaoyang, chimodzi mwa zipatala zazikulu kwambiri ku Beijing, chalengeza pa akaunti yake ya Weibo kuti dipatimenti yake yoyang'anira zachipatala idzaimitsanso kulandira odwala. Weibo ndi China yofanana ndi Twitter.

en: Angry Chinese netizens left more than 800 messages under the official WeChat account "Beijing Headline."
ny: Anthu a ku China omwe anakwiya kwambiri anasiya mauthenga oposa 800 pa akaunti yawo ya WeChat yotchedwa "Beijing Headline".

en: "Why do you stop the emergency room as soon as there is a new COVID case, and how many people will be killed due to the secondary disaster caused by the COVID?" a netizen asked in a Weibo post.
ny: "Chifukwa chiyani mukuletsa chipinda chodzidzimutsa pakangokhala milandu yatsopano ya COVID, ndipo ndi anthu angati omwe adzafe chifukwa cha tsoka lachiwiri lomwe COVID idayambitsa?" a netizen anafunsa mu positi ya Weibo.

en: Some Beijing residents said they were not worried about a Shanghai-like lockdown.
ny: Anthu ena okhala ku Beijing ananena kuti sakuda nkhawa ndi kutsekedwa kwa zinthu ngati ku Shanghai.

en: "Basically, I'm not afraid," said Mr. Wang, who asked VOA Mandarin to not use his full name so he could avoid attracting authorities' attention. "The party, government and military are here, and the people are here."
ny: "M'malo mwake, sindikuopa", adatero a Wang, omwe anapempha mawu a mawu a mawu a ku America kuti asagwiritse ntchito dzina lake lenileni kuti asakope chidwi cha akuluakulu a boma. "Pali chipani, boma ndi asilikali, ndipo anthu ali pano".

en: However, Wang told VOA Mandarin, in mid-October last year, after one person in his apartment building was diagnosed as positive, about 600 people from more than 200 families were forced into isolation at several hotels in the Changping district for 21 days.
ny: Komabe, Wang anauza VOA Mandarin kuti, pakati pa mwezi wa October chaka chatha, munthu mmodzi m'nyumba yake ya nyumba atadziwika kuti ndi woipa, anthu pafupifupi 600 ochokera m'mabanja oposa 200 anakakamizidwa kukhala m'malo odzipatula m'mahotela angapo m'chigawo cha Changping kwa masiku 21.

en: Wang and his wife were not allowed to share a room at their hotel.
ny: Wang ndi mkazi wake sanaloledwe kukhala m'chipinda chimodzi m'holo yawo.

en: What particularly puzzled and annoyed Wang was that on the last day of the mandatory hotel quarantine, in addition to routine nasal and oral swabs during testing, authorities added anal swabs to the regimen.
ny: Chimene chinadabwitsa kwambiri Wang chinali chakuti pa tsiku lomaliza la kuika anthu m'mahotela m'ndende, kuwonjezera pa kuika ma swab a m'mphuno ndi pakamwa pa nthawi ya mayeso, akuluakulu a boma anawonjezera ma swab a m'mphuno pa dongosololi.

en: Kasim Abdurehim contributed to this report.
ny: Kasim Abdurehim anathandiza nawo pa lipotili.

en: At US Urging, Fiji Seizes Russian Oligarch’s Yacht
ny: Potsatira Malangizo a US, Fiji Idzalanda Yacht ya Oligarch ya ku Russia

en: Another Russian oligarchs yacht was seized Thursday as part of efforts to punish Russia over its war in Ukraine.
ny: Yachiŵiri ya oyigiriki a ku Russia inagwidwa Lachinayi monga mbali ya kuyesayesa kulanga Russia chifukwa cha nkhondo yake ku Ukraine.

en: At the request of the United States, Fijian officials took a $300 million yacht belonging to Suleiman Kerimov, the Justice Department said. Officials say the yacht is in Lautoka, Fiji.
ny: Malinga ndi zimene Unduna wa Zachilungamo wa ku Fiji unati, akuluakulu a ku Fiji anapita ndi bwato la ndalama zokwana madola 300 miliyoni loti ndi la Suleiman Kerimov.

en: Kerimovs yacht, the Cayman Island-flagged Amadea, reportedly has been in Fiji since last month, arriving from Mexico. Defense lawyers claimed the vessel belonged to another oligarch.
ny: Chombo cha Kerimov, Amadea, chomwe chili ndi mbendera ya ku Cayman Island, akuti chakhala ku Fiji kuyambira mwezi watha, chofika kuchokera ku Mexico.

en: Kerimov had already been sanctioned by the U.S. in 2014 and 2018 for Russias activities in Syria and Ukraine. The European Union also sanctioned him.
ny: Kerimov anali atapatsidwa kale chilango ndi US mu 2014 ndi 2018 chifukwa cha ntchito za Russia ku Syria ndi Ukraine.

en: In March, the U.S. government announced a comprehensive effort to identify and seize the assets of wealthy Russians who have supported the government of Russian President Vladmir Putin, as part of the response to Moscows February 24 invasion of Ukraine.
ny: Mu March, boma la US linalengeza za kuyesetsa kwathunthu kuti lipeze ndi kulanda katundu wa anthu olemera a ku Russia omwe athandiza boma la Pulezidenti wa Russia Vladimir Putin, monga gawo la kuyankha kwa Moscow pa February 24 kuukira Ukraine.

en: The initiative, led by the Justice Department, is called Task Force KleptoCapture.
ny: Ntchitoyi, yoyendetsedwa ndi Dipatimenti ya Zachilungamo, imatchedwa Task Force KleptoCapture.

en: U.S. Attorney General Merrick Garland said Thursday in a statement there is "no hiding place for the assets of criminals who enable the Russian regime." He also said, "The Justice Department will be relentless in our efforts to hold accountable those who facilitate the death and destruction we are witnessing in Ukraine."
ny: Loya wamkulu wa boma la United States Merrick Garland ananena Lachinayi m'mawu kuti "palibe malo obisalira katundu wa zigawenga zomwe zimapangitsa kuti boma la Russia likhale ndi mphamvu". Ananenanso kuti, "Dipatimenti ya Zachilungamo idzakhala yopanda malire poyesetsa kwathu kufunsa omwe amachititsa kuti anthu azifa komanso kuwonongeka komwe tikuwona ku Ukraine".

en: In April, at the urging of the U.S., Spanish authorities seized a yacht belonging to Russian oligarch Viktor Vekselberg, the owner of the Russian conglomerate Renova Group.
ny: Mu April, akuluakulu a boma la Spain, atauzidwa ndi dziko la United States, anagwira bwato la wolamulira wa boma la Russia, Viktor Vekselberg, mwini wa kampani ya Renova Group.

en: Last week, the U.S. House of Representatives passed a measure that would allow the U.S. government to sell forfeited Russian properties worth more than $2 million for the benefit of Ukraine. The measures next step is the Senate.
ny: Mlungu watha, Nyumba ya Oimira ya ku United States inavomereza lamulo loti boma la United States lizigulitsa katundu wa ku Russia wolemera madola 2 miliyoni kuti athandize Ukraine.

en: (Some information in this report comes from Reuters.)
ny: (Zambiri zimene zili m'nkhaniyi zinachokera ku Reuters.)

en: WHO Report Says COVID Cases Decline, Except in Americas, Africa
ny: Lipoti la WHO Liti Matenda a COVID Akuchepa, Kupatula ku America, Africa

en: The World Health Organization said Wednesday that the number of newly reported coronavirus cases and deaths globally continued to fall in the last week, continuing a decline that began in March.
ny: Bungwe la World Health Organization linanena Lachitatu kuti chiwerengero cha milandu yatsopano ya coronavirus komanso imfa padziko lonse lapansi zidapitilizabe kuchepa sabata yatha, kupitiriza kuchepa komwe kudayamba mu Marichi.

en: In its weekly report on the pandemic, the U.N. health agency said there were about 3.8 million new infections and more than 15,000 deaths last week, a 17% and 3% drop on the week respectively. But those figures are believed to be a significant underestimate of COVID-19's true toll as increasing numbers of countries abandon widespread testing and surveillance.
ny: M'lipoti lake la sabata iliyonse pa mliriwu, bungwe la UN Health Agency linati panali matenda atsopano pafupifupi 3.8 miliyoni ndi anthu opitilira 15,000 sabata yatha, kutsika kwa 17% ndi 3% sabata iliyonse. Koma ziwerengerozi zikuwoneka kuti ndizochepa kwambiri pa chiwerengero chenicheni cha COVID-19 chifukwa mayiko ambiri akuchoka pakuyesa ndi kuyang'anira.

en: Still, WHO noted that cases rose by about a third in Africa and 13% in the Americas. There was also a nearly 70% jump in deaths reported in India, although that was attributed to delayed reporting rather than a recent surge of disease.
ny: Komabe, WHO inati milandu inakula ndi pafupifupi gawo limodzi mwa magawo atatu a anthu a ku Africa ndi 13% ku America. Panali kuwonjezeka kwa pafupifupi 70% kwa anthu amene anafa ku India, ngakhale kuti zimenezi zinachitika chifukwa cha kuchedwa kwa malipoti m'malo mochititsa kuti matendawa awonjezeke posachedwapa.

en: Last week, authorities in South Africa said they had noted an uptick in COVID-19 cases attributable to the BA.4 mutant of omicron, although they said it was too early to tell if that would result in a significant new wave of disease. Although the BA.4 version of COVID-19's omicron variant appears more infectious than omicron, WHO said there was no evidence yet that it was leading to substantially higher rates of hospitalization or death.
ny: Sabata yatha, akuluakulu aku South Africa adati adawona kuwonjezeka kwa milandu ya COVID-19 chifukwa cha mtundu wa BA.4 wa omicron, ngakhale adati ndi kale kwambiri kuti adziwe ngati izi zingayambitse mliri watsopano. Ngakhale mtundu wa BA.4 wa mtundu wa COVID-19 wa omicron ukuwoneka kuti ndiwopatsira kwambiri kuposa omicron, WHO idati palibe umboni kuti ukuyambitsa kuchuluka kwa kuchipatala kapena kufa.

en: Salim Abdool Karim, a public health expert at the University of KwaZulu-Natal, said that while only a "modest" rise in cases had been noted, South Africa was also in the middle of a holiday period and testing had dropped significantly. He said the cases were slowing and were "not following a rocket-like upward trajectory we would expect" in another spike of disease.
ny: Salim Abdool Karim, katswiri wa zaumoyo wa anthu ku University of KwaZulu-Natal, adati ngakhale kuti kuwonjezeka "kochepa" kokha kwa milandu kunawonedwa, South Africa inali pakati pa tchuthi ndipo kuyesedwa kudatsika kwambiri. Anati milandu ikuchedwa ndipo "sichikutsatira njira yofanana ndi rocket yomwe tikayembekezera" mu vuto lina la matenda.

en: At a press briefing on Wednesday, WHO emergencies chief Dr. Michael Ryan said it was too soon to tell if COVID-19 was entering a seasonal pattern and warned against countries dropping all of their restrictions too quickly — as many in the West have done.
ny: Pa msonkhano wa atolankhani Lachitatu, mkulu wa WHO wa zinthu zadzidzidzi Dr. Michael Ryan adati ndizachangu kwambiri kudziwa ngati COVID-19 ikupita pachaka ndipo adachenjeza kuti mayiko asathetse zoletsa zawo zonse mwachangu kwambiri  monga momwe ambiri akumadzulo achitira.

en: "The jury is still out as to how seasonal this virus will become," he said, explaining that it wasn't proven yet that COVID-19 would naturally drop off in the summer and that the world could yet face more unsettling variants. "If people are crowded together in conditions where a new variant is spreading, you will see high levels of transmission," he said.
ny: "Bungwe loweruza milandu likudziwabe kuti kachilomboka kakhalako nthawi yanji", adatero, pofotokoza kuti sizinatsimikizidwe kuti COVID-19 idzatsika mwachilengedwe mchilimwe ndipo dziko lapansi likhoza kukumana ndi mitundu ina yosokoneza. "Ngati anthu akuchuluka pamodzi m'malo omwe mtundu watsopanowu ukufalikira, mudzawona kuchuluka kwa kufalikira", adatero.

en: Meanwhile in China, authorities continued to crack down on cities, including Beijing, where more than 10% of the subway system was shut down in an effort to curb the virus' spread, after authorities in the capital already closed down indoor dining, gyms and school classes.
ny: Panthawiyi, akuluakulu a boma ku China akupitirizabe kuukira mizinda, kuphatikizapo Beijing, kumene anthu oposa 10% a m'sitima ya pansi pa dziko lapansi anaimitsidwa pofuna kuletsa kufalikira kwa kachilomboka, akuluakulu a boma likulu atatseka kale malo odyera, malo ochitira masewera olimbitsa thupi ndi sukulu.

en: In Shanghai, rigid and widely derided restrictions have led to shortages of food and medical aid along with a wider — though likely temporary — impact on the national economy. Desperate, outraged citizens have confronted authorities at barricades and online, screamed out of their windows and banged pots and pans in a sign of frustration and anger.
ny: Ku Shanghai, zoletsa zolimba komanso zosekedwa kwambiri zapangitsa kuti pakhale kuchepa kwa chakudya ndi chithandizo chamankhwala komanso zovuta zambiri pa chuma cha dziko. Anthu okwiya komanso okwiya akhala akukumana ndi akuluakulu a boma pamabowo ndi pa intaneti, akufuula kuchokera pawindo lawo ndikumenya miphika ndi poto posonyeza kukhumudwa ndi mkwiyo.

en: Myanmar Supreme Court Rejects Aung San Suu Kyi Appeal on Corruption Charges
ny: Khoti Lalikulu la ku Myanmar Lagonjetsa Apilo ya A Aung San Suu Kyi pa Milandu ya Ziphuphu

en: An appeal of a five-year jail sentence against ousted Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi was rejected Wednesday by the country's supreme court.
ny: Mlandu wokakamiza mtsogoleri wa dziko la Myanmar, Aung San Suu Kyi, kuti apatsidwe chilango cha zaka zisanu m'ndende, unakanidwa ndi khoti lalikulu la dzikoli Lachitatu.

en: The decision reportedly came as soon as the claim for an appeal was lodged, and the court didn't entertain arguments from either side in the case.
ny: Nkhaniyi inati chigamulochi chinaperekedwa pomwe apiloyo anaikidwa ndipo khoti silinagwirizane ndi mfundo za mbali iliyonse ya mlanduwu.

en: Suu Kyi, 76, was sentenced last week after being found guilty of 11 counts of corruption, including taking a bribe of cash and gold bars worth $600,000.
ny: Suu Kyi, wazaka 76, anaweruzidwa sabata yatha pambuyo poti apezeka ndi mlandu wa ziphuphu 11, kuphatikizapo kulandira ziphuphu za ndalama ndi ndalama zagolide zokwana madola 600,000.

en: Her lawyer called the charge absurd.
ny: Loya wake ananena kuti mlanduwu ndi wopusa.

en: Suu Kyi had already been sentenced to six years for actions against the military, breaking COVID-19 rules and breaking a telecommunications law.
ny: Suu Kyi anali ataweruzidwa kale kuti akhale zaka zisanu ndi chimodzi chifukwa chochita zinthu zotsutsana ndi asilikali, kuphwanya malamulo a COVID-19 komanso kuphwanya lamulo la ma telecommunications.

en: She faces many more charges, and if found guilty could be sentenced to more than 150 years in jail.
ny: Iye akukumana ndi milandu yambiri, ndipo ngati apezeka ndi mlandu akhoza kumangidwa zaka zoposa 150 m'ndende.

en: Suu Kyi has been under house arrest since a military coup took over the country last year.
ny: Suu Kyi wakhala akusungidwa panyumba kuyambira pamene asilikali anagonjetsa dzikoli chaka chatha.

en: Since the coup, on Feb. 1, 2021, there have been widespread protests against the military regime. The regime cracked down violently in many cases, leaving more than 1,800 civilians dead and more than 10,000 arrested, charged or sentenced, according to the Assistance Association for Political Prisoners (Burma).
ny: Kuchokera pa coup, pa February 1, 2021, pakhala pali zionetsero zambiri zotsutsana ndi boma la asilikali. Boma lachiwawa linatsutsa milandu yambiri, ndikusiya anthu oposa 1,800 akupha ndipo oposa 10,000 amangidwa, akuimbidwa mlandu kapena kuweruzidwa, malinga ndi bungwe lothandizira akaidi andale (Burma).

en: Some information in this report comes from Reuters and Agence France-Presse.
ny: Zina mwa mfundo zimene zili m'nkhaniyi zinachokera ku Reuters ndi ku Agence France-Presse.

en: Foreign Tourists Begin Arriving in New Zealand After COVID Restrictions Lifted.
ny: Alendo akunja ayamba kufika ku New Zealand pambuyo poti zoletsa za COVID zamasulidwa.

en: For the first time in over two years, overseas tourists have been allowed to enter New Zealand starting Monday.
ny: Kwa nthaŵi yoyamba m'zaka zoposa ziŵiri, alendo ochokera kunja aloledwa kuloŵa ku New Zealand kuyambira Lolemba.

en: The island nation known for its natural beauty enacted some of the strictest lockdown measures during the COVID-19 pandemic, including very restrictive travel limitations.
ny: Dziko la chilumbali lotchuka chifukwa cha kukongola kwake kwachilengedwe lidakhazikitsa njira zina zolimba kwambiri zotchinga anthu panthawi ya mliri wa COVID-19, kuphatikiza zoletsa kuyenda.

en: The country had reopened for tourists from Australia weeks ago, but the new relaxation of restrictions now allows tourists from over 60 countries to visit, including most European countries and the U.S.
ny: Dzikoli linatsegulidwanso kwa alendo ochokera ku Australia masabata apitawo, koma kuchepetsa kochepa kwa malamulo tsopano kumalola alendo ochokera m'mayiko oposa 60 kupita, kuphatikizapo mayiko ambiri a ku Ulaya ndi US

en: "Today is a day to celebrate and is a big moment in our reconnection with the world," said Tourism Minister Stuart Nash.
ny: "Lero ndi tsiku lokondwerera ndipo ndi nthaŵi yaikulu yolumikizananso ndi dziko", anatero nduna ya zokopa alendo Stuart Nash.

en: Tourists must show they are fully vaccinated and test negative for the virus.
ny: Alendo ayenera kusonyeza kuti ali ndi katemera wathunthu ndipo mayeso awo ndi olakwika.

en: Citizens of China, India and other countries not given a waiver Monday are still not allowed to visit.
ny: Anthu a ku China, India ndi mayiko ena amene sanalandire chilolezo cha Lolemba saloledwa kupita.

en: Before the pandemic, tourism accounted for 5% of the countrys economic activity and 20% of its foreign income.
ny: Mliriwu usanachitike, ntchito zokopa alendo zinali ndi 5% ya ntchito zachuma m'dzikolo komanso 20% ya ndalama zake zakunja.

en: On Monday, 43 international flights carrying around 9,000 passengers were scheduled to leave or arrive at Auckland International Airport, Reuters reported.
ny: Lachiwiri, ndege 43 zapadziko lonse zonyamula anthu pafupifupi 9,000 zinakonzedwa kuti zichoke kapena kufika pa eyapoti ya Auckland, inatero Reuters.

en: Some information in this report comes from The Associated Press and Reuters.
ny: Zina mwa mfundo za m'nkhaniyi zinachokera ku The Associated Press ndi Reuters.

en: Report: Iran to Execute Swedish-Iranian National by May 21.
ny: Lipoti: Iran idzawononga dziko la Sweden ndi Iran pa May 21.

en: Iran will later this month execute a Swedish-Iranian national whom it has imprisoned since 2016 and convicted of spying for Israel, media reported.
ny: Iran idzalamula kuti munthu wa ku Sweden ndi ku Iran aphedwe kumapeto kwa mwezi uno, yemwe wakhala m'ndende kuyambira 2016 ndipo wapezeka wolakwa chifukwa chochitira ukonde Israeli, atolankhani anena.

en: Irans semiofficial ISNA news agency on Wednesday released a report in which Iranian officials stated that Tehran will implement the death penalty against Ahmad Reza Jalali by May 21.
ny: Bungwe la nthano la ku Iran la ISNA Lachitatu linatulutsa lipoti lomwe akuluakulu a ku Iran adanena kuti Tehran ikhazikitsa chilango cha imfa motsutsana ndi Ahmad Reza Jalali pofika pa 21 Meyi.

en: Jalali, a researcher and physician who specializes in disaster relief, was arrested during a visit to Iran in April 2016. In 2017, Jalali was sentenced to death in Iran after he had been found guilty of passing information about two Iranian nuclear scientists to Israel to help it assassinate several nuclear scientists.
ny: Jalali, wofufuza komanso dokotala yemwe amayang'anira zothandizira anthu pa ngozi zadzidzidzi, adamangidwa paulendo wake ku Iran mu Epulo 2016. Mu 2017, Jalali adaweruzidwa kuti aphedwe ku Iran pambuyo poti adapezeka kuti ndi wolakwa popereka zidziwitso za asayansi awiri aku Iran ku Israel kuti athandize kupha asayansi angapo aku Iran.

en: Rights groups have condemned Jalalis detention, citing Irans pattern of detaining dual nationals and expatriates without due process.
ny: Magulu olimbikitsa ufulu wa anthu anatsutsa kumangidwa kwa Jalalis, ponena kuti Iran imatsatira njira imene imatsekera nzika ziwiri ndi anthu ena osakhala nzika popanda kuzenga mlandu.

en: Iran does not recognize dual nationals.
ny: Dziko la Iran silikuvomereza anthu okhala ndi ufulu wokhala ndi nzika ziwiri.

en: The announcement came as authorities in Stockholm wrapped up the trial of Hamid Nouri, a former Iranian prosecution official whom Swedish officials arrested in November 2019.
ny: Chilengezochi chinachitika pamene akuluakulu a boma ku Stockholm anamaliza mlandu wa Hamid Nouri, yemwe anali mkulu wa boma la Iran ndipo anamangidwa ndi akuluakulu a boma la Sweden mu November 2019.

en: Authorities say Nouri played a role in the deaths of political prisoners executed on Iranian government orders at Irans Gohardasht prison during the final phase of the Iran-Iraq war in 1988. Nouri has been held in custody in Sweden since his arrest.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma akuti Nouri anathandiza pa imfa ya akaidi andale omwe anaphedwa pa lamulo la boma la Iran kundende ya Iran Gohardasht pa nthawi yomaliza ya nkhondo ya Iran ndi Iraq mu 1988.

en: On Wednesday, the final day of Nouri's trial, a Stockholm district court judge set the date of the verdict for July 14.
ny: Lachitatu, tsiku lomaliza la mlandu wa Nouri, woweruza wa khoti la ku Stockholm anaika tsiku la chiweruzo pa July 14.

en: Amnesty International put the number of those executed at the prison at 5,000 but said in a 2018 report that the number could be higher.
ny: Bungwe la Amnesty International linati chiwerengero cha anthu omwe anaphedwa kundendeyi chinali 5,000 koma linati mu lipoti la 2018 chiwerengerochi chikhoza kukhala chachikulu.

en: Human Rights Watch, in a recent report, said, "Iran continues to be one of the worlds leading implementers of the death penalty."
ny: Bungwe la Human Rights Watch, m'lipoti laposachedwapa, linati, "Iran ikupitirizabe kukhala imodzi mwa mayiko amene akutsogolera kwambiri pa ntchito yokhazikitsa chilango cha imfa".

en: If Nouri is convicted, he will face a maximum life sentence on charges of international war crimes and human rights abuses. Iran recently summoned the Swedish envoy in protest over Nouris case.
ny: Ngati Nouri akapezeka wolakwa, adzaweruzidwa kuti akhale ndi moyo wautali chifukwa cha milandu yapadziko lonse yochita zachiwawa komanso kuphwanya ufulu wa anthu.

en: Maja Aberg, senior policy adviser with Amnesty International Sweden, says it is no coincidence that Iran announced Jalalis pending execution just after Swedish prosecutors moved on Nouris trial.
ny: Maja Aberg, mlangizi wamkulu wa Amnesty International Sweden, akuti sizachilendo kuti Iran yalengeza kuti Jalalis akuyembekezera kuphedwa atangotuluka kumene kuzenga mlandu wa Nouris.

en: "It indicates that (Iran) sees him as a kind of piece in the jigsaw puzzle, which is very worrying," Aberg told Sweden's TT news agency.
ny: "Zimasonyeza kuti (Iran) imamuona ngati gawo la chithunzi, zomwe ndi zochititsa mantha kwambiri", Aberg anauza bungwe la ku Sweden la TT.

en: Swedish law allows for the prosecution of Swedish citizens and other nationals for crimes against international law committed abroad.
ny: Lamulo la Sweden limalola kuti nzika za Sweden ndi nzika zina zikakamizidwe mlandu chifukwa cha milandu youkira malamulo a mayiko imene yachitika kunja.

en: Some information for this report came from The Associated Press, Reuters and Agence France-Presse.
ny: Zina mwa mfundo za lipotili zinachokera ku Associated Press, Reuters ndi Agence France-Presse.

en: Erdogan Goes to Riyadh to Seal Rapprochement
ny: Erdogan Akupita ku Riyadh Kukafuna Kuyambitsa Ubale Watsopano

en: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan heads to Saudi Arabia Thursday for a two-day visit aimed at easing old tensions between Ankara and Riyadh.
ny: Pulezidenti wa Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan akupita ku Saudi Arabia Lachinayi pa ulendo wa masiku awiri wokhudzana ndi kuchepetsa mikangano yakale pakati pa Ankara ndi Riyadh.

en: The Turkish leaders visit with the Saudi king comes after years of rivalry between their once-close countries.
ny: Ulendo wa atsogoleri a dziko la Turkey ndi mfumu ya Saudi ukuchitika pambuyo pa zaka zambiri za mpikisano pakati pa mayiko awo omwe anali oyandikana nawo.

en: Mehmet Ogutcu is the head of the London Energy Club, a grouping of government and energy sector leaders. Ogutcu says the visit is the culmination of intense international diplomacy.
ny: A Mehmet Ogutcu ndi mtsogoleri wa London Energy Club, gulu la atsogoleri a boma ndi mabungwe a zamagetsi. Ogutcu akuti ulendowu ndi mapeto a mgwirizano wapadziko lonse.

en: "President Erdogan has good relations with the king; with the crown prince Muhammad Bin Salman, we had serious difficulties," said Ogutcu. "Now it looks that I believe the*(Britons), and Americans, and the Qataris of course played some role, even the Azeris might have done this. And things are changing and relaxing a bit more, and now at the presidential level, it's going to be sealed."
ny: "Purezidenti Erdogan ali ndi ubale wabwino ndi mfumu; ndi kalonga wachifumu Muhammad Bin Salman, tinali ndi mavuto aakulu", adatero Ogutcu. "Tsopano zikuwoneka kuti ndikukhulupirira kuti *(Abriti), ndi America, ndi a Qatar ndithudi adatenga gawo, ngakhale Azerbaijani atha kuchita izi. Ndipo zinthu zikusintha ndikumasuka pang'ono, ndipo tsopano pamlingo wa Purezidenti, zidzatsekedwa".

en: Erdogan and the crown prince have been bitter rivals. The Turkish president led international condemnation over the murder of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi, who was killed inside Saudi Arabias consulate in Istanbul.
ny: Pulezidenti wa Turkey anatsogolera kutsutsa kwa mayiko onse pa kupha mtolankhani wa ku Saudi Jamal Khashoggi, yemwe anaphedwa mkati mwa ofesi ya kazembe wa Saudi Arabia ku Istanbul.

en: The killing was linked to the crown prince, a charge he denied. But the decision earlier this month to move the Khashoggi murder trial from Istanbul to Riyadh is seen as a gesture by Ankara, opening the way for Erdogan's visit.
ny: Kuphedwa kwa mfumuyi kunagwirizanitsidwa ndi kalonga wa korona, zomwe iye anakana, koma chigamulo choyambirira cha mwezi uno chosamutsa mlandu wa Khashoggi kuchokera ku Istanbul kupita ku Riyadh chikuwonedwa ngati chisonyezo cha Ankara, kutsegula njira ya ulendo wa Erdogan.

en: Ogutcu says with presidential elections due next year, Erdogan is looking for Saudi help to bail out the ailing Turkish economy.
ny: Ogutcu akuti ndi chisankho cha pulezidenti chomwe chidzakhazikitsidwe chaka chamawa, Erdogan akufuna thandizo la Saudi kuti athandize pa mavuto a chuma cha Turkey.

en: "Turkey has an interest in reviving relations with Riyadh because Turkey needs financial support," said Ogutcu. "The Turkish economy is not attracting any significant portfolio investments nor sovereign wealth funds coming to invest Turkey. But this will be a give-and-take package deal involving these countries. So, there are real economic and political security interests involved."
ny: "Turkey ili ndi chidwi chobwezeretsanso ubale ndi Riyadh chifukwa Turkey imafunikira thandizo la ndalama", adatero Ogutcu. "Uchuma waku Turkey sukukopa ndalama zazikulu kapena ndalama zolemera zochokera ku boma zomwe zikubwera kudzayendera Turkey. Koma izi zidzakhala mgwirizano wopereka ndi kutenga womwe umaphatikizapo mayiko awa. Chifukwa chake, pali zofuna zenizeni zachuma ndi ndale zachitetezo".

en: Shared concerns over Iran's growing influence in the region -- along with its nuclear energy program -- provide important common ground between Riyadh and Ankara, says international relations professor Soli Ozel of Istanbul's Kadir Has University, especially as American attention is expected to pivot away from the Middle East and toward China.
ny: Kuda nkhawa kofanana ndi kwa Iran pa mphamvu zake zomwe zikukula m'derali - pamodzi ndi pulogalamu yake ya mphamvu za nyukiliya - kumapereka malo ofanana pakati pa Riyadh ndi Ankara, akutero pulofesa wa maubwenzi apadziko lonse Soli Ozel wa ku Kadir Has University ku Istanbul, makamaka pamene akuyembekezeka kuti chidwi cha America chidzachoka ku Middle East kupita ku China.

en: "Turkey does propose itself as a counterweight to Iran. Both countries have an interest along with all the western countries for Iran not to be as influential throughout the region as it is today," said Ozel. "And the Iranians are also constantly sending signals that they are not going to let others draw them away from those countries - Iraq, Lebanon and Syria - where they have quite a lot of influence."
ny: "Turkey ikudzipereka ngati choletsa Iran. Mayiko onsewa, pamodzi ndi mayiko onse a kumadzulo, ali ndi chidwi kuti Iran isakhale ndi mphamvu m'dera lonseli monga zilili lero", anatero Ozel. "Ndipo Airani akupitirizabe kutumiza zizindikiro kuti sadzalola ena kuwachotsa m'mayiko omwe ali ndi mphamvu zambiri - Iraq, Lebanon ndi Syria".

en: Erdogan's Saudi visit is part of a wider policy of seeking to repair relations across the region in a bid to end its isolation. The Turkish president has recently visited the United Arab Emirates and earlier this month hosted the Israeli president, Isaac Herzog.
ny: Ulendo wa Erdogan ku Saudi ndi gawo la ndale yayikulu yofuna kukonza ubale kudera lonse pofuna kuthetsa kudzipatula kwake. Purezidenti wa Turkey posachedwapa wachezera United Arab Emirates ndipo koyambirira kwa mwezi uno adalandira Purezidenti wa Israeli, Isaac Herzog.

en: But analyst Ozel warns Ankara is in a vulnerable position.
ny: Koma katswiri wa maphunziro a Ozel akuchenjeza kuti Ankara ali m'malo ovuta.

en: "Turkey alienated, insulted, offended a lot of countries with which it had at least decent relations. And they all recognize that this burst of diplomacy is coming out of weakness rather than strength," said Ozel.
ny: Ozel anati: "Turkey inachotsa, kunyoza, ndi kuvulaza mayiko ambiri amene inali ndi ubale wabwino nawo. Ndipo onsewa akuzindikira kuti kuphulika kwa ndalezi kukuchokera ku kufooka osati ku mphamvu".

en: But analysts say Ankara is banking on its importance as a potential bulwark to Iranian ambitions, a factor that may help overcome any remaining hostility among the neighbors it is trying to win back.
ny: Koma akatswiri amanena kuti Ankara akudalira kufunika kwake monga linga la zolinga za Iran, chinthu chimene chingathandize kuthetsa udani uliwonse umene ulipo pakati pa anansi ake omwe akuyesera kuwombola.

en: Executions, Detentions Hang Over Saudi Legal Reforms
ny: Kuphedwa, Kumangidwa Kumangotengera Kusintha kwa Malamulo a ku Saudi

en: Saudi Arabia is pushing to revamp its harsh justice system but reforms are overshadowed by executions and tough treatment of dissidents, raising questions about how much will change.
ny: Dziko la Saudi Arabia likuyesetsa kusintha dongosolo lake la chilungamo koma kusintha kumeneku kukuphimbidwa ndi kuphedwa ndi kuchitidwa zinthu mwankhanza kwa anthu amene sakugwirizana ndi malamulo, ndipo zimenezi zikuchititsa kuti anthu azifunsa kuti zinthu zingasinthe bwanji.

en: The kingdom is known for its strict interpretation of Islamic sharia law, which forms the basis of its judicial system.
ny: Ufumuwu umadziwika chifukwa cha kutanthauzira kwake mosamalitsa malamulo a Chisilamu a Sharia, omwe ndi maziko a dongosolo lake lachiweruzo.

en: But in recent months it has moved ahead with reforms that analysts say could make its courts function more like others in the Middle East.
ny: Koma m'miyezi yapitayi, boma la Turkey lapitirira ndi kusintha zinthu zimene akatswiri amanena kuti zingapangitse makhoti ake kugwira ntchito mofanana ndi makhoti ena a ku Middle East.

en: That effort hinges on a series of new laws for sensitive issues like women's divorce rights and judges' power to determine criminal sentences.
ny: Ntchito imeneyi ikugwirizana ndi malamulo ena okhudza nkhani zosavuta monga ufulu wa akazi wosudzulana ndi mphamvu ya oweruza yosankha zigamulo.

en: Announced last year by de facto ruler Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, the measures, including the first written penal code, appear to align with Saudi Arabia's goal of opening up to the world and softening its extremist image.
ny: Malangizo amenewa, kuphatikizapo malamulo oyamba olembedwa a chilango, analengezedwa chaka chatha ndi wolamulira wa dzikoli, Prince Mohammed bin Salman, ndipo akuoneka kuti akugwirizana ndi cholinga cha Saudi Arabia choti atseguke kwa dziko lonse ndi kuchepetsa khalidwe lake la zigawenga.

en: Even critics concede the changes could make Saudi courts more predictable, in some cases.
ny: Ngakhale otsutsa amavomereza kuti kusintha kumeneku kungapangitse makhoti a ku Saudi kukhala oyenera kuoneratu zinthu zina.

en: But there is no expectation that restrictions on free speech will ease, or that the legal system will treat more favorably perceived opponents of the government.
ny: Koma palibe chiyembekezo chakuti zoletsa za ufulu wa kulankhula zidzakhala zochepa, kapena kuti dongosolo la malamulo lidzakhala lothandiza kwambiri kwa otsutsa boma.

en: And despite the reforms, authorities have simultaneously provided reminders of what gave Saudi Arabia its ruthless reputation in the first place, notably the mass execution of 81 men in a single day in March for offenses related to "terrorism."
ny: Ndipo ngakhale kuti kusintha kwa zinthuzi kwachitika, akuluakulu a boma akhala akuwakumbutsa zimene zinachititsa kuti Saudi Arabia ikhale ndi mbiri yoipa kwambiri, makamaka kuphedwa kwa anthu 81 tsiku limodzi mu March chifukwa cha "chiwawa cha uchigawenga".

en: 'Notorious' system
ny: Dongosolo la "Lodziŵika"

en: Two new laws have already been approved by the Saudi Cabinet. One governs the admissibility of evidence, previously at the judges' discretion.
ny: Lamulo latsopano la malamulo awiri lavomerezedwa kale ndi Kabungwe ka kazembe ka ku Saudi Arabia.

en: The second, a family law, is to take effect in June. In a traditionally male-dominated system, it expands the rights of divorced women to alimony and custody of their children.
ny: Lamulo lachiwiri, lomwe ndi lamulo la banja, lidzayamba kugwira ntchito mu June.

en: Announcing the new law in March, Prince Mohammed said it represented "a major qualitative leap" for women's rights and "family stability."
ny: Pofotokoza za lamulo latsopanoli mu March, Prince Mohammed anati linali "kusunthika kwakukulu kwa khalidwe" kwa ufulu wa akazi ndi "kukhazikika kwa banja".

en: The reforms seem partly to cater to foreign firms whose investment the kingdom is courting, said Adel al-Saeed, vice president of the European Saudi Organization for Human Rights.
ny: Adel al-Saeed, wachiwiri kwa pulezidenti wa bungwe la European Saudi Organization for Human Rights, anati, kusintha kumeneku kumaoneka kuti kukugwira ntchito kwa makampani akunja omwe akuyendera ndalama zimene ufumuwo ukufuna.

en: "The owners of capital are afraid of investing in this country, which is notorious in the legal aspect, so these laws are intended to change the image," he said.
ny: "Omwe ali ndi ndalama amaopa kuika ndalama m'dziko lino, lomwe ndi lotchuka m'lamulo, choncho malamulowa akufuna kusintha chithunzichi", adatero.

en: The new penal code, yet to be unveiled, could bring further dramatic changes.
ny: Lamulo latsopano la malamulo oletsa anthu kuchita zinthu zoipa, limene silinafotokozedwe, lingadzetse kusintha kwakukulu.

en: Under sharia, only apostasy, theft, revolt, armed robbery, adultery, drinking alcohol and slander carry prescribed sentences. Judges are left to determine punishment in other cases.
ny: Malinga ndi malamulo a Sharia, ampatuko, kuba, kupanduka, kuba ndi zida, chigololo, kumwa mowa ndi kunyoza ndi zimene zimaperekedwa.

en: With a penal code in place, "the state will expect judges to rely not on their own training in sharia but instead on the legal rules (based on sharia) approved by the state," said Nathan Brown, an academic at George Washington University.
ny: Popeza malamulo a chilango alipo, "boma likuyembekeza kuti oweruza asamangoganizira za maphunziro awo a Sharia koma aziganizira malamulo (otengera Sharia) ovomerezeka ndi boma", anatero Nathan Brown, katswiri wa maphunziro a pa yunivesite ya George Washington.

en: "As a result, Saudi Arabia will look much more like a civil law system, much like most states in the region," said Brown, who has studied the Saudi reforms.
ny: Brown, yemwe waphunzira za kusintha kwa dziko la Saudi, anati: "Chifukwa cha zimenezi, dziko la Saudi Arabia lidzakhala ngati boma la malamulo a anthu, mofanana ndi mayiko ambiri m'chigawochi".

en: The result should be more "predictability," said Abdullah Alaoudh, a U.S.-based legal expert and government critic, as new rules "take away from the leeway ... that the judges used to have."
ny: Abdullah Alaoudh, katswiri wa zamalamulo komanso wotsutsa boma wa ku United States, ananena kuti zotsatira zake ziyenera kukhala "zotheka kuziyerekezera", chifukwa malamulo atsopanowa "amachotsa mpata... umene oweruza anali nawo".

en: But tighter regulation by the monarchy also "creates a larger problem: lack of independence," he added.
ny: Koma malamulo okhwima a ufumuwo "amabweretsa vuto lalikulu kwambiri: kusowa kwa ufulu wodzilamulira", iye anawonjezera motero.

en: The king is the head of the Saudi judiciary and acts as the final court of appeal.
ny: Mfumuyi ndi mutu wa boma la Saudi ndipo ndi khoti lomaliza la apilo.

en: Alaoudh's own father, prominent cleric Salman al-Awdah, has been held since 2017, seemingly in retaliation for a Twitter post that clashed with Saudi Arabia's policy at the time of isolating Qatar.
ny: Bambo ake a Alaoudh, m'busa wotchuka Salman al-Awdah, akhala akuikidwa m'ndende kuyambira 2017, zikuwoneka kuti akubwezera zomwe adalemba pa Twitter zomwe zidatsutsana ndi mfundo za Saudi Arabia panthawi yomwe adapatula Qatar.

en: He is one of many detained in an apparent crackdown on dissent and those who could challenge Prince Mohammed's power.
ny: Iye ndi mmodzi mwa anthu ambiri amene amangidwa chifukwa chofuna kuthetsa maganizo a anthu ena komanso amene angatsutse ulamuliro wa Prince Mohammed.

en: One of the most prominent examples is former crown prince Mohammed bin Nayef, the CIA ally respected in the West for his efforts to counter violent extremism, but who King Salman ousted from the line of succession.
ny: Chimodzi mwa zitsanzo zochititsa chidwi kwambiri ndi mfumu yakale ya korona Mohammed bin Nayef, mnzake wa CIA wolemekezedwa ku West chifukwa cha kuyesetsa kwake kulimbana ndi chiwawa chachiwawa, koma amene Mfumu Salman inamchotsa pa mzere wa mzera.

en: Prince Nayef has not been seen in public since reports of his arrest in March 2020. His detention was never officially confirmed.
ny: Prince Nayef sanawonekere pagulu kuyambira malipoti a kumangidwa kwake mu Marichi 2020.

en: Shadow of Khashoggi
ny: Mthunzi wa Khashoggi

en: For government opponents, such cases reinforce questions about what difference the ongoing justice reforms will make.
ny: Kwa otsutsa boma, milandu yoteroyo imalimbitsa mafunso okhudza kusiyana kumene kusintha kwa chilungamo kumene kukuchitika kudzapanga.

en: "In my view, this is all window-dressing," said Madawi al-Rasheed, a U.K.-based academic and spokesperson for the opposition National Assembly Party founded by exiles.
ny: "M'malingaliro mwanga, zonsezi ndi zokongoletsa", anatero Madawi al-Rasheed, katswiri wa maphunziro ku UK komanso mneneri wa chipani chotsutsa cha National Assembly Party chopangidwa ndi othaŵa kwawo.

en: "It's very, very difficult to see what the meaning is of these reforms apart from the project of portraying (Prince Mohammed) as a reformer."
ny: "N'zovuta kwambiri kuona tanthauzo la kusintha kumeneku kupatulapo ntchito yojambula (Mfumu Mohammed) monga wochita zosintha".

en: Hanging over any discussion of justice and legal reform in Saudi Arabia is the 2018 murder and dismemberment of critic and columnist Jamal Khashoggi in the kingdom's Istanbul consulate.
ny: Nkhani iliyonse yokhudza chilungamo ndi kusintha kwa malamulo ku Saudi Arabia ikudalira kupha ndi kuvulaza kwa wolemba nkhani komanso wolemba nkhani, Jamal Khashoggi, mu 2018 ku ofesi ya kazembe ku Istanbul.

en: A U.S. intelligence assessment found Prince Mohammed himself "approved" an operation to capture or kill Khashoggi, though Saudi officials deny this and say it was a "rogue" operation.
ny: Kufufuza kwa United States kwapeza kuti Prince Mohammed mwiniwakeyo "anavomereza" ntchito yomanga kapena kupha Khashoggi, ngakhale kuti akuluakulu a ku Saudi amakana izi ndipo amati inali ntchito "yachifwamba".

en: In April, before Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan visited Riyadh on Thursday and embraced Prince Mohammed, Turkey transferred the trial in absentia of 26 suspects in the Khashoggi case to Saudi Arabia.
ny: Mu April, Purezidenti wa Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan asanapite ku Riyadh Lachinayi ndi kukakondana ndi Prince Mohammed, Turkey inasamutsa mlandu wa anthu 26 omwe akuimbidwa mlandu wa Khashoggi ku Saudi Arabia.

en: Turkey's decision drew anguished protest from lawyers and Khashoggi's fiancée, who insisted Saudi courts couldn't possibly hold a credible trial.
ny: Chigamulo cha Turkey chinakwiyitsa kwambiri maloya ndi mkwatibwi wa Khashoggi, omwe anaumirira kuti makhoti a ku Saudi sakhoza kuchititsa mlandu wodalirika.

en: For the loved ones of those locked away, Khashoggi's killing fuels a uniform fear of speaking out.
ny: Kwa okondedwa a anthu amene ali m'ndende, kupha kwa Khashoggi kumachititsa kuti anthu aziopa kulankhula.

en: "I want to, many do, but we're scared," said a friend of Prince Salman bin Abdulaziz, who has been detained along with his father since 2018.
ny: "Ndikufuna, ambiri amafuna, koma ife tikuopa", anatero bwenzi la Prince Salman bin Abdulaziz, amene wakhala akusungidwa pamodzi ndi bambo ake kuyambira 2018.

en: "Everyone knows what happened to Khashoggi."
ny: "Aliyense akudziwa zimene zinachitikira Khashoggi".

en: Moroccan Prison Program Sets Out to De-Radicalize IS Veterans
ny: Mapulogalamu a M'ndende za ku Morocco Akufuna Kuthetsa Kuukira kwa Akatswiri a Boma la IS

en: As a combatant for the Islamic State group who left his native Morocco to join what he felt was a holy fight in Syria, Mohsin says he saw all the horrors of war. "A terrifying experience," he says.
ny: Monga womenyera nkhondo gulu la Islamic State amene anachoka kwawo ku Morocco kuti alowe nawo zomwe iye ankaona kuti zinali nkhondo yopatulika ku Syria, Mohsin akuti anaona zoopsa zonse za nkhondo. "Zinali zoopsa kwambiri", akutero.

en: Now a prisoner, the 38-year-old claims he is no longer the fanatic he was then, enraged with a murderous hatred for non-Muslims. Captured in Turkey and extradited to Morocco, he is serving a 10-year prison term on terrorism charges.
ny: Tsopano ndi mkaidi, munthu wazaka 38 akuti salinso wokonda kwambiri zinthu zimene anali nazo kale, ndipo akupsera mtima chifukwa cha chidani choopsa kwa anthu amene si Asilamu.

en: Now the former fighter has graduated with 14 other prisoners convicted of terror offenses from a Morocco de-radicalization program that might make them more eligible for an early release.
ny: Tsopano wolimbirayo anamaliza maphunziro ake pamodzi ndi akaidi ena 14 amene anaweruzidwa chifukwa cha zinthu zoipa zimene anachita chifukwa cha pulogalamu yochotsa ziphuphu ku Morocco imene ingawapangitse kukhala oyenerera kumasulidwa msanga.

en: The Associated Press and other media were invited to observe their graduation ceremony Thursday in a prison in Sale near the Moroccan capital, Rabat, and to interview some prisoners under monitored and controlled conditions. Prison administration officials picked out three men they said were willing to be interviewed.
ny: Associated Press ndi atolankhani ena anaitanidwa kuti akachite mwambo wawo womaliza maphunziro Lachinayi m'ndende ya Sale pafupi ndi likulu la Morocco, Rabat, ndi kufunsa akaidi ena mafunso pansi pa zinthu zowunikiridwa ndi zolamulidwa.

en: Officials stipulated that the inmates shouldn't be identified by their full names and that their faces mustn't be shown, citing privacy reasons.
ny: Akuluakulu a boma analamula kuti akaidiwo asadziwike ndi mayina awo onse komanso kuti nkhope zawo zisamawonekere, chifukwa cha zifukwa zachinsinsi.

en: But prison officials didn't listen to the interviews or intervene to shut down media lines of questioning or inmates' answers.
ny: Koma akuluakulu a kundende sanamvere zoyankhulanazo kapena kulowerera kuti atseke nkhani za atolankhani za kufunsa mafunso kapena mayankho a akaidi.

en: The 15 inmates in crisp shirts and trousers stood solemnly for Morocco's national anthem and were handed certificates. Prison officials said the de-radicalization program consisted of three months of classes in prison on religion, law and economics, and that inmates also received training on how to start a business. These most recent graduates were the ninth batch since the program started in 2017.
ny: Akaidi 15 omwe adavala malaya ndi mathalauza owala adayimilira mokweza nyimbo ya dziko la Morocco ndipo adaperekedwa ndi satifiketi. Akuluakulu a ndende adati pulogalamu yochotsa ziphuphu idapangidwa ndi miyezi itatu m'ndende yophunzirira chipembedzo, malamulo ndi chuma, ndipo akaidi adaphunzitsidwa momwe angayambitsire bizinesi. Omaliza maphunzirowa anali gulu lachisanu ndi chinayi kuyambira pomwe pulogalamuyi idayamba mu 2017.

en: Moulay Idriss Agoulmam, the director of social-cultural action and prisoner reintegration at Morocco's prison administration, said the program is entirely voluntary and works with inmates "to change their behavior and improve their life path."
ny: Moulay Idriss Agoulmam, mkulu wa ntchito za chikhalidwe ndi kubwezeretsa akaidi m'ndende za ku Morocco, ananena kuti pulogalamuyi ndi yaufulu ndipo imagwira ntchito ndi akaidi "kuti asinthe khalidwe lawo ndi kusintha moyo wawo".

en: "It enables prisoners to form an awareness of the gravity of their mistakes," he said.
ny: Iye anati: "Zimapangitsa akaidi kuzindikira kuti zolakwa zawo ndi zazikulu kwambiri".

en: Graduating from the program doesn't make inmates automatically eligible for early release, but does increase their chances of getting a royal pardon or a reduced sentence. That's been the case for just over half the program's 222 graduates so far, the prison administration says. Since 2019, the training has also been offered to women convicted under Morocco's Anti-Terrorism Act. Ten women have graduated so far — all of them since released, including eight with pardons.
ny: Maphunzirowa akupezeka kwa azimayi omwe ali ndi ufulu wosamvera malamulo a Morocco. Akazi khumi atha maphunziro awo  Onsewa atulutsidwa, kuphatikiza asanu ndi atatu omwe ali ndi machimo.

en: Called "Moussalaha," meaning "reconciliation" in Arabic, the program is offered to prisoners who have demonstrated a readiness to disavow extremism.
ny: Pulogalamuyi imatchedwa "Moussalaha", kutanthauza "kuyanjanitsa" m'Chiarabu ndipo imaperekedwa kwa akaidi amene asonyeza kuti ali okonzeka kukana chiwawa.

en: Mohsin said he left to fight in Syria in 2012. A school dropout as a teen, he said he "was virtually illiterate and couldn't discern good from bad." He said he was radicalized by people who showed him extremist videos "about the divine obligation to battle those who don't follow Islamic principles and to murder non-Muslims."
ny: Mohsin ananena kuti anachoka kuti akamenyane ku Syria mu 2012. Wasiya sukulu ali wachinyamata, ananena kuti "anali wosaphunzira ndipo sankatha kusiyanitsa chabwino ndi choipa". Iye anati anali kuukira anthu amene anamuonetsa mavidiyo achigaluka " onena za udindo wa Mulungu wolimbana ndi anthu amene satsatira mfundo za Chisilamu komanso kupha anthu omwe si Asilamu".

en: In Syria, "I saw massacres, rapes, and thefts," he said. "I concluded after a time that the fight being conducted in the name of Islam had nothing to do with our religion."
ny: Iye anati: "Ndinaona anthu akupha anthu ambiri, akugonjetsa anthu komanso akuba. Patapita nthawi ndinaganiza kuti nkhondoyi sinali yogwirizana ndi chipembedzo chathu".

en: He escaped to Turkey in 2018 and was detained for a year there before being extradited to Morocco.
ny: Iye anathawa ku Turkey mu 2018 ndipo anamangidwa kumeneko kwa chaka chimodzi asanaperekedwe ku Morocco.

en: He says he has now disavowed extremism.
ny: Iye akuti tsopano wakana kuchita zinthu mopitirira malire.

en: "That period of my life has passed," he said.
ny: Iye anati: "Nthawi imeneyi yatha.

en: Numerous Moroccans have traveled to Syria, Iraq and elsewhere to join extremist groups. Morocco has also experienced multiple attacks itself. Five suicide attacks in Casablanca in 2003 killed 33 people. In 2011, an explosion destroyed a cafe in Marrakech, killing 17 people, most of them foreign tourists.
ny: Anthu ambiri a ku Morocco apita ku Syria, Iraq ndi kwina kuti akalowe m'magulu achigaluka. Morocco yakhala ikukumana ndi ziwopsezo zingapo. Kuukira kwachisanu kwa kudzipha ku Casablanca mu 2003 kunapha anthu 33. Mu 2011, kuphulika kunawononga cafe ku Marrakech, ndikupha anthu 17, ambiri mwa iwo alendo akunja.

en: Al Mustapaha Razrazi, a clinical psychologist and member of the program's scientific committee, said among 156 people who have been released after attending the courses, just one has been caught committing a crime again.
ny: Al Mustapaha Razrazi, katswiri wa zamaganizo komanso membala wa komiti ya sayansi ya pulogalamuyi, ananena kuti pa anthu 156 amene anamasulidwa atapita ku maphunzirowa, mmodzi yekha ndiye anapezeka akuchita mlandu.

en: That person was convicted of a non-terrorism-related offense, he said.
ny: Iye anati munthu ameneyu anaweruzidwa kuti ndi wolakwa pa mlandu wosagwirizana ndi uchigawenga.

en: Iran Gets Opportunity to Sell Auto Parts to Russian Carmaker
ny: Iran Yapeza Mwayi Wogulitsa Magalimoto ku Makampani Ogulitsa Magalimoto ku Russia

en: A member of Iran's syndicate of car parts manufacturers says Iranian producers have an opportunity to export their wares to a Russian carmaker, state media reported.
ny: M'bale wina wa bungwe la opanga magalimoto ku Iran ananena kuti opanga magalimoto ku Iran ali ndi mwayi wotumiza katundu wawo kwa wopanga magalimoto ku Russia, atolankhani a boma anena.

en: The late Monday report quoted Hossein Bahrainian as saying "a prominent Russian car maker" requested parts from Iran. He did not name the manufacturer. He said it requested brake parts, airbags, air-conditioner parts and other components.
ny: Lipoti la Lolemba lotha linatchula Hossein Bahrainian ponena kuti "munthu wina wodziwika bwino wopanga magalimoto ku Russia" adafunsa zigawo ku Iran. Iye sananene dzina la wopanga. Iye adati adafunsa zigawo za mabuleki, airbags, zida zamagetsi ndi zigawo zina.

en: Both Iran and Russia are under U.S. sanctions but the export of Iranian cars and car parts is not subject to sanctions.
ny: Iran ndi Russia zili pansi pa chiletso cha US koma kutumiza kunja kwa magalimoto ndi zigawo za magalimoto ku Iran sikukumangidwa.

en: The import of automobiles to Iran is also not subject to sanctions. However, Tehran has not imported cars since 2018, after the U.S. withdrew from a nuclear deal between Iran and world powers and imposed oil and banking sanctions on Iran.
ny: Komabe, Tehran sinayambe kuyitanitsa magalimoto kuyambira 2018, pambuyo poti US yachoka pachigwirizano cha nyukiliya pakati pa Iran ndi mayiko apadziko lonse ndikuika mafuta ndi malamulo aku banki ku Iran.

en: Western nations stopped exporting to Russia after the invasion of Ukraine.
ny: Mayiko a Kumadzulo anasiya kutumiza katundu ku Russia pambuyo pa kuukira kwa Ukraine.

en: Iran in recent years has exported car radiators and suspension systems to Russia. In the past it exported cars to Iraq, Syria and Venezuela.
ny: M'zaka zaposachedwapa, Iran yakhala ikugulitsa ma radiator ndi ma suspension ku Russia.

en: Tehran and Moscow have had close relations in recent years, especially after Iran's sole nuclear power plant went online in 2011 with help from Russia.
ny: Tehran ndi Moscow akhala ndi ubale wapamtima m'zaka zaposachedwapa, makamaka pambuyo poti malo okhawo opangira mphamvu za nyukiliya ku Iran adayamba kugwira ntchito mu 2011 mothandizidwa ndi Russia.

en: Separately on Tuesday, Iran said it has played a mediatory role in the war in Ukraine.
ny: Lachiwiri, Iran inati inali ndi udindo wothandizana ndi anthu pa nkhondo ya ku Ukraine.

en: "So far twice I have conveyed messages from the foreign minister of Ukraine to my Russian counterpart," said Foreign Minister Hossein Amir Abdollahian in a phone conversation with his Irish counterpart. He said Iran supports diplomatic solutions for restoring peace and stability.
ny: "Pakali pano ndatumiza mauthenga kawiri kuchokera kwa nduna ya zakunja ya Ukraine kwa mnzanga waku Russia", adatero nduna ya zakunja Hossein Amir Abdollahian polankhula pafoni ndi mnzanga waku Ireland.

en: Abdollahian did not elaborate but said Iran "opposes war and displacement of human beings in Ukraine," and other paces like Yemen, the Palestinian lands and Afghanistan.
ny: Abdollahian sananene zambiri koma anati Iran "imatsutsa nkhondo ndi kusamutsidwa kwa anthu ku Ukraine", komanso njira zina monga Yemen, madera a Palestina ndi Afghanistan.

en: Diversity, New Perspectives Are Applied to Middle East Coverage
ny: Kusiyanasiyana, Malingaliro Atsopano Akugwiritsidwa Ntchito pa Kufalitsa za ku Middle East

en: Natalia Sancha has always adopted a collaborative approach to journalism. When out on assignment, she speaks to others covering the same story about their perspectives.
ny: Natalia Sancha wakhala akugwiritsa ntchito njira yogwirira ntchito limodzi ndi atolankhani. Akakhala kunja kwa ntchito, amalankhula ndi ena omwe akufotokoza nkhani yomweyo za malingaliro awo.

en: This partly stems from an interest in telling underreported stories, but as a female journalist in a male-dominated region, she says collaboration and supporting the women she works with have always been important.
ny: Izi zimachokera ku chidwi chofotokoza nkhani zosadziwika bwino, koma monga mtolankhani wamkazi m'dera lomwe amuna ambiri amakhala, iye akuti mgwirizano ndi kuthandizira akazi omwe amagwira nawo ntchito zakhala zofunika nthawi zonse.

en: "I would talk to male and female journalists, and I always realized that women had a similar perspective, because we had similar experiences while covering the story," the 42-year-old journalist said.
ny: "Ndinkalankhula ndi atolankhani aamuna ndi aakazi, ndipo nthaŵi zonse ndinkadziŵa kuti akazi anali ndi maganizo ofanana, chifukwa tinali ndi zochitika zofanana pamene tinali kufotokoza nkhaniyo", anatero mtolankhani wa zaka 42.

en: That collaborative approach came into play in 2020 when a publisher asked Sancha if she was interested in writing a book about Syria.
ny: Njira yothandizirana imeneyi inayamba kugwira ntchito mu 2020 pamene wofalitsa wina anafunsa Sancha ngati akufuna kulemba buku lokhudza Syria.

en: She countered with a better offer.
ny: Iye anakana ndi mwayi wabwino.

en: "I told him that a collective narrative by women journalists about the broader region would have a different effect," she said. "I could have written the book myself, but it would not have the same sense."
ny: Iye anati: "Ndinamuuza kuti nkhani imene akazi ena a m'gulu la atolankhani ankafotokoza zokhudza dera lonseli, ikanakhala ndi zotsatira zosiyana.

en: Originally from Andalusia in southern Spain, Sancha spent the past 14 years in the Middle East covering conflicts in Iraq, Syria and Yemen, and reporting from Egypt, Lebanon and Tunisia.
ny: Sancha, wochokera ku Andalusia kumwera kwa Spain, wakhala zaka 14 zapitazi ku Middle East akufotokoza za mikangano ku Iraq, Syria ndi Yemen, komanso akulemba kuchokera ku Egypt, Lebanon ndi Tunisia.

en: She has been working more recently with the European Union communications department, after leaving Beirut for health reasons following a mass explosion that rocked the city in 2020.
ny: Posachedwapa wakhala akugwira ntchito ndi dipatimenti yolumikizirana ya European Union, atachoka ku Beirut pazifukwa zaumoyo pambuyo pa kuphulika kwakukulu komwe kudagwedeza mzindawu mu 2020.

en: Women "have a different experience because we would go to places that our male colleagues were not used to. Not because we're smarter, but just because the majority of the region is still Arab, Muslim and gender-segregated," Sancha told VOA.
ny: Sancha anauza VOA kuti akazi "amakumana ndi mavuto osiyanasiyana chifukwa chakuti amapita kumalo amene amuna anzawo sanazolowere, osati chifukwa chakuti ndife anzeru koma chifukwa chakuti anthu ambiri m'derali ndi achiarabu, Asilamu komanso anthu osiyana pakati pa amuna ndi akazi".

en: Having women reporters has an impact, she noted.
ny: Iye anati kukhala ndi akazi olemba nkhani kumakhudza kwambiri.

en: "If I put myself in the position of the reader, I would prefer to have a woman telling me the story because it is going to be about 100 percent of the population, which means you are going to have a more inclusive narrative on the conflict."
ny: "Ngati ndingadziike m'malo mwa owerenga, ndingakonde kuti mkazi andiuze nkhaniyo chifukwa idzakhala pafupifupi 100 peresenti ya anthu, zomwe zikutanthauza kuti mudzakhala ndi nkhani yowonjezereka yokhudza mikangano".

en: For her book, Sancha reached out to other women who cover the Middle East, to ensure diverse perspectives from foreign and local reporters.
ny: M'buku lake, Sancha anafikira akazi ena amene akufotokoza za Middle East, kuti athandize atolankhani ochokera kunja ndi a m'deralo kukhala ndi maganizo osiyanasiyana.

en: The result of the nearly two-year collaboration is Bullets for All, released in Spanish in April.
ny: Zotsatira za mgwirizano wa zaka pafupifupi ziŵiri ndi Bullets for All, womwe unatulutsidwa m'Chisipanishi mu April.

en: In the book, "we tell one story with different voices that represent all the women" from the region, Sancha said.
ny: Sancha anati m'bukuli, "timanena nkhani imodzi yokhala ndi mawu osiyanasiyana omwe amaimira akazi onse" ochokera m'derali.

en: Each offers a personal perspective on covering historic moments, including the collapse of autocratic governments, popular protest movements and war. It also examines the discrimination and harassment women face in the newsroom and on assignment.
ny: Nkhaniyi ikufotokoza mmene anthu amaonera zinthu pa nkhani ya mbiri yakale, monga kuwonongeka kwa maboma a anthu, zionetsero za anthu komanso nkhondo.

en: Making connections
ny: Kupanga mauthenga

en: Understanding language and culture goes a long way toward making progress in the region, says Maya Gebeily. The Reuters bureau chief for Lebanon, Syria and Jordan is one of the contributors to the book.
ny: Mayi Maya Gebeily anati: "Kudziwa bwino chilankhulo ndi chikhalidwe cha anthu a m'derali kumathandiza kwambiri kuti zinthu ziziyenda bwino m'derali".

en: "There's a lot to say and show from the perspective of women reporters who were also then influenced by the women that they met as they were doing their reporting," she said.
ny: "Pali zambiri zoti anene ndi kusonyeza kuchokera ku maganizo a olemba nkhani achikazi omwe nawonso anali ndi mphamvu kuchokera kwa akazi omwe anakumana nawo pamene anali kupereka lipoti lawo", iye anati.

en: Born in the U.S. to Lebanese parents, Gebeily started her journalism career in 2013 with a local news site in Beirut, Lebanon. She went on to cover the region for Agence France-Presse before joining Reuters.
ny: Wobadwira ku US kwa makolo aku Lebanon, Gebeily adayamba ntchito yake yolengeza nkhani mu 2013 ndi tsamba la nkhani zakomweko ku Beirut, Lebanon. Anatsatira kufotokoza derali ku Agence France-Presse asanapite ku Reuters.

en: Gebeily said her American and Lebanese background helped her understand the region better, which in turn has shaped her reporting. Knowing the local language is an important part of that.
ny: Gebeily anati mbiri yake ya ku America ndi ku Lebanon inamuthandiza kumvetsetsa derali bwino, zomwe zinakhudza nkhani zake. Kudziwa chilankhulo cha kumeneko ndi gawo lofunikira pa izi.

en: "When interviewing a minister or a displaced person or an activist, the most important element is getting their trust," she said. "If you're able to speak the language and make them feel comfortable from the beginning, it changes everything. It grants you a very beautiful kind of access."
ny: Iye anati: "Pamene mukukambirana ndi mtumiki, munthu amene wasamutsidwa kwawo kapena munthu wina amene akuchita zinthu zina, chinthu chofunika kwambiri n'chakuti anthuwo azikukhulupirirani. Ngati mungathe kulankhula chinenerocho ndipo mukuthandiza kuti anthuwo azikhala omasuka kuyambira pachiyambi, zinthu zingasinthe ndipo zimenezi zingakuthandizeni kuti mupeze anthu ambiri".

en: In addition to Iraq and Lebanon, Gebeily, 30, has also traveled to Syria to cover the war against the Islamic State (IS) militant group.
ny: Kuwonjezera pa ku Iraq ndi Lebanon, Gebeily, wazaka 30, anapitanso ku Syria kuti akafotokoze za nkhondo yolimbana ndi gulu la zigawenga la Islamic State (IS).

en: "Ive been very privileged to access some communities directly without having to work with a translator or a fixer, which also shapes the way that the stories come out," she said.
ny: Iye anati: "Ndakhala ndi mwayi waukulu kwambiri wolandira anthu ena mwachindunji popanda kugwira ntchito ndi womasulira kapena wolemba mabuku, zomwe zimakhudzanso mmene nkhani zimakambidwira".

en: Syrian-Kurdish journalist Khabat Abbas, who has covered the war in Syria, attests to the importance of that.
ny: Wolemba nkhani wa ku Syria ndi wa ku Kurdish, Khabat Abbas, amene anafotokoza za nkhondo ya ku Syria, akuchitira umboni kufunika kwa zimenezi.

en: "Its knowing the language and the culture that gives people a sense of comfort to open up to you," she told VOA from Qamishli, Syria.
ny: "Kudziwa chinenero ndi chikhalidwe kumapatsa anthu chilimbikitso chotseguka kwa inu", iye anauza VOA kuchokera ku Qamishli, Syria.

en: That knowledge helped when Abbas, 34, was on assignment with Sancha in March 2021. They traveled to a Kurdish-run detention camp in northeast Syria and interviewed female jihadists affiliated with IS, for a story in El Pais.
ny: Zidziwitsozo zinathandiza pamene Abbas, wazaka 34, anali pa ntchito ndi Sancha mu Marichi 2021. Iwo anapita kumsasa wa kuika anthu m'ndende wa Akurdi kumpoto chakum'mawa kwa Syria ndipo anafunsa mafunso azimayi a jihad omwe ali ogwirizana ndi IS, kuti afotokoze nkhani ku El Pais.

en: "While in Qamishli [in northeast Syria], I ran into two British journalists, very good colleagues of mine, who were disappointed after Shamima Begum and other women at the camp refused to talk to them," Sancha said, referring to a young woman who left her home in Britain aged 15 to join IS.
ny: "Pamene ndinali ku Qamishli [kum'mwera chakum'mawa kwa Syria], ndinakumana ndi atolankhani awiri a ku Britain, anzanga abwino kwambiri, omwe anakhumudwa chifukwa Shamima Begum ndi akazi ena a mumsasawo anakana kulankhula nawo", anatero Sancha, ponena za mkazi wina wachinyamata amene anachoka kunyumba kwake ku Britain ali ndi zaka 15 kuti alowe nawo gulu la IS.

en: "Their fixer was a man, so the jihadist women didnt talk to them because they are radical, and they dont talk to men. But then I was able to sit with Shamima and other women, who gave fantastic interviews from inside their tents," Sancha said.
ny: Sancha anati: "Munthu amene ankawakonza anali mwamuna, choncho akazi a Jihad sanalankhule nawo chifukwa chakuti anali achangu, ndipo iwo sanalankhule ndi amuna. Koma kenako ndinatha kukhala ndi Shamima ndi akazi ena, omwe anapereka mauthenga abwino kuchokera mkati mwa mahema awo".

en: Abbas had a role in getting to talk to those women, she added.
ny: Abbas anali ndi mbali yaikulu pokambirana ndi akazi amenewo, iye anawonjezera.

en: Unlike Sancha and Gebeily, Abbas grew up in the marginalized Kurdish region of Syria, where until the war began in 2011, journalism effectively didnt exist.
ny: Mosiyana ndi Sancha ndi Gebeily, Abbas anakulira m'dera la Akurdi ku Syria, kumene mpaka nkhondo itangoyamba mu 2011, ntchito ya atolankhani inalibe.

en: "Ordinary people in our region were used to seeing women pick up arms and fight, but they werent used to seeing a woman hold a camera on the streets and on front lines," Abbas said. "It took a lot of sacrificing for me to convince my family and society that Im as good, if not better, as my male colleagues."
ny: Abbas anati: "Anthu wamba m'dera lathu ankayesetsa kuona akazi akusenza zida n'kumenya nkhondo, koma sanazolowere kuona mkazi wina akugwira kamera m'misewu ndi m'mizere ya patsogolo. Zinanditengera kudzipereka kwambiri kuti ndikhulupirire banja langa ndi anthu kuti ndine wabwino, ngati si wabwino, kuposa anzanga achimuna".

en: Journalism appealed to her because the story of the Middle East has often been told by male journalists, both local and foreign.
ny: Iye ankakonda kwambiri ntchito ya atolankhani chifukwa chakuti nthawi zambiri nkhani za ku Middle East zimanenedwa ndi atolankhani a m'dzikoli komanso ochokera kunja.

en: "The narrative hasnt changed because of that, but if local and international women journalists get a real chance to tell the story of the Middle East, that narrative could change, which would affect the way others see this region," Abbas said.
ny: "Nkhaniyo sinasinthe chifukwa cha zimenezi, koma ngati atolankhani achikazi a m'deralo ndi apadziko lonse atenga mwayi weniweni wofotokoza nkhani ya ku Middle East, nkhaniyo ikhoza kusintha, zomwe zingakhudze mmene ena amaonera derali", adatero Abbas.

en: Sancha also believes women in journalism have an impact on the way issues are viewed in the region, including post-traumatic stress disorder and the effect it has on female health, and subjects such as violence and alcohol.
ny: Sancha amakhulupirira kuti akazi mu nkhani za atolankhani amakhudza momwe nkhani zimawonedwera m'derali, kuphatikizapo matenda opsinjika maganizo pambuyo pa ngozi komanso zotsatira zake pa thanzi la akazi, komanso nkhani monga chiwawa ndi mowa.

en: "We talk about all these issues that men normally wouldnt not speak about," she said.
ny: Iye anati: "Timakambirana nkhani zonse zimene amuna safuna kuti anthu azilankhula.

en: Iran's Guards Commander Says Israel Creating Conditions for Own Destruction
ny: Mkulu wa Alonda a ku Iran Anati Israyeli Akupanga Zinthu Zodabwitsa Anthu

en: Israel's actions are creating conditions for its own destruction, Irans Revolutionary Guards commander on Friday told a Jerusalem Day rally at which the countrys new domestically-made Kheibar Buster missile was displayed.
ny: Zimene Israeli akuchitazi zikupangitsa kuti dzikoli liwonongedwe, mkulu wa asilikali a asilikali a asilikali a ku Iran ananena Lachisanu pa msonkhano wa pa Tsiku la Yerusalemu, pamene dzikoli linasonyeza mfuti yatsopano ya Kheibar Buster yopangidwa m'dzikolo.

en: State television said millions of Iranians joined rallies marking Quds Day, the Arabic name for Jerusalem, in state-organized marches across the country.
ny: Televizioni ya boma inati anthu mamiliyoni ambiri a ku Iran analowa m'misonkhano yosonyeza Tsiku la Quds, dzina lachiarabu la Yerusalemu, m'misonkhano yochitidwa ndi boma m'dziko lonse.

en: It showed the Israeli flag being set on fire and groups of people around the country shouting choreographed "Death to America, Death to Israel" slogans.
ny: Zinkaonetsa mbendera ya Israeli ikuwotchedwa ndi magulu a anthu m'dziko lonse akufuula mawu akuti "Imfa kwa America, Imfa kwa Israel".

en: Supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said in a televised speech that anti-Israeli protests and attacks showed that Palestinians rejected compromises by Arab authorities with Israel.
ny: Mtsogoleri wamkulu wa dziko la Iran Ayatollah Ali Khamenei ananena m'nkhani yake ya pa TV kuti ziwonetsero ndi ziwopsezo zotsutsana ndi Israeli zasonyeza kuti Apalastinayo anakana mapangano a akuluakulu a boma la Arab ndi Israeli.

en: Opposition to Israel is a touchstone of belief for Iran, which backs Palestinian and Lebanese Islamist militant groups opposed to peace with Israel, which Tehran does not recognize.
ny: Kutsutsa Israyeli ndi mwala wa chikhulupiriro kwa Iran, yomwe imathandizira magulu a asilikali a Palestina ndi Lebanese omwe amatsutsa mtendere ndi Israyeli, womwe Tehran sazindikira.

en: "What has happened in Palestine in recent years annuls all plans for compromise with the Zionist enemy (Israel) because no plan for Palestine can be implemented in the absence or contrary to the opinions of its owners, the Palestinians," Khamenei said, speaking in Arabic and addressing Palestinians and other Arabs.
ny: "Zimene zachitika ku Palestina m'zaka zaposachedwapa zimaletsa mapulani onse a kugwirizana ndi mdani wa Zionist (Israel) chifukwa palibe mapulani a Palestina omwe angagwiritsidwe ntchito ngati palibe kapena motsutsana ndi malingaliro a eni ake, Apalestina", adatero Khamenei, akulankhula m'Chiarabu ndipo akulankhula ndi Apalestina ndi Aarabu ena.
