ny: Malinga ndi zimene khoti la ICC linati, "monga zotsatira za kupusitsa koopsa kumeneku (komwe kunachitika ndi zigawenga za FDLR), anthu anaphedwa, kugwiriridwa, ndi kuchotsedwa kwawo ndi mphamvu, ndipo midzi yonse inawonongedwa".

en: Karugarama said Mbarushimana and his FDLR rebel forces played a pivotal role in the countrys 1994 genocide in which hundreds of thousands of people were killed.
ny: Karugarama anati Mbarushimana ndi magulu ake opanduka a FDLR anatenga mbali yofunika kwambiri pa kupha anthu ambiri m'dzikoli mu 1994.

en: "We believe that, in the next couple of weeks after due process has taken place in France, he should be able to be transferred to The Hague in the Netherlands to face charges and be prosecuted for war crimes and crimes against humanity committed within the territory of the DRC."
ny: "Tikukhulupirira kuti, m'masabata angapo otsatira pambuyo poti mlandu wa chilungamo wachitika ku France, ayenera kusamutsidwira ku The Hague ku Netherlands kuti akakhale ndi mlandu ndi kutsutsidwa chifukwa cha milandu ya nkhondo ndi milandu youkira anthu yomwe yachitika m'dera la DRC".

en: The Justice Minister also said Kigali will be cooperating with the International Criminal Court in the imminent prosecution of Mbarushimana.
ny: Nduna ya Zachilungamo inati Kigali idzathandizana ndi Khoti Loona za Ufulu wa Anthu pa mlandu wa Mbarushimana.

en: British, French Foreign Ministers to Re-Invigorate DRC Peace Process - 2002-01-18
ny: Atumiki a Britain ndi France a za kunja kuti alimbikitse mtendere wa ku DRC - 2002-01-18

en: The British and French foreign ministers travel to the Democratic Republic of Congo Monday to kickoff a three-day, four-nation tour of the troubled region of Central Africa.
ny: A nduna za zakunja za Britain ndi France apita ku Democratic Republic of Congo Lolemba kuti akayambitse ulendo wa masiku atatu wa mayiko anayi wopita ku dera la Central Africa lomwe lili ndi mavuto.

en: The mission will be jointly led by British Foreign Secretary Jack Straw and his French counterpart Hubert Vedrine.
ny: Ntchitoyi idzakhazikitsidwa ndi Mlembi wa Zachilendo wa ku Britain, Jack Straw, ndi mnzake wa ku France, Hubert Vedrine.

en: They will be visiting the Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda, Burundi and Uganda.
ny: Iwo adzapita ku Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda, Burundi ndi Uganda.

en: Their primary objective is to breathe new life into the peace process in the war-torn Congo.
ny: Cholinga chawo chachikulu ndicho kupatsa moyo watsopano ku mtendere wa ku Congo.

en: Specifically, the British and French want to see the withdrawal of foreign troops who back the Congolese government (n Kinshasa, demobilization of rebels who occupy more than half the country, and peace talks to end the conflict.
ny: Makamaka, a British ndi a French akufuna kuona kuchotsedwa kwa asilikali akunja omwe amathandiza boma la Congo (ku Kinshasa, kufooketsa zigawenga zomwe zimagwira dziko loposa theka, ndi zokambirana za mtendere zothetsa nkhondo.

en: British Foreign Secretary Straw said the mission also has a broader goal of making sure the Congo does not become another Afghanistan.
ny: Mlembi wa za m'dziko la Britain Straw anati ntchitoyi ili ndi cholinga choonetsetsa kuti dziko la Congo lisakhale dziko lina la Afghanistan.

en: "The 11th of September has made it much more urgent that we take earlier action against failed, and failing states," he said.
ny: Iye anati: "Zimene zinachitika pa September 11 zinachititsa kuti tizikhala ndi nkhawa kwambiri kuti tichitire zinthu mwamsanga kuti tilimbane ndi mayiko amene alephera".

en: In Kinshasa, the ministers will meet Congolese President Joseph Kabila. He took power one year ago, after his father, President Laurent Kabila, was assassinated by one of his bodyguards.
ny: Ku Kinshasa, ndunazo zikumana ndi Pulezidenti wa Congo Joseph Kabila, amene analandira mphamvu chaka chatha, atate wake Pulezidenti Laurent Kabila ataphedwa ndi mmodzi wa alonda ake.

en: Their next stop will be Kigali for talks with Rwandan President Paul Kagame, and the leader of the Rally for Congolese Democracy rebels, Adolphe Onusumba.
ny: Malo awo otsatirawa ndi Kigali kuti akambirane ndi Pulezidenti wa Rwanda Paul Kagame, ndi mtsogoleri wa zigawenga za Rally for Congolese Democracy, Adolphe Onusumba.

en: The ministers will make a brief visit to Burundi to discuss that country's civil war with President Pierre Buyoya.
ny: A ndunazi adzapita ku Burundi kukakambirana ndi Pulezidenti Pierre Buyoya za nkhondo yapachiweniweni m'dzikoli.

en: The tour will end in Uganda, where meetings are scheduled with President Yoweri Museveni and Jean-Pierre Bemba, who leads the Movement for the Liberation of Congo guerrillas.
ny: Ulendowu udzatha ku Uganda, kumene akumana ndi Pulezidenti Yoweri Museveni ndi Jean-Pierre Bemba, yemwe akutsogolera gulu la zigawenga za Movement for the Liberation of Congo.

en: UNICEF Pushes for Demobilizing Child Soliders Near Africa's Great Lakes - 2002-10-07
ny: UNICEF Ikulimbikitsa Ana Omwe Ali Asilikali Kufupi ndi Nyanja Zazikulu za ku Africa - 2002-10-07

en: The United Nations children's agency, UNICEF, is pushing for child soldiers to be demobilized in Africa's Great Lakes region, as several peace drives there build momentum. The agency says funding is in place to help the children leave the military and restart their lives.
ny: Bungwe la United Nations la ana, UNICEF, likulimbikitsa kuti ana asitikali asungidwe m'dera la Great Lakes ku Africa, chifukwa chakuti ntchito zingapo za mtendere zikulimbikitsa kwambiri. Bungweli limati ndalama zilipo zothandiza ana kusiya usilikali ndi kuyamba moyo wawo.

en: UNICEF's top child protection official, Manuel Fontaine, says peace initiatives in Uganda, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda are making it possible to get more children under the age of 18 out of fighting units. "We insist that child soldiers could be demobilized, even in conflict situations. We should never wait for peace to get children out of any form of armed group. But, obviously, that's a better timing at the moment. It's more conducive to demobilization," Mr. Fontaine said.
ny: Mkulu wa bungwe la UNICEF woteteza ana, Manuel Fontaine, akuti njira za mtendere ku Uganda, Democratic Republic of Congo ndi Rwanda zikupangitsa kuti ana ambiri azaka zosakwana 18 achoke m'magulu omenyera nkhondo. "Tikuumiriza kuti ana asirikali akhoza kusamutsidwa, ngakhale m'mikangano. Sitiyenera kuyembekezera mtendere kuti ana achoke m'magulu alionse ozungulira. Koma, mwachidziwikire, ndi nthawi yabwino kwambiri pakadali pano. Ndi yabwino kwambiri kuti asatenge ana", adatero a Fontaine.

en: He says there are currently 1,200 child soldiers in Uganda, fighting mainly with the rebel Lord's Resistance Army. He says that over the past 14 years, the group has abducted some 10,000 children, boys to fight and girls to serve as sex slaves.
ny: Iye akuti pakalipano ku Uganda kuli ana asitikali 1,200, omwe akumenyana makamaka ndi gulu la zigawenga la Lord's Resistance Army. Iye akuti pazaka 14 zapitazi, gululi laphwanya ana pafupifupi 10,000, anyamata akumenya nkhondo ndi atsikana kuti akhale akapolo ogonana.

en: According to UNICEF, The Democratic Republic of Congo still has some 10,000 children recruited to fight, while Rwanda has up to 2,000 children involved in combat.
ny: Malinga ndi UNICEF, Democratic Republic of Congo akadali ndi ana pafupifupi 10,000 amene amalembedwa ntchito kuti akamenye nkhondo, pamene Rwanda ali ndi ana pafupifupi 2,000 amene akuchita nawo nkhondo.

en: UNICEF says, even though some of the children do not directly engage in fighting, they are exposed to many dangers. They may be used as porters, carrying very heavy loads, or as messengers or spies passing information and scouting out enemy territory.
ny: UNICEF inanena kuti ngakhale kuti ana ena samenya nkhondo mwachindunji, iwo amavutika ndi zinthu zambiri. Angagwiritsidwe ntchito monga otumizira katundu, kunyamula katundu wolemera kwambiri, kapena monga amithenga kapena akazitape amene amapatsira anthu uthenga ndi kufufuza malo a adani.

en: Sometimes, boys, but mainly girls, are used as sex slaves. They are exposed to violence and HIV-AIDS and other sexually transmitted diseases. The girls may become pregnant, making it harder for them to reintegrate into their communities.
ny: Nthawi zina, anyamata, koma makamaka atsikana, amagwiritsidwa ntchito ngati akapolo ogonana. Amakhala ndi chiwawa, HIV-AIDS ndi matenda ena opatsirana mwa kugonana. Atsikanawo akhoza kutenga pakati, ndipo zimenezi zimawavuta kuti abwerere m'dera lawo.

en: UNICEF's Manuel Fontaine says demobilization takes time and money. He says the children must first be found, and then removed from their government or rebel units. Then, resources are needed to help them rebuild their lives. That involves providing schools, vocational training and health care.
ny: Mkulu wa bungwe la UNICEF, Manuel Fontaine, ananena kuti kuletsa ana kumakhala kofunika nthawi ndi ndalama, ndipo anawo ayenera kupezeka kaye, kenako n'kuchotsedwa m'boma kapena m'magulu a zigawenga.

en: "You do not want to stigmatize them and individualize them. They are basically going back to communities where there are a lot of other children, many of whom have suffered from consequences of war, even if they were not recruited. So, you are trying to build services in those communities that are broad services, that would be made available to all those children," Mr. Fontaine said.
ny: "Simukufuna kuwapatsa ulemu ndi kuwaika paokha. Iwo akubwerera kumadera kumene kuli ana ena ambiri, ambiri mwa iwo avutika ndi zotsatira za nkhondo, ngakhale kuti sanalembedwe. Choncho, mukuyesera kumanga ntchito m'madera omwe ndi ntchito zazikulu, zomwe zingaperekedwe kwa ana onsewo", adatero Bambo Fontaine.

en: Mr. Fontaine says, as part of various peace packages in the Great Lakes region, the World Bank and other donors are providing $500 million to help demobilize children. He says, unfortunately, the needed government institutions are not yet in place in some countries to move the process ahead quickly enough. He says that's why UNICEF is pressing to see such structures develop, so that children can get back home and start to lead normal lives once again.
ny: A Fontaine akuti, monga gawo la mapangano osiyanasiyana amtendere m'chigawo cha Great Lakes, Banki Yapadziko Lonse ndi omwe amapereka ndalama zina akupereka $ 500 miliyoni kuti athandize ana kusamuka. Amati, mwatsoka, mabungwe aboma omwe akufunikira sakupezekabe m'maiko ena kuti apititse patsogolo njirayi mwachangu mokwanira. Amati ndichifukwa chake UNICEF ikulimbikira kuti nyumba zoterezi zikhalepo, kuti ana athe kubwerera kwawo ndikuyamba kukhala ndi moyo wabwinobwino.

ny: Anthu a ku Goma Akuyembekeza Kuti Akapanduka Adzachoka M'dzikoli

ny: DRC Ikuimba M23 Mlandu Wopandukira Powombera Rwanda

ny: Palibe gwero la nkhani limene likupezeka

ny: Anthu a M23 Akuchoka Kumalo Awo Kum'mawa kwa Congo

ny: Tanzania Yapempha Uganda Kuti Imuthandize Kukonza Ubale Wake ndi Rwanda

ny: Rwanda Ikuimba mlandu DRC Yowombera Anthu pa Mphepete mwa Malire

ny: US Ikufunsira Atsogoleri Padziko Lonse pa Kuukira Kotheka ku Syria

en: World Bank, Nike Team Up for 'The Girl Effect' Initiative
ny: Banki Yapadziko Lonse, Nike Yogwirizana pa Ntchito ya 'The Girl Effect'

en: The Adolescent Girls Initiative partners the World Bank, the Nike Foundation and governments of developing and developed nations to empower girls in poor countries.
ny: Bungwe la Adolescent Girls Initiative likugwirizana ndi World Bank, Nike Foundation ndi maboma a mayiko otukuka ndi otukuka kuti apatse mphamvu atsikana m'mayiko osauka.

en: The two-year-old program is helping girls in Asia, Africa and the Middle East gain the education and skills they need to transition into the workforce.
ny: Pulogalamu ya zaka ziŵiri imeneyi ikuthandiza atsikana a ku Asia, Africa ndi ku Middle East kupeza maphunziro ndi maluso amene angawafune kuti alowe m'gulu la anthu ogwira ntchito.

en: "My name is Sanchita. I come from a small village called Ishwarpur in Bangladesh," American actress Anne Hathaway delivered her lines as powerfully from behind a podium at the World Bank as she does on the silver screen, telling the story of an impoverished girl.
ny: "Dzina langa ndi Sanchita. Ndimachokera kumudzi wina waung'ono wotchedwa Ishwarpur ku Bangladesh", anatero wojambula wa ku America Anne Hathaway kuchokera kumbuyo kwa podium ku World Bank monga momwe amachitira pazenera la siliva, akufotokoza nkhani ya mtsikana wosauka.

en: "When a baby is born in Ishwarpur, families desperately hope it will be a boy," she continued. "It has been this way for as long as anyone can remember.
ny: Iye anapitiriza kuti: "Mwana akabadwa ku Ishwarpur, mabanja amayembekezera mwachidwi kuti mwana wamwamuna.

en: It is believed that boys will contribute to the family income in a place where people are very poor.
ny: Anthu amakhulupirira kuti anyamata amathandiza kuti banja lizipeza ndalama zambiri m'dera limene anthu ndi osauka kwambiri.

en: "These circumstances are familiar to those who benefit from the Adolescent Girls Initiative.
ny: "Zimenezi n'zozoloŵerana ndi amene amapindula ndi bungwe la Adolescent Girls Initiative.

en: Who benefits?A dozen such teenage girls and young women visited the World Bank from developing Asian, Middle Eastern and African countries.
ny: Kodi ndani amapindula?Ana aakazi ndi akazi achinyamata ambiri oterewa anapita ku Banki Yadziko Lonse kuchokera m'mayiko aku Asia, Middle East ndi Africa.

en: They were just a few of the girls who benefit from training and education programs that help them transition from school to employment.
ny: Iwo anali ochepa chabe mwa atsikana amene amapindula ndi maphunziro ndi maphunziro omwe amawathandiza kusintha sukulu kupita kuntchito.

en: Hathaway told the audience that, with the help of a development organization, Sanchita gained an education and borrowed $60 to buy a cow and start a vegetable garden.
ny: Hathaway anauza omverawo kuti, mothandizidwa ndi bungwe lina la chitukuko, Sanchita anaphunzira ndipo anabwereka madola 60 kuti agule ng'ombe ndi kukhazikitsa munda wa ndiwo zamasamba.

en: The teenage girl could then afford to pay her own school fees, as well as her brother's, and contribute to her family in such a way that Sanchita's parents hope she does not marry any time soon.Hathaway spoke of her own childhood in a comfortable suburban U.S. neighborhood, and of a time when she had no idea about the kind of circumstances Sanchita faced nor how much girls need safe spaces for education.
ny: Mtsikanayo amatha kulipira ndalama zake za sukulu, komanso za mchimwene wake, ndikupereka ndalama zothandizira banja lake mwanjira yoti makolo a Sanchita akuyembekeza kuti sadzakwatirana posachedwa. Hathaway adalankhula za ubwana wake m'mudzi wabwino wa US, komanso nthawi yomwe sanadziwe mtundu wa zochitika zomwe Sanchita adakumana nazo komanso momwe atsikana amafunikira malo otetezeka kuti aphunzire.

en: "Places that could teach them how to take the light they have as girls and ignite the world," explained Hathaway.
ny: "Malo amene angawathandize kutenga kuwala kumene ali nako monga atsikana ndi kuyatsa dziko", anatero Hathaway.

en: "I wouldn't know how much the world needs 'The Girl Effect.'"  Girl power"The Girl Effect" is what the Adolescent Girls Initiative wants to see happen for 600 million girls in developing countries.
ny: "Sindikudziwa kuti dziko likufunikira bwanji 'Mphamvu ya Mtsikana.'" Mphamvu ya Mtsikana"Mphamvu ya Mtsikana" ndicho chimene bungwe la Adolescent Girls Initiative likufuna kuti chichitike kwa atsikana 600 miliyoni m'mayiko osauka.

en: Overall, an estimated one-third of young women in developing nations are not employed and not in school.World Bank President Robert Zoellick said underinvesting in girls impedes development.
ny: Pafupifupi, akuti gawo limodzi mwa magawo atatu a akazi achichepere m'maiko akutukuka alibe ntchito ndipo samapita kusukulu. Pulezidenti wa World Bank Robert Zoellick anati kusowa ndalama kwa atsikana kumalepheretsa chitukuko.

en: He added that educating girls also makes sense for poor families, noting that an extra year of secondary schooling can raise their wages by 10 to 20 percent.
ny: Iye anawonjezera kuti kuphunzitsa atsikana n'kothandiza kwambiri kwa mabanja osauka, ndipo ananena kuti chaka china cha sukulu ya sekondale chingawonjezere malipiro awo ndi 10 mpaka 20 peresenti.

en: "If they earn greater income they also have greater access to reproductive health information and services, so then more likely to delay marriage and childbirth, have healthier babies and attain higher literacy rates," Zoellick said.
ny: Zoellick anati: "Ngati amapeza ndalama zambiri, amakhalanso ndi mwayi wopeza zambiri zokhudza thanzi la ana, choncho amakhala ndi mwayi wochedwa kukwatira ndi kubereka ana, kukhala ndi ana athanzi ndiponso kukhala ndi luso lotha kuwerenga ndi kulemba".

en: "The evidence strongly suggests that investing in adolescent girls is a key way to break inter-generational patterns of poverty."
ny: "Zimene zikuchitikazi zikusonyeza kuti kuika ndalama m'zofuna za atsikana achinyamata ndi njira yabwino yothetsera umphawi umene umakhalapo pakati pa mibadwo".

en: Current operations The Adolescent Girls Initiative public-private partnership, with its $20 million in funds, is already at work in seven countries, with plans to expand to Haiti and Yemen.         Mayra Buvinic talks about the Adolescent Girls Initiative
ny: Ntchito zomwe zikuchitika Panopa The Adolescent Girls Initiative Public-Private Partnership, yomwe ili ndi ndalama zokwana 20 miliyoni, ikugwira ntchito kale m'maiko asanu ndi awiri, ndipo ikufuna kuwonjezera ku Haiti ndi Yemen. Mayra Buvinic akuyankhula za Adolescent Girls Initiative

en: "So where we are in Liberia and Nepal, young women are completing the first rounds of training," explained Mayra Buvinic, director of Gender and Development at the World Bank.
ny: Mayra Buvinic, mkulu wa bungwe la World Bank loona za kugonana ndi chitukuko, anati: "Pamene tili ku Liberia ndi Nepal, atsikana akumaliza maphunziro awo".

en: "In South Sudan, 100 adolescent girls' clubs will have opened in four states by the end of this month. In Jordan, female community college graduates are gaining access to vouchers.
ny: "Ku South Sudan, magulu 100 a atsikana achinyamata adzatsegulidwa m'maiko anayi kumapeto kwa mwezi uno. Ku Jordan, akazi omaliza maphunziro awo a ku koleji akupeza ma voucher.

en: In Afghanistan, Lao PDR and Rwanda, assessments are being completed, and the projects will be launched at the end of this quarter.
ny: Ku Afghanistan, ku Laos ndi ku Rwanda, ntchito zowunikira zikukwaniritsidwa ndipo ntchitozo zidzakhazikitsidwa kumapeto kwa kotala lino.

en: "Thanks and praise Kebbeh Kamara tells the audience how she's benefited from the World Bank/Nike initiative
ny: "Zikomo ndi kutamanda Kebbeh Kamara akuuza omvera momwe wapindulira ndi ntchito ya World Bank / Nike

en: Kebbeh Kamara said she has benefited from training in Greater Monrovia, Liberia.
ny: Kebbeh Kamara ananena kuti wapindula ndi maphunziro a ku Greater Monrovia, Liberia.

en: Wearing a pink dress and sporty black headband decorated with rhinestones, she addressed the World Bank audience from the stage.
ny: Atavala chovala chobiriwira ndi lamba wakuda wamasewera wopangidwa ndi miyala ya mphero, analankhula ndi gulu la anthu a World Bank kuchokera pabwalo.

en: "I learned how to start a business, how to earn money on your own, how to be self-sustainable," she said, "how to save money and what to spend money for.
ny: Iye anati: "Ndinaphunzira mmene ndingayambitsire bizinesi, mmene ndingapezere ndalama ndekha, mmene ndingadzitetezere, mmene ndingapezere ndalama ndi zimene ndingazigwiritse ntchito.

en: " Sarah Poni Saturnino, 19, of Juba, Southern Sudan, told VOA she is enjoying her first trip to the United States and all the empowerment training and activities.
ny: " Sarah Poni Saturnino, wazaka 19, wa ku Juba, South Sudan, anauza VOA kuti akusangalala ndi ulendo wake woyamba wopita ku United States ndi maphunziro onse ndi zochitika za kupatsa mphamvu.

en: She said she hopes to take the lessons she has learned here in workshops back to the Adolescent Girls Initiative clubs in Southern Sudan.
ny: Iye anati akuyembekeza kuti zimene anaphunzira m'masukuluwa adzaphunziranso m'makalabu a Youth Girls Initiative ku South Sudan.

en: "I learned about how to express yourself. Eye contact. Speak loud," explained Saturnino. "This way can give me really a voice to speak in front of people.
ny: "Ndinaphunzira mmene ndingadzifotokozere ndekha. Kuyang'ana. Kulankhula mokweza", anatero Saturnino. "Mfundo imeneyi ingandipatse mawu abwino kwambiri oyankhula pamaso pa anthu.

en: And even if I go back home, I'm not longer Sarah again -- I'm somebody now." Somebody who has earned the admiration of a fellow Southern Sudanese citizen, child-soldier-turned-rapper Emmanuel Jal.
ny: Ndipo ngakhale nditapita kunyumba, sindikhala Sarah kachiwiri -- ndine wina tsopano". Munthu amene walandira ulemu wa nzika ina ya ku South Sudan, mwana-msilikali-womwe anakhala rapper Emmanuel Jal.

en: A supporter of the Adolescent Girls Initiative, Jal performed at the World Bank event.
ny: Jal, yemwe amathandiza bungwe la Adolescent Girls Initiative, anachita nawo mwambo wa World Bank.

en: The girls joined him on stage, beaming as they danced behind him -- as did at least one World Bank official -- while the audience of staffers in business suits took to their feet and raised their hands in the air as well.
ny: Atsikanawo anam'tsatira pabwalo, akuvina kumbuyo kwake - monga anachitira mmodzi wa akuluakulu a World Bank - pamene omvera a antchito okhala ndi zovala za bizinesi anadzuka ndi kukweza manja awo.

en: Activists Press for Better Help to End Congo Rapes
ny: Anthu Olimbikitsa Anthu Akupempha Thandizo Kuti Zochita Zokhudza Kugwiriridwa kwa Anthu ku Congo Zithe

en: As U.N. Special Representative for Sexual Violence In Conflict Margot Wallstrom embarks on a new trip to the Democratic Republic of Congo, two activists recently concluded lobbying efforts in the United States for more effective action on trying to end conflict-related rapes in Congo.
ny: Pamene nthumwi yapadera ya bungwe la United Nations yoona za chiwawa cha kugonana m'mikangano Margot Wallstrom akuyamba ulendo wake watsopano wopita ku Democratic Republic of Congo, anthu awiri omwe akuchita nawo ntchitoyi posachedwapa anamaliza ntchito yawo yolimbikitsa anthu kuti achite zinthu zothandiza kwambiri pofuna kuthetsa nkhanza zachiwawa za m'dziko la Congo.

en: One of them, Justine Masika Bihamba, told a gathering of Washington, D.C., university students and concerned citizens that the area in which she works, Beni, in North Kivu province, is still overrun by Ugandan rebels who regularly rape women.She said in these situations women are considered victims, and are not implicated in the search for peace.
ny: Mmodzi mwa iwo, Justine Masika Bihamba, anauza msonkhano wa ku Washington, D.C., ophunzira a ku yunivesite ndi nzika zokhudzidwa kuti dera lomwe amagwirira ntchito, Beni, m'chigawo cha North Kivu, likupitirizabe kugonjetsedwa ndi zigawenga za ku Uganda zomwe nthawi zonse zimagwiririra akazi.Anati m'mikhalidwe imeneyi akazi amaonedwa ngati ophedwa, ndipo samakhudzidwa ndi kufunafuna mtendere.

en: Striving for peace in the region
ny: Kuyesetsa kuti m'derali mukhale mtendere

en: Bihamba coordinates an organization called the Synergy of Women Against Sexual Violence.
ny: Bihamba akutsogolera bungwe lotchedwa Synergy of Women Against Sexual Violence.

en: Counselors with the group have been attacked and threatened because of their work. When Bihamba was at work one day, Congolese soldiers attacked her home, and sexually assaulted one of her daughters.
ny: Pamene Bihamba anali kuntchito tsiku lina, asilikali a ku Congo anaukira nyumba yake, ndipo anagwiririra mwana wake wamkazi.

en: Bihamba explained that what is needed - above all - is peace in eastern Congo.
ny: Bihamba anafotokoza kuti chofunika koposa zonse ndi mtendere kum'mawa kwa Congo.

en: She said she believes sexual crimes would go down drastically if fighting stopped.
ny: Iye ananena kuti amakhulupirira kuti upandu wa kugonana udzatsika kwambiri ngati nkhondo zidzaleka.

en: Activist Donatella Rostagno, from the European network for Central Africa, accompanied Bihamba on her trip to the United States.
ny: Wochita zinthu wotchedwa Donatella Rostagno, wa bungwe la European Network for Central Africa, anapita ndi Bihamba pa ulendo wake wopita ku United States.

en: She said she supports the work being done by the U.N. special representative for sexual violence in conflict.
ny: Iye anati akuthandiza ntchito imene nthumwi yapadera ya UN yoona za chiwawa cha kugonana m'mikangano ikuchita.

en: Rostagno also said feels, however, the international community is not doing enough to stop Congo's war, despite having a large U.N. peacekeeping mission there.
ny: Rostagno ananenanso kuti akuona kuti mayiko akunja sakuchita mokwanira kuti athetse nkhondo ya ku Congo, ngakhale kuti ali ndi ntchito yaikulu ya UN yokhazikitsa mtendere kumeneko.

en: "The majority of the actions is made to look at the consequences, to work with the women who are victims, but not enough is done to look at the causes of the rapes and the conflict," said Rostagno.
ny: "Zambiri mwazochitikazo zimachitidwa kuti tione zotsatira zake, kuti tigwire ntchito ndi akazi omwe ali ophedwa, koma sizomwe zimachitika kuti tione zomwe zimayambitsa nkhanza ndi mikangano", anatero Rostagno.

en: Deteriorating situation amid global concern
ny: Zinthu zikuipiraipira padziko lonse lapansi

en: She fears the overall situation in eastern Congo is getting worse, not better - despite the international attention - with rebels, militias, and renegade soldiers still running rampant.
ny: Iye akuopa kuti zinthu zikuipiraipira kum'mawa kwa Congo osati kusintha ngakhale kuti mayiko ena akudziwa zimenezi.

en: "A lot of these rebel groups are getting reorganized, and are even getting in a coalition so the movements that we see in the region, it is worrying us," said Rostagno.
ny: "Magulu ambiri a zigawenga akubwezeretsedwanso, ndipo akupanga mgwirizano kotero kuti mayendedwe omwe tikuwona m'derali, akutida nkhawa", adatero Rostagno.

en: "I think we were more optimistic on this region six months ago than today.
ny: "Ndikuganiza kuti miyezi isanu ndi umodzi yapitayo tinali ndi chiyembekezo chochuluka pankhani imeneyi kusiyana ndi mmene zilili masiku ano.

en: "The United Nations has identified three armed groups that gang raped dozens of people about two months ago in a week-long attack in Luvungi, another part of North Kivu province.
ny: "Mitundu Yogwirizana yazindikira magulu atatu ozembetsa amene anagwiririra anthu ambiri m'magulu pafupifupi miyezi iŵiri yapitayo pa chizunzo chimene chinatha mlungu umodzi ku Luvungi, chigawo china cha chigawo cha North Kivu.

en: Those implicated are the Mai Mai Cheka, the Democratic Liberation Forces of Rwanda, and followers of an army deserter, Colonel Emmanuel Nsengiyumva.
ny: Amene akuphatikizidwa ndi a Mai Mai Cheka, a Democratic Liberation Forces of Rwanda, ndi otsatira a msilikali wosauka, Colonel Emmanuel Nsengiyumva.

en: Proposals for improvementDuring their presentation, the two activists, Bihamba and Rostagno, also offered concrete proposals to make the situation better.
ny: Pampikisanowu, a Bihamba ndi a Rostagno anaperekanso malingaliro ena okhudza kusintha zinthu.

en: Rostagno explained that foreign non-governmental organizations get funding to tackle the issue of sexual violence, but local organizations often get ignored.
ny: Rostagno anafotokoza kuti mabungwe a mayiko ena omwe si a boma amalandira ndalama zothandizira kuthetsa vuto la chiwawa cha kugonana, koma mabungwe a m'deralo nthawi zambiri amanyalanyazidwa.

en: She said complex applications to get outside funding favor bigger organizations.
ny: Iye anati ntchito zovuta kupeza ndalama kunja kwa mabungwe akuluakulu.

en: "They can just do it, they send it, they receive the money.
ny: "Akanatha kungochita, kutumiza, kulandira ndalama.

en: The problem is that the money in most cases is spent to pay for the fixed cost of the organization, for the salaries of expat people coming to the region and to the country, while the local non-governmental organizations, those working with the communities, with the women, with the children, in the villages, those who need need money to survive in order to do their work do not have access," said Rostagno.Bihamba said Congolese soldiers should be paid directly through bank withdrawals, rather than being paid through their superiors.
ny: Vuto ndilakuti ndalamazo nthawi zambiri zimagwiritsidwa ntchito kulipira ndalama zoyendetsera bungwe, malipiro a anthu omwe akubwera kudera ndi kudziko, pomwe mabungwe aboma, omwe amagwira ntchito ndi madera, akazi, ana, m'midzi, omwe amafunikira ndalama kuti apulumuke kuti achite ntchito yawo alibe mwayi, "adatero Rostagno.Bihamba adati asirikali aku Congo ayenera kulipidwa mwachindunji kudzera m'mabanki, osati kudzera kwa akuluakulu awo.

en: Bihamba said with the current system they receive only about a third of their salary, which causes some soldiers to loot and rape.
ny: Bihamba anati ndi dongosolo lomwe lilipo tsopano, amalandira gawo limodzi mwa magawo atatu okha a malipiro awo, zomwe zimachititsa kuti asilikali ena apange zinyalala ndi kugwiririra.

en: She also called for an international tribunal for the Congo to help end general impunity, as well as more local tribunals for raped victims to seek justice. In North Kivu, where more than 5 million people are estimated to live, she said there are only three tribunals.
ny: Iye anapempha kuti khoti la mayiko la Congo lizithandiza kuthetsa kusaloledwa chilango, komanso kuti makhoti ambiri a m'deralo a anthu omwe anagwiriridwa apeze chilungamo.

en: Desmond Tutu Retires From Public Life
ny: Desmond Tutu Anasiya Ntchito Zake Zopatsa Anthu Ufulu

en: Desmond Tutu fought apartheid in South Africa, and was critical of the war in Iraq.
ny: Desmond Tutu anamenya nkhondo ya tsankho ku South Africa, ndipo anali wotsutsa nkhondo ya ku Iraq.

en: "We waged a war that shouldn't have happened," he said.He also spoke out against genocide in Rwanda.
ny: "Tinachita nkhondo imene sitikanayenera kuchita", anatero. Ananenanso kuti anthu ambiri akupha anthu ku Rwanda.

en: "God have mercy on us," he said.The retired Anglican archbishop announced in July that he would retire from public life on his birthday."The time has come to slow down, and sip maybe rooibos tea with my beloved wife in the afternoons" he said.
ny: "Mulungu atithandize", anatero.Mkulu wa mabishopu a ku England amene anapuma pantchito analengeza mu July kuti akusiya ntchito yake pa tsiku lobadwa. "Nthawi yakwana yoti ndichepetse, ndipo mwina ndizimwa tiyi wa rooibos ndi mkazi wanga wokondedwa madzulo", anatero.

en: Tutu rose through the ranks of the Anglican church in South Africa to become the first black Anglican archbishop of Capetown.
ny: Tutu anadzuka m'magulu a mpingo wa Anglican ku South Africa kuti akhale mkulu wa mabishopu a ku Cape Town.

en: He was a vocal critic of South Africa's white-ruled government and encouraged non-violence to end apartheid. Tutu was the recipient of many awards, and in 1984, he received a Nobel Peace Prize for advocating "a democratic and just society without racial divisions.
ny: Tutu analandira mphoto zambiri ndipo mu 1984, analandira mphoto ya Nobel Peace chifukwa cholimbikitsa "mbuto yachilungamo komanso yachilungamo yopanda magawano a mitundu.

en: " He used the recognition to step up the anti-apartheid campaign, calling for an economic boycott against South Africa. After the end of apartheid, Tutu called it an incredible day when Nelson Mandela won South Africa's first all-race elections.
ny: "Anatenga mwayi umenewu kuti awonjezere ntchito yolimbana ndi tsankho, ndipo anaitana kuti anthu a ku South Africa achite chipongwe cha anthu a mitundu yosiyanasiyana.

en: "I would say the highest point for me was when I stood on the balcony in 1994 to introduce our new, brand new president to South Africa and the world," he said.
ny: Iye anati: "Ndinganene kuti chinthu chofunika kwambiri kwa ine chinali pamene ndinaima pa balconi mu 1994 kuti ndifotokoze za pulezidenti wathu watsopano ku South Africa ndi dziko lonse lapansi".

en: To help mend the nation, President Mandela appointed Tutu as head of the country's Truth and Reconciliation Commission. The group issued a report that included numerous confessions of guilt under apartheid in return for amnesty.
ny: Pofuna kuthandiza anthu kuti akhale ndi moyo wabwino, Pulezidenti Mandela anasankha Tutu kukhala mtsogoleri wa bungwe la Truth and Reconciliation Commission la dzikoli.

en: "It makes specific proposals on how we can cultivate a culture of human rights and of structures to insure that the atrocities of the past will not reoccur," Tutu said.Tutu also campaigned to fight poverty and AIDS.
ny: "Icho chimapereka malingaliro enieni a mmene tingalimbitse chikhalidwe cha ufulu waumunthu ndi za machitidwe kuti zitsimikizire kuti nkhanza za m'mbuyomu sizidzachitikanso", adatero Tutu.Tutu analinso ndi kampeni yolimbana ndi umphawi ndi Edzi.

en: In recent years, he expressed his disappointment in post-apartheid South Africa, especially the level of violent crime.
ny: M'zaka zaposachedwapa, iye anasonyeza kukhumudwa kwake ndi South Africa ya pambuyo pa chiphunzitso cha tsankho, makamaka mlingo wa upandu wachiwawa.

en: Despite his withdrawal from public life, Tutu says he will continue to support his peace foundation and will remain part of a group of elder statesmen who campaign for peace and human rights.
ny: Ngakhale kuti anasiya ntchito yake, Tutu ananena kuti apitirizabe kuthandiza maziko ake a mtendere ndipo adzakhalabe m'gulu la akuluakulu a boma omwe akuyesetsa kuti pakhale mtendere ndi ufulu wa anthu.

en: But Tutu says he will no longer give interviews and, as he put it, will mostly "shut up."
ny: Koma Tutu akuti sadzaperekanso mafunso ndipo, monga ananenera, "adzakhala chete".

en: "I have been part of our struggle for freedom and democracy, and I am part of the celebration that we did succeed," he said. "I have been part of the post apartheid dispensation and long for us to do infinitely better."Many say his voice will be missed.
ny: Iye anati: "Ndakhala ndi mbali m'kulimbana kwathu ndi ufulu ndi demokalase, ndipo ndili ndi mbali m'chikondwerero chimene tinapambana. Ndakhala ndi mbali m'nthawi ya pambuyo pa chigawenga ndipo ndikufunitsitsa kuti zinthu zizitiyendera bwino kwambiri".Ambiri amanena kuti mawu ake adzakumbukiridwa.

en: Malawi's Jacaranda School for Orphans Celebrates Christmas
ny: Sukulu ya Ana Amasiye ya ku Jacaranda ku Malawi Ikukondwerera Khirisimasi

en: The management for the Jacaranda School for Orphans in Malawis commercial capital Blantyre recently hosted a party for its students as it closed for Christmas and New Years Day holidays.
ny: Akuluakulu a sukulu ya ana amasiye ya Jacaranda ku likulu la malonda la Malawi, Blantyre, posachedwapa anakonza phwando la ophunzira ake pamene sukuluyi inatsekedwa pa maholide a Khirisimasi ndi Chaka Chatsopano.

en: Around 500 people including students, staff members and others from surrounding areas attended the event, which was held at the schools premises in Chigumula area.
ny: Anthu pafupifupi 500 kuphatikizapo ophunzira, ogwira ntchito ndi ena ochokera m'madera ozungulira anapezeka pa mwambowu, womwe unachitikira m'masukulu a m'dera la Chigumula.

en: The party included gifts, Santa Claus, and a "dancing show case" by the students.
ny: Msonkhanowu unaphatikizapo mphatso, Santa Claus, ndi "kuvina chionetsero" ndi ophunzira.

en: The school management told VOA that the yearly celebration has been a school tradition for the past 13years.
ny: Akuluakulu a sukuluyo anauza mawu a ku America kuti mwambo wa chaka ndi chaka wakhala mwambo wa sukulu kwa zaka 13 zapitazi.

en: The school's director, Luc Deschamps, said: "[We feel] it is very important for us to celebrate Christmas because the children do not have parents.
ny: Mkulu wa sukuluyo, Luc Deschamps, anati: "Timaona kuti ndi zofunika kwambiri kuti tizikondwerera Khirisimasi chifukwa ana alibe makolo.

en: They stay with either a grandmother or a distant aunt or uncle, and they are not able to cerebrate at home or have a party or a little bit of sweets and cake for the children. So, we provide a happy day for the children to celebrate the spirit of Christmas. And it is also a way of our children to learn to give."
ny: Iwo amakhala ndi agogo awo kapena azakhali awo, ndipo sangathe kusangalala kunyumba kapena kuchita phwando kapena kuwapatsa anawo maswiti ndi keke. Choncho, timapereka tsiku losangalatsa kwa ana kuti azikondwerera mzimu wa Khirisimasi.

en: No media source currently available
ny: Palibe gwero la nkhani limene likupezeka

en: Deschamps, who is also an Honorary Consul of France in Malawi, said before the main event the patrons were treated to "a nice meal" from the students.
ny: Deschamps, yemwe ndi nthumwi ya France ku Malawi, ananena kuti ophunzirawo "anawapatsa chakudya chabwino" ophunzirawo asanapite ku mwambo waukuluwo.

en: "We had a big, big lunch with good meat and rice,[the dish made from maize flour called] nsima, of course, and vegetables. And it was the students themselves who cooked the meal for everybody, for over 500 people," he said.
ny: Iye anati: "Tinakadya chakudya chamadzulo chachikulu ndi nyama yabwino ndi mpunga, [chakudya chopangidwa ndi ufa wa chimanga wotchedwa] nsima, ndithudi, ndi masamba. Ndipo ophunzirawo ndi amene anaphika chakudyacho kwa aliyense, kwa anthu oposa 500".

en: One of the students, Eddah Zimba, said, "The celebrations are really cool, ... I have enjoyed myself. I have eaten, and now I am here dancing. What has interested me most is the gift that we have received the like the puffs, the biscuits, the squash and the dance."
ny: Mmodzi mwa ophunzirawo, Eddah Zimba, anati: "Maphwandowo ndi abwino kwambiri,... ndasangalala kwambiri. Ndadya, ndipo tsopano ndili pano ndikuvina. Chomwe chinandisangalatsa kwambiri ndi mphatso imene tinalandira monga ma puffs, ma biscuit, squash ndi kuvina".

en: She thanked the schools management for hosting the Christmas party for students who in most cases do not have such celebrations at home.
ny: Iye anayamikira akuluakulu a sukulu chifukwa chochita phwando la Khirisimasi kwa ophunzira amene nthawi zambiri sakondwerera mwambo umenewu kunyumba.

en: Another student Emmanuel Chisale said good meal aside, the event has taught him the spirit of sharing.
ny: Wophunzira wina Emmanuel Chisale anati chakudya chabwino pambali, chochitikacho chamuphunzitsa mzimu wogawana.

en: "This party has brought a change in my life. I have learned that we have to have a heart for sharing one another as the Father Christmas was doing," he said.
ny: Iye anati: "Phwando limeneli lasintha moyo wanga. Ndaphunzira kuti tiyenera kukhala ndi mtima wogawana wina ndi mnzake monga mmene ankachitira Khrisimasi".

en: Founded in 2002, the Jacaranda School for Orphans is the only one in Malawi which provides free primary, secondary and tertiary education to children without parents.
ny: Sukulu ya Jacaranda ya Ana Amasiye, yomwe inakhazikitsidwa mu 2002, ndi yokhayo ku Malawi yomwe imapereka maphunziro a pulayimale, apakati ndi apamwamba kwa ana opanda makolo.

en: A Malawian woman, Marie Da Silva, started the school after she returned from the United States where she spent nineteen years working as a nanny.
ny: Mayi wina wa ku Malawi, dzina lake Marie Da Silva, anayamba sukuluyi atabwerera kuchokera ku United States kumene anagwira ntchito ya kusamalira ana kwa zaka 19.

en: Economists Predict Bumpy Road for Malawi's Economy in 2015
ny: Akatswiri a zachuma alosera kuti zachuma cha ku Malawi chidzakhala choipa kwambiri mu 2015

en: Economists in Malawi say the country is likely to continue facing financial challenges in 2015 unless the government can regain the confidence of donors, who are still withholding 40 percent of budgetary support due to the corruption scandal known as Cashgate. More than $30 million were looted from government coffers in the scandal, and several people, including government officials, were arrested.
ny: Anthu ena a zachuma ku Malawi akuti dzikoli likhoza kupitirizabe kukumana ndi mavuto azachuma mu 2015 pokhapokha ngati boma lingabwezeretse chidaliro cha omwe amapereka ndalama, omwe akukanabe kupereka ndalama zokwana 40 peresenti chifukwa cha ziphuphu zomwe zimadziwika kuti Cashgate.

en: The withholding of donor aid has forced Malawi's government to pass what is known as the Zero Aid national budget for the 2014-2015 fiscal year. Analysts, such as Abel Mwanyungwe, an economics lecturer at the Polytechnic College of the University of Malawi, say the drop in spending has hurt the economy.
ny: Chifukwa cha kusagwirizana kwa ndalama zothandizira anthu, boma la Malawi linakakamizika kupititsa bajeti ya dziko ya Zero Aid ya chaka cha 2014 mpaka 2015.

en: "This has been a bumpy year as we are coming from the Cashgate effects that have quite a major dent on the economys performance. We have seen that in most cases the very delicate and crucial departments and service providers have been affected, in the sense that we dont have enough drugs in the hospitals. In schools, in terms of teachers payments is not in time," said Mwanyungwe.
ny: "Uwu wakhala chaka choipa pamene tikuchokera ku zotsatira za Cashgate zomwe zili ndi vuto lalikulu pa ntchito ya chuma. Tawona kuti nthawi zambiri madera ovuta kwambiri ndi ofunikira kwambiri ndi opereka chithandizo akhudzidwa, m'lingaliro lakuti tilibe mankhwala okwanira m'zipatala. M'masukulu, pankhani ya malipiro a aphunzitsi sichikhala pa nthawi", adatero Mwanyungwe.

en: Mwanyungwe also links Cashgate to the recent depreciation of Malawis currency, the kwacha, which has resulted in strikes by various government workers demanding higher pay.
ny: Mwanyungwe akuphatikizanso Cashgate ndi kuchepa kwa ndalama za ku Malawi, kwacha, kumene kwachititsa kuti ogwira ntchito m'boma achite ziwopsezo za malipiro apamwamba.

en: For example, support staff for the judiciary have been on strike for six weeks, seeking a 45 percent pay increase which the government says it cannot afford because it has no money.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, ogwira ntchito zothandiza oweruza akhala akugwedezeka kwa milungu isanu ndi umodzi, kufunafuna kuwonjezeka kwa malipiro kwa 45 peresenti, zomwe boma likuti silingathe kulipira chifukwa alibe ndalama.

en: Workers at Malawi's Anti-Corruption Bureau went on strike demanding a 70 percent pay raise until the government threatened to forfeit their December salaries if they did not return.
ny: Ogwira ntchito ku Malawi's Anti-Corruption Bureau anachita chionetsero chofuna kuti malipiro awo aukitsidwe ndi 70 peresenti mpaka pamene boma linaopseza kuti likanawataya malipiro awo a mu December ngati sadzabwerera.

en: Mwanyungwe said the government can only avoid further strikes in 2015 if it makes efforts to restore donor confidence in the management of its public finances.
ny: Mwanyungwe anati boma lingapewe kuukira boma m'chaka cha 2015 ngati likuyesetsa kubwezeretsa chidaliro cha opereka ndalama pa kayendetsedwe ka ndalama zake.

en: "My fear is that if we dont have this donor confidence and donor support coming back to the economy, we may force the government to go into serious local borrowing that would lead to serious repercussions in terms of inflation, in terms of interest rates and this may have a sort of catch-catch lose situation," said Mwanyungwe.
ny: "Ndikuopa kuti ngati sitikhala ndi chidaliro cha opereka ndalama komanso thandizo la opereka ndalama kuti tibwerere ku chuma, tikhoza kukakamiza boma kuti lipereke ngongole zazikulu m'deralo zomwe zingayambitse mavuto aakulu pa nkhani ya chiwongoladzanja, pa nkhani ya chiwongoladzanja ndipo izi zingayambitse vuto la kutaya ndalama", adatero Mwanyungwe.

en: The donors are, among other things, demanding that the government prosecute all those involved in the scandal and strengthen its financial management system.
ny: Opereka ndalamawo akupempha pakati pa zinthu zina kuti boma lipereke mlandu kwa onse amene ali ndi mlanduwu komanso kuti lilimbikitse kayendetsedwe kake ka ndalama.

en: Newton Kambala, the president of the Malawi Confederation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry, said the scandal rendered 2014 as "a very bad year for the business sector, because of huge debts that the government owes the private sector."
ny: Newton Kambala, pulezidenti wa Malawi Confederation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry, ananena kuti nkhani imeneyi inachititsa kuti chaka cha 2014 chikhale "chaka choipa kwambiri kwa anthu ogwira ntchito m'mabizinesi chifukwa cha ngongole yaikulu imene boma lili nayo kwa anthu wamba".

en: He warned that if the situation persists, "2015 will be worse."
ny: Iye anachenjeza kuti ngati zinthu zikupitirizabe kukhala choncho, "chaka cha 2015 chidzakhala choipa kwambiri".

en: In his state of the nation address last Saturday, Malawi president Peter Mutharika said his government is doing everything possible to address the problems caused by the Cashgate scandal.
ny: M'mawu ake a dziko Lachiwiri, pulezidenti wa Malawi, Peter Mutharika, anati boma lake likuchita zonse zotheka kuthetsa mavuto obwera chifukwa cha mlandu wa Cashgate.

en: "My government has strengthened the financial system to make sure that Cashgate never occurs again in Malawi. We have resourced fairly well the law enforcement institutions, including the Anti-Corruption Bureau, so that they do a thorough independent job, prosecute all suspects, and recover the stolen resources where possible," said Mutharika.
ny: "Boma langa lalimbitsa dongosolo la zachuma kuti liwonetsetse kuti Cashgate sichichitika ku Malawi. Tapeza ndalama zambiri kwa mabungwe okhazikitsa malamulo, kuphatikizapo Anti-Corruption Bureau, kuti achite ntchito yolimba, kutsutsa onse omwe akuwakayikira, ndi kubwezeretsa chuma chobedwa ngati kuli kotheka", adatero Mutharika.

en: Mutharika also said his government is implementing newly-adopted fiscal reforms that seek to grow the countrys economy by 5.5 percent in 2014, up from an estimated 5.0 percent in 2013.
ny: Mutharika adatinso boma lake likugwiritsa ntchito zosintha zachuma zomwe zidakhazikitsidwa kumene zomwe zikufuna kukulitsa chuma cha dzikoli ndi 5.5 peresenti mu 2014, kuchokera pa 5.0 peresenti yoyerekeza mu 2013.

en: Malawi to Conduct Door-to-Door HIV Testing
ny: Malawi Idzayesa HIV Kunyumba ndi Nyumba

en: Malawians have mixed reactions to government plans to introduce door-to door HIV testing early next year. Supporters say the step is urgently needed because 100 Malawians get infected each day, and an average of 138 die from AIDS daily. Minister of Health Jean Kalirani announced the plans during the recent commemoration of World AIDS Day in the northern district of Karonga.
ny: Anthu a ku Malawi akuganiza kuti boma likufuna kuyambitsa kuyesa anthu kuti azitha kuyesa anthu a HIV kunyumba ndi nyumba kumayambiriro kwa chaka chamawa. Anthu ena amanena kuti zimenezi n'zofunika kwambiri chifukwa chakuti anthu 100 a ku Malawi amafa ndi matendawa tsiku lililonse ndipo pafupifupi anthu 138 amafa ndi matendawa tsiku lililonse.

en: "We will go in the villages asking for blood samples to check whether that person is HIV positive or not. And those that will be found HIV positive will definitely be given the care they need. And those who are found negative will also be counseled so that they remain negative," said Kalirani.
ny: "Tidzapita kumidzi kukapempha zitsanzo za magazi kuti tione ngati munthuyo ali ndi HIV kapena ayi. Ndipo omwe adzapezeka kuti ali ndi HIV ndithu adzapatsidwa chithandizo chomwe akufunikira. Ndipo omwe adzapezeka kuti ali ndi HIV adzaperekedwanso upangiri kuti akhalebe ndi HIV", adatero Kalirani.

en: Kalirani said the campaign will start in mid-March and will aim to reach everyone in the country, including people who are far from health facilities that provide HIV testing and counseling services. She said the campaign is in line with the goal of ending HIV infection by 2030. Malawi's HIV infection rate is currently at 10 percent, a slight drop from three years ago.
ny: Kalirani adati kampeniyi iyamba pakati pa Marichi ndipo idzafika kwa aliyense mdzikolo, kuphatikiza anthu omwe ali kutali ndi malo azaumoyo omwe amapereka chithandizo cha HIV. Iye adati kampeniyi ikugwirizana ndi cholinga choletsa matenda a HIV pofika 2030.

en: The announcement has raised fears in some Malawians, such as Steven Jailosi, a primary school teacher in rural Blantyre, who feel the campaign will likely infringe upon peoples privacy.
ny: Chilengezochi chachititsa kuti anthu ena a ku Malawi, monga Steven Jailosi, mphunzitsi wa sukulu ya pulayimale m'dera la kumidzi la Blantyre, aziopa kuti ntchitoyi idzawononga ufulu wa anthu.

en: "I think it is not okay because they will be invading our privacy. HIV testing is supposed to be private. No one is supposed to know that I went for an HIV testing unless I make a choice to tell them," said Jailosi.
ny: "Ndikuganiza kuti zilibe vuto chifukwa adzasokoneza zinsinsi zathu. Kuyesedwa kwa HIV kuyenera kukhala kwachinsinsi. Palibe amene ayenera kudziwa kuti ndinapita kukafufuzidwa kwa HIV pokhapokha nditapanga chisankho chowauza", adatero Jailosi.

en: Ester Makonokaya, a secretary in Blantyre, said that although she has been tested already, she feels the door-to-door HIV testing will violate people's privacy.
ny: Ester Makonokaya, mlembi wa ku Blantyre, ananena kuti ngakhale kuti iye wayesedwa kale, akuona kuti kuyesedwa kwa khomo ndi khomo kwa HIV kudzaphwanya chinsinsi cha anthu.

en: "Government should instead take the mobile clinics to the villages where people will be able to access them on their own rather than taking testing in their homes, because that might mean that some of the people who are not supposed to know other peoples status will know because, you know, when someone has been tested you show some reactions," said Makonokaya.
ny: "Boma liyenera kupita ndi zipatala zoyendera anthu m'midzi kumene anthu angathe kupita nazo okha m'malo mochita mayeso m'nyumba zawo, chifukwa zimenezi zingachititse kuti anthu ena amene sayenera kudziwa mmene anthu ena alili adzadziwa chifukwa, mukudziwa, munthu akafunsidwa, mumasonyeza kuti mukuchita zinthu zina", anatero Makonokaya.

en: Macpherson Maulana, a journalist in Blantyre and a producer of radio programs on health, told VOA that government would do better to educate Malawians on the need for HIV testing so that people will go for tests on their own "without being pushed."
ny: Macpherson Maulana, mtolankhani wa ku Blantyre komanso wofalitsa wa wailesi pa nkhani zaumoyo, anauza mawu a AMERICA kuti boma lingachite bwino kuphunzitsa anthu a ku Malawi kufunika kochita mayeso a HIV kuti anthu azipita kukachita mayeso okha "popanda kukakamizidwa".

en: "I fear it could end up into fights. You see it happened in Liberia recently where people who were coming to help people suspected to have contracted Ebola were even killed. So, civic education is the most important element for people to be encouraged to come out for testing voluntarily," said Maulana.
ny: Maulana anati: "Ndikuopa kuti zingayambitse nkhondo. Mukuona kuti zinachitika posachedwa ku Liberia kumene anthu amene ankabwera kudzathandiza anthu omwe akuganiza kuti ali ndi kachilombo ka Ebola anaphedwa. Choncho, maphunziro a anthu ndi chinthu chofunika kwambiri kuti anthu azilimbikitsidwa kuti azipita kukachita mayeso mwaufulu".

en: However, HIV/AIDS counselor David Odali, whose NGO Umunthu Foundation runs HIV-related projects, insisted privacy will be protected.
ny: Komabe, mlangizi wa HIV/AIDS David Odali, yemwe bungwe lake la Umunthu Foundation limayang'anira ntchito zokhudzana ndi HIV, anaumirira kuti chinsinsi chidzatetezedwa.

en: "Confidentiality will be upheld. Lets consider the household setup. I think the first thing would be to provide group counseling to members of that family. [Of course] people can be tested while others are watching, but when it comes to disclosing the results, a counselor is supposed to disclose that results to each and every individual separately," said Odali.
ny: Odali anati: "Zinsinsi zidzatsatiridwa. Tiyeni tione mmene banja limapangidwira. Ndimaganiza kuti chinthu choyamba ndi kupereka malangizo a gulu kwa anthu a m'banja limenelo. [Ndithudi] anthu akhoza kuyesedwa pamene ena akuyang'ana, koma pankhani youlula zotsatira, mlangizi ayenera kufotokoza zotsatirazo kwa munthu aliyense payekha".

en: Odali said it will be up to the person who has been tested to disclose his or her status.
ny: Odali ananena kuti munthu amene wachitidwa mayesoyo ndi amene adzasonyeze mmene alili.

en: In 2006, the charity Development Aid from People to People conducted door-to-door HIV testing in the district of Thyolo and Blantyre, reaching 400,000 people. The organization says it worked well.
ny: Mu 2006, bungwe lachitetezo la anthu la Development Aid, lomwe ndi bungwe lochitira anthu ena chifundo, linapereka mayeso a HIV kunyumba ndi nyumba m'madera a Thyolo ndi Blantyre, ndipo anthu 400,000 anafika.

en: Water Crisis Raises Fears of Waterborne Disease in Malawi
ny: Mavuto a Madzi Akuchititsa Kuti Anthu A Malawi Aziopa Matenda Omwe Amapezeka M'madzi

en: Malawians in the country's commercial capital, Blantyre, usually rely on tap water. But for the past five months, the taps have often run dry, forcing residents to draw water from unprotected sources like rivers and wells, while work is being done at the city main pumping station.The risk of contracting water-borne diseases is rising.
ny: Anthu a ku Malawi omwe amakhala mumzinda wa Blantyre, womwe ndi likulu la malonda m'dzikoli, nthawi zambiri amadalira madzi a m'mphepete mwa madzi. Koma kwa miyezi isanu yapitayi, mipopeyi yakhala ikuuma, ndipo anthu akukhala m'mphepete mwa madziwa akuyenera kutengera madzi kuchokera kumitima yosatetezedwa monga mitsinje ndi akasupe, pomwe ntchito zikuchitika pa siteshoni yayikulu yopumira.

en: In Blantyre and surrounding areas, residents have spent five days without tap water.
ny: M'dera la Blantyre ndi madera ena, anthu akhala masiku asanu opanda madzi a m'mphepete mwa mtsinje.

en: Women, who by Malawi tradition are responsible for household tasks, complain of the risks they face when fetching water from rivers far from residential areas.
ny: Akazi, amene malinga ndi mwambo wa ku Malawi ali ndi udindo wochita ntchito zapakhomo, amadandaula za ngozi zimene amakumana nazo pamene akutsitsa madzi kuchokera m'mitsinje kutali ndi malo okhala.

en: Rhoda Milanzi, a housewife and mother of three, tells VOA the journeys through bushy footpaths are risky. "We wake up every day 2 a.m., sometimes 1 a.m., to go and collect water. There are so many risks. You see, sometimes we would meet witches, snakes on the way," she says, "even hyenas have been chasing us."
ny: Mayi wina wa ku America dzina lake Rhoda Milanzi, yemwe ndi mayi wa ana atatu, anauza VOA kuti kuyenda m'misewu ya m'nkhalango ndi koopsa. Iye anati: "Timauka m'mawa uliwonse pa 2 koloko m'mawa, nthawi zina pa 1 koloko m'mawa, kuti tikapeze madzi.

en: Milanzi says to ease the burden of carrying water home for bathing, women prefer to bathe in the river. But she says they have been disturbed by youths who hide in the nearby bush.
ny: Milanzi ananena kuti kuti akazi amakonda kusamba mumtsinje kuti asatengere madzi kunyumba kwawo kuti asambe, koma ananena kuti amasokonezedwa ndi achinyamata amene amabisala m'nkhalango ya pafupi.

en: "These youths of today would come there and hide somewhere to see us naked. This has been a major embarrassment. In fact we complained to the chiefs about it.
ny: "Achichepere a masiku ano ankabwera kumeneko ndi kubisala kwinakwake kuti atione tili maliseche. Zimenezi zakhala zochititsa manyazi kwambiri.

en: They punished some of them, but you know they would sometimes climb trees just to look at older women like us taking a bath," she explains.
ny: Ena mwa iwo anawalanga, koma mukudziwa kuti nthaŵi zina ankakwera mitengo kuti akaone akazi achikulire ngati ife akusamba", akufotokoza motero.

en: The water problem also has affected the delivery of health services.
ny: Vuto la madzi lakhudzanso ntchito zaumoyo.

en: Three weeks ago, authorities at Queen Elizabeth Central Hospital in Blantyre confirmed that they had suspended surgical operations due to water scarcity.
ny: Masabata atatu apitawo, akuluakulu a m'chipatala cha Queen Elizabeth ku Blantyre anatsimikizira kuti asilikali a bomawo asiya kuchita opaleshoni chifukwa cha kuchepa kwa madzi.

en: Health rights campaigners warn of the possible outbreak of waterborne diseases, especially in densely populated areas, if the situation is left unresolved.
ny: Anthu amene amalimbikitsa ufulu wa anthu pa nkhani ya thanzi amachenjeza za matenda opatsirana ndi madzi, makamaka m'madera okhala anthu ambiri, ngati zinthu sizikuthetsedwa.

en: Officials at the Blantyre Water Board attribute the problem largely to an ongoing European Union-funded project that seeks to install new pumping machines at Walkers Ferry, the main pumping station.  Priscilla Mateyu, the spokesperson for the Blantyre Water Board, says the project is expected to increase water production capacity to 105,000 cubic meters per day from the current daily production of 78,000 cubic meters.
ny: Akuluakulu a Blantyre Water Board amanena kuti vutoli likubwera chifukwa cha ntchito imene ikuchitika ndipo ikugwiritsidwa ntchito ndi bungwe la European Union pofuna kukhazikitsa makina atsopano opumira pamadzi ku Walkers Ferry, yomwe ndi malo akuluakulu opumira.

en: "January is when the project is finishing. But for the new machines and everything else to start working properly, we have to wait until March [2015]. That's when we expect the levels would increase and also production capacity improving to least what we expect it to be," Mateyu said.
ny: Mateyu anati: "Mwezi wa January ndi pamene ntchitoyi ikutha. Koma kuti makina atsopano ndi zina zonse ziyambike kugwira ntchito bwino, tiyenera kudikira mpaka March [2015]. Pamenepo tikuyembekeza kuti mitengoyo idzawonjezeka komanso mphamvu yopanga idzawonjezeka mpaka kuchepera zomwe tikuyembekeza kuti zikhale",

en: The local consumer rights watchdog, the Consumers Association of Malawi, had been planning to hold vigils at the water board until the water supply was normalized, but the board asked protesters to hold off, promising to distribute water to residents through mobile water tanks.  The consumer rights group has given the water board two weeks to fulfill its commitment before proceeding with the protests.
ny: Bungwe loyang'anira ufulu wa ogula m'deralo, Consumer Association of Malawi, linali kukonzekera kuchita ma vigils pa water board mpaka madzi atagwira ntchito, koma board idafunsa omwe akuyimilira kuti asiye, ndikulonjeza kuti adzagawira madzi kwa anthu kudzera m'matangi amadzi oyenda. Gulu loteteza ufulu wa ogula lapereka milungu iwiri ku water board kuti akwaniritse zomwe adalonjeza asanapitilize zionetserozo.

en: Malawi President Under Fire for Giving Money to Journalists
ny: Pulezidenti wa Malawi Akuvutitsidwa Chifukwa Chopatsa Ndalama Atolankhani

en: Malawi President Peter Mutharika is under fire for giving envelopes containing $125 to more than 80 media people at a dinner he hosted last month in Blantyre. The editor of the privately owned Times Television said reporters were told the envelopes contained the presidents plans for the media - which has been critical of the governments economic performance.
ny: Pulezidenti wa Malawi Peter Mutharika akuzunzidwa chifukwa chopereka envelopu zokhala ndi madola 125 kwa anthu oposa 80 a m'ma TV pa chakudya chamadzulo chomwe anachitira mwezi watha ku Blantyre.

en: In his column published in Malawis Sunday Times newspaper, editor Grecian Tukula said he was not sure why the money was given to journalists at the state dinner.
ny: M'nkhani yake yofalitsidwa m'nyuzipepala ya Malawi Sunday Times, mkonzi wa magaziniyi, Mgiriki Tukula, ananena kuti sakudziwa chifukwa chake ndalamazo zinaperekedwa kwa atolankhani pa chakudya chamadzulo cha boma.

en: Tukula said he initially decided to return the money but reversed the decision to avoid "creating a scene."
ny: Tukula ananena kuti poyamba anaganiza zobwezera ndalamazo koma anasintha maganizo ake kuti asapangitse "zinthu zina".

en: But the editor for the Weekend Nation newspaper, George Kasakula, told VOA that he returned the money right away.
ny: Koma mkonzi wa nyuzipepala ya Weekend Nation, George Kasakula, anauza VOA kuti anabweza ndalamazo mwamsanga.

en: "I just felt it was not right for me to receive the money, so I returned it. My understanding is that if someone invites me to a workshop, its their duty to ensure that they feed me, they accommodate me and they transport me. But in this case, I didnt see why I should get that allowance because I didnt spend anything to go to Sanjika [Palace]," said Kasakula.
ny: Kasakula anati: "Ndinangoona kuti sindinali wolungama kulandira ndalamazo, choncho ndinabwezera ndalamazo. Ndikudziwa kuti ngati wina anditenga kupita ku msonkhano, ndi udindo wake kuonetsetsa kuti amadyetsa, amandinyamula ndi kundiyendetsa. Koma pa nkhaniyi, sindinaone chifukwa chake ndiyenera kulandira ndalamazo chifukwa sindinalipire chilichonse kuti ndipite ku Sanjika [Palace]",

en: The issue has attracted more public attention after privately owned Capital Radio aired a story questioning the meaning of the cash handouts from the president.
ny: Nkhaniyi yakopa chidwi cha anthu ambiri pambuyo poti Capital Radio yaumwini inaulutsa nkhani yofunsa tanthauzo la ndalama zomwe pulezidenti anapereka.

en: "As Capital FM we serve the interest of the public. This issue has been all over the social media, and even we as a media are implicated [we believe] it is paramount that we follow up and get to the bottom of the matter," said Steven Dakalira, the head of news and current affairs at Capital Radio.
ny: "Popeza Capital FM timatumikira anthu onse. Nkhaniyi yakhala ikufalikira pa malo ochezera a pa Intaneti, ndipo ngakhale ife monga atolankhani timakhudzidwa [tikukhulupirira] kuti ndikofunikira kwambiri kuti titsatire ndi kupeza mfundo zenizeni za nkhaniyi", atero Steven Dakalira, mkulu wa nkhani ndi zochitika zamakono ku Capital Radio.

en: In his column in the Nyasa Times, Malawi professor of law Danwood Mzikenge Chirwa said what President Mutharika did by giving money handouts to journalists at a news event was tantamount to bribery. He has called on Mutharika to resign or face impeachment proceedings.
ny: M'nkhani yake mu nyuzipepala ya Nyasa Times, pulofesa wa zamalamulo ku Malawi Danwood Mzikenge Chirwa anati zomwe Purezidenti Mutharika anachita popereka ndalama kwa atolankhani pa mwambowu zinali zofanana ndi ziphuphu.

en: Local civil society groups said that "by attempting to bribe the journalists" Mutharika subjected his leadership style to disrepute.
ny: Magulu a anthu wamba m'derali ananena kuti "pofuna kupusitsa atolankhani" Mutharika anachititsa kuti atsogoleri ake asadzakhale ndi mbiri yabwino.

en: Meanwhile, some journalists are donating the money to charity.
ny: Panthaŵiyi, atolankhani ena akupereka ndalamazo ku ntchito zachifundo.

en: Brian Ligomeka, the Managing Editor for the Times Group, told Times Television that all four employees there have donated the money to an orphanage.
ny: Brian Ligomeka, Mkonzi Woyang'anira wa Times Group, anauza a Times Television kuti antchito onse anayi kumeneko apereka ndalamazo ku nyumba ya ana amasiye.

en: "At first we decided to return the money to the president but we later thought it wise to buy assorted items like sugar, salt, notebooks and donate it to needy children," said Ligomeka.
ny: Ligomeka anati: "Poyamba tinaganiza zobwezera ndalamazo kwa pulezidenti koma kenako tinaganiza kuti ndi nzeru kugula zinthu zosiyanasiyana monga shuga, mchere, mabuku ndi kuzipereka kwa ana osowa".

en: In his latest Sunday Times column, Raphael Tenthani, who also writes for BBC, apologized on behalf of other journalists "for letting down the public that trust journalists unreservedly."
ny: M'nkhani yake yaposachedwapa ya Sunday Times, Raphael Tenthani, yemwe amalembanso nkhani za BBC, anapepesa m'malo mwa atolankhani ena "popeza kuti anakhumudwitsa anthu amene amakhulupirira kwambiri atolankhani".

en: Tenthani has since donated the money for charity work and said that although the journalists could have done better if they returned the money right away, doing so would have been perceived as disrespect to the head of state.
ny: Tenthani wapereka ndalamazo kuti azichita ntchito zachifundo ndipo ananena kuti ngakhale atolankhani akanatha kuchita bwino ngati akanabwezera ndalamazo nthawi yomweyo, kuchita zimenezo kukanakhala kusamvera kwa mtsogoleri wa dziko.

en: Maclan Kanyangwa, who heads the Department of Journalism and Media Studies at the Polytechnic College of the University of Malawi, said a media code of ethics bars journalists from accepting payment on a story.
ny: Maclan Kanyangwa, yemwe akutsogolera Dipatimenti ya Zolemba ndi Zophunzira pa Zamalonda ku Polytechnic College ya University of Malawi, ananena kuti malamulo a chikhalidwe cha atolankhani amaletsa atolankhani kulandira malipiro pa nkhani.

en: "Obviously the meeting at the palace was the newsworthy event. There was a possibility that something was going to be published. And in the event that this payment would have influenced journalist decision [on news judgment], then that becomes a problem," said Kanyangwa.
ny: "Zachidziwikire kuti msonkhanowu unachitikira m'nyumba yachifumu ndipo unali nkhani yofunika kwambiri. Panali kuthekera kuti chinachake chidzafalitsidwa. Ndipo ngati malipirowa akanakhudza chisankho cha mtolankhani [pa chiweruzo cha nkhani], ndiye kuti zimakhala vuto", adatero Kanyangwa.

en: Kanyangwa said he feels many journalists failed to return the money immediately because they might have been out of their ethical senses when they got the money.
ny: Kanyangwa anati akuona kuti atolankhani ambiri sanabwezere ndalamazo chifukwa mwina analibe nzeru pamene analandira ndalamazo.

en: Efforts to talk to Presidential Press Officer Fredrick Ndala were not successful. But some government authorities say the payment was not a bribe but meant for a fuel refund to those who attended the night event.
ny: Anthu ena amene ankafuna kulankhula ndi Pulezidenti Fredrick Ndala sanathe, koma akuluakulu ena a boma ananena kuti ndalamazo sizinaperekedwe ngati ziphuphu koma zinali zoti anthu amene anapezeka pamwambowu abwezeredwe mafuta.

en: Report: Manufacturing Could Free Poorest Nations From Poverty
ny: Lipoti: Kupanga Zinthu Zopanga Kungathandize Kuti Anthu Osauka Asakhale M'ndende

en: A new United Nations report urges the poorest countries in the world to shift from low- to high-productivity activities to improve their economies.
ny: Lipoti latsopano la United Nations likulimbikitsa mayiko osauka kwambiri padziko lonse kuti asinthe zinthu zimene amachita kuti azitha kuchita zinthu zochepa n'kuyamba kuchita zinthu zokolola kwambiri.

en: In its annual Least Developed Countries Report, UNCTAD — the U.N. Conference on Trade and Development — says these countries must structurally transform their economies to free themselves from the "poverty trap," which is stunting economic growth and development.
ny: M'kalata yake ya pachaka yonena za mayiko osauka kwambiri, bungwe la UNCTAD  la bungwe la United Nations Conference on Trade and Development  limati mayiko ameneŵa ayenera kusintha chuma chawo kuti asamasuke mu "msampha wa umphawi", umene ukulepheretsa kukula kwa chuma ndi chitukuko.

en: Of the 48 nations the U.N. considers "Least Developed Countries" (LDCs), only one, Laos, is on track to achieve all seven of the Millennium Development Goals (MDG's) by 2015.
ny: Pa mayiko 48 amene UN imawaona kuti ndi "Mayiko Ochepa Kupita Patsogolo" (LDCs), ndi amodzi okha, Laos, omwe ali pa njira yoti akwaniritse zolinga zonse zisanu ndi ziwiri za Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) pofika chaka cha 2015.

en: Only four African countries — Ethiopia, Malawi, Rwanda and Uganda — are likely to meet a majority of these targets.
ny: Mayiko anayi okha a ku Africa  Ethiopia, Malawi, Rwanda ndi Uganda  ndi amene angakwanitse kukwaniritsa zolinga zambiri.

en: This assessment is particularly grim in light of the even greater challenges awaiting these countries in the coming years. The MDGs set a goal for nations to halve their poverty levels by 2015. The so-called Sustainable Development Goals, which carry on from where the MDGs leave off, call for eradication of poverty by 2030.
ny: Kufufuza kumeneku n'koipa kwambiri chifukwa cha mavuto aakulu amene akuyembekezera mayiko amenewa m'zaka zikubwerazi. Zolinga za MDGs zinati mayiko azichepetsa umphawi wawo ndi theka pofika mu 2015.

en: According to Taffere Tesfachew, an UNCTAD official who works with African nations, it would be nothing short of a miracle for the LDCs to pull this off.
ny: Malinga ndi kunena kwa Taffere Tesfachew, mkulu wa UNCTAD amene amagwira ntchito ndi mayiko a ku Africa, sizingakhale zozizwitsa kuti mayiko a LDC akwanitse kuchita zimenezi.

en: In order for the least developed countries to achieve this miraculous performance, he says they will need to structurally change their economies.
ny: Kuti mayiko osauka kwambiri akwaniritse zimenezi, iye anati adzafunika kusintha chuma chawo.

en: He tells VOA this means shifting labor from activities with low productivity, such as small-scale agriculture and services to more dynamic activities with higher productivity, such as manufacturing and high-value services.
ny: Iye akuuza mawu a AMerica kuti izi zikutanthauza kusamutsa ntchito kuchokera ku ntchito zokhala ndi zokolola zochepa, monga ulimi wamng'ono ndi ntchito zothandiza anthu, kupita ku ntchito zowonjezereka zokhala ndi zokolola zambiri, monga kupanga ndi ntchito zamtengo wapatali.

en: "Countries that have moved up are the ones that are creating opportunities for those that are leaving agriculture to engage in things where they add value, where they get training and as it happens, manufacturing tends to have that sort of feature, that is why this call for manufacturing," he said. "Countries that are using policies to shift and influence capital and labor to move into this activity sector tend to do better."
ny: Iye anati: "M'mayiko amene asintha zinthu, anthu amene achoka pa ntchito zaulimi akutha kuchita zinthu zimene zimawonjezera phindu, zimene zimawaphunzitsa, ndipo chifukwa cha zimenezi, ntchito yopanga zinthu imakhala ndi khalidwe limeneli.

en: Tesfachew says these high-productivity sectors tend to pay higher wages and create a demand for goods. This, he says, encourages investment.
ny: A Tesfachew amanena kuti ntchito zoterezi zimene zimapanga zinthu zambiri zimachititsa kuti anthu azilipira malipiro apamwamba ndiponso kuti anthu azifuna katundu.

en: On the surface, it appears that the LDCs are not doing badly. UNCTAD economic data show growth in these poor countries between 2002 and 2008 exceeded the seven percent target set by the international community. And, even after the 2008 financial crisis, UNCTAD notes the LDCs grew faster than other developing countries, at an average of 5.7 percent per year.
ny: Pa maonekedwe a kunja, zikuoneka kuti mayiko a LDC sakuchita bwino. Deta za zachuma za UNCTAD zikusonyeza kuti kukula kwa mayiko osauka ameneŵa pakati pa 2002 ndi 2008 kunaposa chifuno cha 7% choikidwa ndi gulu la mayiko apadziko lonse. Ndipo ngakhale pambuyo pa mavuto azachuma a 2008, UNCTAD imanena kuti mayiko a LDC anakula mofulumira kuposa mayiko ena akupita patsogolo, ndi pafupifupi 5.7% pachaka.

en: But U.N. economists say the outlook for the least developed countries in the short and medium term remains uncertain. They say increasing peoples productivity is the best way to break the patter of human and economic underdevelopment that continues to entrap them in poverty.
ny: Koma akatswiri a zachuma a bungwe la United Nations amanena kuti zinthu zimene zikuchitika m'mayiko osauka kwambiri pa nthawi yochepa komanso ya pakati pa zaka zikadali zosatsimikizika. Iwo amanena kuti kuwonjezeka kwa ntchito za anthu ndi njira yabwino kwambiri yothetsera vuto la kusatukuka kwa anthu ndi chuma limene likupitirizabe kuwagwira m'ndende.

en: UN: Most African Nations to Miss 2015 MDG Goals
ny: UN: Mayiko Ambiri a ku Africa Adzasowa Zolinga za MDG za 2015

en: Most African countries will not reach the Millennium Development Goals set for 2015 because of the gap between economic and human development. That is one of the conclusions in this years annual U.N. report on the Least Developed Countries, presented Thursday.
ny: Dziko la Africa silingafikire zolinga za zaka chikwi za chitukuko za 2015 chifukwa cha kusiyana pakati pa chitukuko cha zachuma ndi chitukuko cha anthu. Ichi ndi chimodzi mwa mfundo zimene zafotokozedwa m'lipoti la UN la chaka chino la mayiko osauka kwambiri, lomwe linaperekedwa Lachinayi.

en: Junior Davis, U.N. economic affairs officer for Africa, said African countries have not been able to translate their economic growth into structural transformation.
ny: Mkulu wa bungwe la United Nations loona za chuma ku Africa, dzina lake Junior Davis, ananena kuti mayiko a ku Africa sanathe kusintha chuma chawo kuti chikhale njira yokhazikitsira zinthu.

en: "We think that is the case because these countries have not focused efficiently on building what we call their productive capacities," Davis said. "These are the basic human and economic development capacities that are needed to promote sustainable economic development. And the MDG, as they were constructed, largely ignored the need to develop the productive capacities."
ny: "Tikuganiza kuti zimenezi zili choncho chifukwa chakuti mayiko ameneŵa sanayambe kuganizira kwambiri za kumanga zimene timazitcha kuti mphamvu zawo zopangira zinthu", anatero Davis. "Izi ndi mphamvu zoyambira za chitukuko cha anthu ndi zachuma zimene zimafunika kuti chitukuko cha zachuma chikhale cholimba. Ndipo zolinga za zaka za m'ma 2000 zinamangidwa, ndipo zinanyalanyaza kufunika kokonza mphamvu zopangira zinthu".

en: Slow progress
ny: Kupita patsogolo pang'onopang'ono

en: African countries also are not on course to halve poverty by 2015, and their overall progress on reducing hunger is relatively slow. Poverty limits human development and undermines productivity. And economic development is needed to make gains in human development.
ny: Komanso mayiko a ku Africa sakufuna kuchepetsa umphawi mpaka theka pofika chaka cha 2015, ndipo zinthu zimene zikuchitika pochepetsa njala n'zochepa kwambiri. Umphawi umalepheretsa anthu kukula ndipo umafooketsa zokolola. Ndipo chitukuko cha zachuma n'chofunika kuti anthu apindule.

en: Ethiopia, Rwanda, Uganda and Malawi are the only African countries on track to reach the majority of the development goals. They are making progress because they heavily invested in areas that create sustainable development such as infrastructure, health and education.
ny: Dziko la Ethiopia, Rwanda, Uganda ndi Malawi ndi mayiko okhawo a ku Africa omwe ali pa njira yabwino yokwaniritsira zolinga zambiri za chitukuko. Iwo akupita patsogolo chifukwa chakuti apanga ndalama zambiri m'madera omwe amapanga chitukuko chokhalitsa monga zomangamanga, thanzi ndi maphunziro.

en: The post-2015 development agenda for fragile countries where governance remains an issue — such as South Sudan and the Democratic Republic of Congo — will still largely depend on support from the international community to achieve social and economic development, Davis said.
ny: Pulogalamu ya chitukuko pambuyo pa 2015 ya mayiko osatetezeka kumene kulamulira kumakhalabe nkhani  monga South Sudan ndi Democratic Republic of Congo  idzadalirabe thandizo la mayiko ena kuti akwaniritse chitukuko cha chikhalidwe ndi chuma, adatero Davis.

en: Improvements in rural development, industrial productivity, agriculture and the services sectors in these countries will require "ways in which we can have a pattern of growth which is not just sustainable but jobs-rich," Davis said. "Because we see the growth in jobs and employment is central to any development strategy that aims to reduce poverty in a sustainable way."
ny: Pofuna kuti zinthu ziziyenda bwino m'mayiko amenewa, m'mayiko ena, m'madera a kumidzi, m'makampani, m'zochita zaulimi komanso m'madera a ntchito, pamafunika "njira zimene tingakhalire ndi njira yokhalira ndi chitukuko chosatha komanso chopatsa anthu ntchito zambiri", anatero Davis. "Chifukwa chakuti tikuona kuti kukula kwa ntchito ndi ntchito n'kofunika kwambiri pa njira iliyonse yachitukuko yochepetsera umphawi moyenera".

en: A country is placed on the Least Developed Countries list based on its per capita income, economic vulnerability, and human development indicators such as health and nutrition.
ny: Dziko linaikidwa m'gulu la mayiko osauka kwambiri potengera ndalama zimene lili nazo pa munthu mmodzi, mmene zinthu zilili pa moyo wa munthu, ndiponso zimene anthu amachitira pa nkhani ya chitukuko cha anthu monga thanzi ndi zakudya.

en: Of the 48 least developed countries in the world, 34 are in Africa. Three countries have graduated from their least developed status: Botswana, Cape Verde and Samoa.
ny: Pa mayiko 48 osauka kwambiri padziko lonse, 34 ali ku Africa.

en: Strike Paralyzes Malawi's Judicial Services
ny: Ntchito Zokhudza Malamulo ku Malawi Zafika Pofooka

en: A week-long strike by the support staff of Malawi's judiciary system has paralyzed the courts, causing overcrowding in police cells and the indefinite suspension of major cases - including government corruption trials. Court marshals, clerks and messengers are demanding the 30 percent salary increases promised by the government two years ago.
ny: Kuchita ziwonetsero kwa milungu ingapo kwa ogwira ntchito m'boma la Malawi kwachititsa kuti makhoti azivutika kwambiri, zomwe zinachititsa kuti apolisi azidzadzaza kwambiri ndipo milandu ikuluikulu - kuphatikizapo milandu ya ziphuphu ya boma - iyenera kuyimitsidwa mpaka kalekale.

en: Chanting and singing around the court premises has become a pastime activity for the striking court workers since the onset of a sit-in last week.  Linley Hebert, a spokesperson for the striking workers, told VOA the strike is a result of the governments failure to honor a 2012 agreement.
ny: Kuimba ndi kuimba mozungulira nyumba za khoti kwakhala ntchito yosangalatsa kwa ogwira ntchito m'makhoti omwe akuyimira kuyambira pomwe msonkhanowu unayamba sabata yatha. Linley Hebert, mneneri wa ogwira ntchito omwe akuyimira, adauza Voice of America kuti ntchitoyi ndi chifukwa cha boma kulephera kulemekeza mgwirizano wa 2012.

en: "In October [this year], the government reviewed the salaries of the civil servants, but we were not included in that revision," Hebert said.
ny: Hebert anati: "Mu October [chaka chino], boma linafufuza malipiro a antchito a boma, koma ife sitinawerengedwe m'kaundulawo".

en: "Yet in 2012, we had an agreement that each time they are revising the salaries of the civil servants, [they will be increasing our salaries as well].
ny: "Komabe mu 2012, tinali ndi mgwirizano wakuti nthawi iliyonse akamaonetsetsa kuti malipiro a akuluakulu a boma akubwezeretsedwanso, [adzakulitsanso malipiro athu].
